Reviews.Title: “old school luxury”
Reviews.Author: CairoDouda
Reviews.Content: we had 4 rooms two of were imperial and they upgraded the other 2 to imperial also which was a nice touch . we asked for airport transportion which was on time with nice driver. the hotel is luxury old in a very good shap. i think they have to upgrad the bathroom amenities like the shower gel ...etc though in the room it's writin if you need to upgrad you will pay for that!!! also the free water they are two tiny small bottles !!! the two or three chocolates that they left in the room were not fresh at all also the chocolates that they offered with the coffee. little things but makes huge differance .mini bar should be with more choices of juices concierge all of them were great as well as the room service staff and the doormen very courteous. Rome is a great city with lot to see the hotel is in very good location wolking distance about 10 min to the core of the city the spanish steps . the open bus two min from the hotel we did the tour was great. don't miss the Vatican visit was an awesome visit better to have a guide we had one i think it was Euro 40 each for about 5 hours visit .

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful, great service, and freindly staff.”
Reviews.Author: LA-Backdoc
Reviews.Content: I was scouring TripAdvisor for ideas on places to stay in Rome and when I found this place I thought "I'd sure like to stay there!". It is normally quite expensive but I found it available on Starwood's discount site http://www.beatthetimer.com at a rate of 250 Euro/night. Beat The Timer is an SPG site that puts up sales on hotel prices for 48 hours, its really worth frequenting. The hotel is beautiful from the outside, but when you step inside, it is spectacular. The rooms are classically small European but appointed in authentic Italian Renaissance style. The check-in staff was very friendly and actually congratulated me on securing such a good rate for the room. I had read on TripAdvisor that the breakfast was very expensive and I can attest to that fact. Our breakfast buffet for 2 was 60 Euro. Would I stay here again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 68mark4
Reviews.Content: On e of the best hotels I've stayed in. Very attentive service. The rooms are breathtaking with gorgeous art and frescos. This was true luxury through Starwood program

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, yet cozy.”
Reviews.Author: PamWestchester
Reviews.Content: We spent close to two weeks in Italy, with our last stop being Rome. We had already stayed at the incredible Four Seasons Florence, so our expectations were high. We were not disappointed. The lobby is ample and beautiful. The hallways and rooms are elegant and beautiful. The concierge gave us some excellent recommendations for shopping and dining. The location is near some sights. We were able to secure an excellent per-paid rate, so we were not able to get free breakfast, but there were places nearby to get a simple meal. While I believe wifi should be free in five star hotels, we got it free through the Starwood program. All in all, it was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Spendy, a bit dank but good location”
Reviews.Author: BlueDevilTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days in rainy April, the AAA rate of €297 got us a nice sized room with a window looking over the courtyard, a shower that would not drain and a sink with corroded handles. Room service was wonderful as well as lobby bar service. The bartender from Costa Rica is excellent! Service was good and very private, the hotel is quite quiet. It was in a great location for walking to all of the major points of interest. Be sure to order your Vatican tickets online a head of time. We should have done this for the Colloseum, skip the guided tour and go on your own with the little recorded audio player.

Reviews.Title: “Right Choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hulagrub
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely superior hotel. Check-in was fantastic; room was spacious, comfortable and clean; service was impeccable; location had walk able distance from train station (Roma Termini) and Metropolitana access; and all Rome sites were accessible either by walking or simple public transportation. The hotel graciously accommodated our early check in request (which we realize was a bit of absolute luck) which really helped after the long flight. The breakfast was remarkable with fresh squeezed blood orange juice and an assortment of the finest meats, cheeses, pastries, fruit, cereals and breads you can imagine. It also included hot breakfast foods and a chef to make personalized omelets (try the cappuccino!). We didn't eat at the hotel except for breakfast primarily because we wanted to experience Rome, but when we looked over the menu it was a bit pricey (but not exorbitant for a 5 star). I think free Internet would have been a plus for the cost we paid for the room however you can use the very worn business center for a 1 Euro charge. If there was a downside to the hotel, this would be the only one I can possibly find. I would go back in a heartbeat as we enjoyed our stay. (9.7 on a scale of 10)

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort, great location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingpud
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at Easter and highly recommend the St Regis as a great base in Rome. Its situation near the Termini station means it is central for airport and port connections, and also for all public transport round Rome itself. However, it is also ideal for explorers on foot. There are many fascinating sights right on the doorstep, including the Diocletian Baths; a short stroll away is the Quirinale and 5 minutes further the Trevi area. The Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Colosseum, the Forum area....all the classics this side of the river are enjoyably walkable. When you return to the hotel, it is to a beautifully grand lobby, helpful staff and high quality rooms. Ours was the standard double but it was high ceilinged, elegant, well-sized and utterly spotless, including the bathroom. It was perfectly peaceful; looking out to the Piazza della Repubblica was a good view yet not noisy. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linen some of the best we've seen (we are well travelled and not easy to please about comfortable beds)! Breakfast is indeed expensive as others have said but there are many other places for that within close proximity (lovely deli / coffee shop straight across the road in a covered arcade). One niggle common among hotels: bottled water in the room - well done St Regis for providing any complimentary water at all (2 small bottles a day), but it is much more impressive to be left a couple of litre bottles and find them replaced morning and night...costs hotels next to nothing; but so appreciated by the thirsty sightseer! However, full marks secured for this hotel by the spot on approach to our late check out request on the last day (3pm instead of 12 noon) - a quick check by the front desk to see there were no guests checking in, and we were told we could check out when we wished, free of charge. So many hotels see this kind of request as a chance to make a few extra euros; yet gracious service such as this is just the sort of touch to bring guests back a second time. We certainly hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel with the most comfy bed and a luxurious shower and bath”
Reviews.Author: WM1980
Reviews.Content: We received the stay as a gift and really enjoyed it. The service was excellent - very friendly porters and receptionists - and the bed incomparable. The sheets, pillows and mattress felt so luxurious we wanted to stay in bed! The only minus is that breakfast was not included and for 40 EUR/pp we decided to have it in a nearby bar. Also Internet charges in the room was charged very high but was free in the lobby. Definitely would like to recommend this hotel as it's also closebh the termini train station which connects with the airport.

Reviews.Title: “real value for money?”
Reviews.Author: mannecker
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend 2 nights on a city break. The hotel is located not far away from the main train station ( meaning it is not the most scenic area in town). A taxi to the center would cost you max 10 euros but clealy it's a significant walk. The hotel is decorated " old style" with many luxious furnitures such as statues, etc. The stairs are quite immense, fully decorated again. Great service from reception to conciege. The room was furbisched again in an old style . Same for bathroom. Do not go to this hotel if you want modern, design rooms....It was clean, roomy but we had no view. The bed was really high quality and the overall place is very quiet. A great sleep for sure. The breakfast is a bit expensive ( circa 35 euros....) . Drinks as well ( 10 euros for a draft coke....). Conclusion, I have a mixed feeling as sure this is a great place to stay, very luxious place, very pro, not overcrowded, etc....but with some downside effects such as location, no real "fun" and pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service, but don't book a superior room”
Reviews.Author: dj n
Reviews.Content: After walking through the St. Regis Grand entrance lobby, my first impression is that this hotel is absolutely breathtaking. The pictures on the website do not do it justice. The location is also ideal (today we walked 10 min to the Trevi fountain, and 20 mins to the forum/Colosseum area). I booked a superior room after finding a great prepaid rate & reading all the glowing reviews online. I'm not sure if hotel room sizes are generally small in Rome, but after seeing the superior room, I was rather shocked to realize that I had just paid good money to sleep in a really nice shoe closet. The room pretty much fits a king size bed and nothing else. The hotel also surrounds some small alleyways, so you won't get much scenic views here. I'm sure the rest of the elite rooms in this hotel are outstanding... but if you're planning a stay here in a standard room, be prepared to temper your expectations considerably.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: averma001
Reviews.Content: I insisted on a room overlooking the Reppublica, which I received after an hour and a half wait. I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is in a great location with great amenities. The service staff can be a little elitist in the way that they treat you, which I found a bit off-putting at times. The noise from the street didn't bother me. The windows are pretty good at insulating the room. The housekeeping service was also a bit sloppy. I would come back to a room that wasn't necessarily cleaned, just "tidied up" with the bed made. I had to make several calls to have empty bottles, etc. to be taken away from the room. They had some "high-profile" political guests staying there while I was there, so perhaps they were distracted? Still no excuse. There was also a lot of security roaming the halls in civilian clothing which made me more nervous than anything. Regardless, the location, comfort and the amenities make me give this hotel 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: SMR3Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis in Rome in early February, and it was nothing short of spectacular! We arrived to the first snow in 20 years, so the city was in shut down mode, but not the St. Regis. We were whisked in out of the cold. and immediately checked in, they brought us piping hot cappuccinos and cookies while we waited for our rooms to be finalized. The service the entire stay was outstanding. The rooms are a really beautiful balance of old and new.The mural behind the bed was pretty special, and each one is unique, as we had a friend staying down the hall, and hers was different than ours. Chandeliers from room to room were also very special. Beds were excellent, bathrooms large and well-appointed. The Lobby is so grand you just will not believe it! We had an evening ritual of wine in the lobby after our long days trekking around the city, and honestly it was difficult to leave to go to dinner because it was just THAT beautiful. The concierge made some great dining recommendations. Target, as others have mentioned, is really fun and the food was terrific. The location, for us, was just great! We love walking, and felt like we could get around, even in the snow, really easily. Tip: We got tickets for the "on-off" tour bus and used it for two days to get around to some of the further away sites like Vatican City. Totally worth it, and a great way to learn about the different areas of the city. All in all, it was an amazing trip, and the St. Regis was a huge part of our falling in love with Rome. We will definitely be back to the St. Regis, and it won't be soon enough! Just writing about it makes me miss it.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxury Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom269
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with updated ameneties yet retaining its old-school charm. Certainly in the luxury niche, it has amazingly large rooms with surprisingly tall ceilings. Great central location, pleasant staff, and an impressive breakfast buffet. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Grand Hotel, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mfrom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the St Regis Rome for our honeymoon in February. The hotel is charming and beautiful, the rooms are spacious and clean. The street is a bit busy outside the hotel on all sides which made even our 4th floor room extremely noisy at night and we found it very difficult to sleep. The staff was welcoming and attentive, but we didn't feel we received the attention to detail that we receive at most other Starwood properties. The internet was expensive but I understand it is now free from some more current reviews. We questioned this and were not offered complimentary internet for SPG gold members. We were erroneously billed 60 Euro for breakfast on our last morning. We called the hotel 3 times since our return home and have been reassured each time that they will credit the charge. To this day we have not received a credit. Very disappointing for someone who prefers to stay at Starwood properties. We will consider the Hotel Eden the next visit to Rome, the hotel is in a quieter neighborhood and there is an SPG desk that may give better service to preferred guests.

Reviews.Title: “Romans Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Negin S
Reviews.Content: well...what can i say ? its truely the luxuriest hotel in Rome. Near to piazza republica and metro station. Quite suitable for an evening stroll in the streets around the hotel. and the hotel itself....very comfortable rooms and bathrooms,housekeeping both in day and night, a classic lobby but friendly at the same time. I really enjoyed having a cappuccino in the lobby every afternoon. I personally suggest this hotel if you are planning a relaxing luxury trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch!”
Reviews.Author: TravelteamCT
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, beautiful hotel. The wonderful lobby has so many niches and seating areas, you can be alone or with a group and still experience it as grand, especially with the pianist playing in the evenings. We had an inexpensive room and it was still amazing, with a king bed, a magnficent bathroom, and a charming window seat with shutter windows that opened to a quiet courtyard. Breakfast is pricey but totally worth it -- the omelet chef is a darling. The house butler, Monica, the doormen, and the concierges are all so welcoming and gracious. The concierge's recommendations for restaurants were spot-on for reasonable prices and authentic food. The hotel was nicely situated for walking to all the points on our itinerary. One comment: it would be nice if wi-fi access was free. I was happy to avoid work, but to access my email one day, I had to pay 15 euro or go to the business center area. Our friends in town at other hotels had free internet. Still, we had a perfect stay and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly Suggest This Hotel, Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WiseTravelingGeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis with 2 kids, and based on our past experiences in Europe, we thought that the rooms were going to be extremely small. Actually, our room was extremely large for a hotel in Rome, with a large King bed, and we were able to get another small bed for one child. The bathroom was awesome, with both a bathtub and a shower. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, and we always looked forward to going back to our hotel at night. We even got a welcoming gift of fresh fruit, and complimentary fruit and chocolate everyday. The room's AC worked perfectly, and we could control the temperature ourselves. Also, the hotel has an excellent location, in Republic Square, and all the taxi drivers knew how to get there. If you are willing to pay the expensive price, then it is absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmmmay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis on New Years Eve and a few days following that. I really enjoyed my time at the hotel. Staff: Perfect and very helpful. Provided very good recommendations for places to visit and where to eat. In addition, my boyfriend wanted to surprise me and the hotel kindly helped him arrange for rose petals on the bed, and balloons in the room. I was so surprised when I got into the room. I was initially super tired from the long flight, but seeing the room immediately put me back into good mood and was a very good start of my week long vacation in Italy. Location: Very conveniently located. It's only a 5 min walk from the train station, and about 15 min walk to the fountain and spanish steps. Short taxi ride away from most attractions. Room: Clean and well decorated. On the first night (new years eve), we got a room that overlooked the square, so we were able to see the fireworks from the windows in our room. We left Rome for a few days to travel to Florence, and when we returned, they upgraded us to a nice suite on the other side of the hotel. I didn't think that I would be able to stay in such a big hotel room in Europe. The walk in closet, and a very nice B&O TV was a bonus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: divaAthens
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a w/k in Rome together with 2 other couples ! While we searched most of the top end hotel in Rome we selected st Regis because the price offered was 30 p/ c cheaper than most of his competitors. We were positively surprised that the hotel was very nice our deluxe rooms very spacious wifi working excellent buffet breakfast and polite staff. Distance from our places of interest around Spanish steps was just a 10 min walk therefore it was worth it the money we saved from our accommodation. The overal opinion of all the couples we stayed was very positive

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Stay at the St. Regis, Rome”
Reviews.Author: solarpoweredmom
Reviews.Content: We absolutely fell in love with this hotel; in fact, though we've stayed at top-rated hotels throughout Europe and the US, this has become our very favorite. The St. Regis is grand and gorgeous; the elegant ballroom -- where we had a scrumptious breakfast each morning, and drinks at night -- is magnificent, with its opulent yet comfortable decor. The service could not be better; every member of the hotel staff is friendly, kind, and so helpful. Our room -- which was immediately upgraded without asking -- was gorgeous. The plush bed was very comfortable (and I'm tough, since I have chronic back problems) and the marble bathroom, with separate shower and bath, absolutely heavenly. We can't wait to find some reason to return to Rome because of the St. Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best!”
Reviews.Author: ConcettaAnn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Regis for 2 nights. Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted by every member of the staff in the lobby. I received an upgrade to a Deluxe room, free wifi and complimentary breakfast. Service was outstanding! Breakfast was amazing! I can't say enough about this hotel. My room had a great view of one of the piazzas. It was nicely decorating with paintings and had a beautiful chandelier. The bathroom was more than adequate - had a tub and a separate shower and marble counters and floors. Everything was elegant and tasteful. The common areas were relaxing and the fitness center was well-equipped. The location of the St Regis is also convenient to buses and trains - about a 5 minute walk to both. When I checked out, I requested a cab but they arranged a car service for me. I will absolutely stay here when I come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: jcjteeth
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four nights at this "palace" of a hotel. We were upgraded to a lovely suite that was decorated with original works of art, beautiful marble bathroom with a tub and standup shower! The only downside to the room was the unbearable heat from the furnace blowing non-stop. I spoke to the front desk clerk about it the next morning and he said it would be turned off and he was correct. Probably not the best location if you are going to be doing a lot of walking to the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, or Trevi Fountain...but very close to the train station and The Colosseum! By the second day, the bartender knew exactly what our group wanted to drink after a long day seeing the sights! Would stay here again, no question!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I am used to from St Regis”
Reviews.Author: Kate A
Reviews.Content: The St Regis in Rome is a very nice and upscale hotel, but the service was pretty lacking. The concierge desk especially was less than helpful. We told them specifically that we wanted to go to a nice restaurant that locals visit with a "scene". When we showed up to the restaurant at 9pm on a Saturday night, there was only one other table there besides us and it stayed that way for the rest of the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & Tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: dimitrisbAthens
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights, suite was very well equiped. even Bang& Olufsen TV, i phone docking station etc. Very classy decoration, service was five star, polite staff (not so common in Rome 5 star hotels). Great common areas, excellent breakfast. Finally, best location in old rome, within walking distance to everything. Found my permanent staying place when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “"Le Grand" is an appropriate name”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March 2012. Here are some factual observations: 1. The location for sightseeing is ok, but not ideal. Walking times: 5 min to the main train station, 15 min to Trevi Fountain, 15 min to Spanish Steps, 20 min to the Colosseum. However, there were always taxis available right in front when we needed them. 2. The room we were in was very big (by European standards) and was probably close to what I would expect in an American hotel. The room itself was incredibly decorated with a giant Murano glass chandelier. 3. Even though we were there in March, the room was very hot. We could open the windows to cool things down, but the front of the hotel is on a main road with sirens and traffic going by all night. This didn't bother us (since we could probably sleep through a nuclear bomb), but I could see this really bothering a light sleeper. 4. We had the hotel arrange for a sedan transfer to/from FCO, and everything went smoothly. When we arrived, the driver was waiting with a sign, and the return transfer went just as smoothly. 5. The service was very, very good (though not quite as good as a 5-star Asian hotel). The concierge made several dinner reservations for us without any problems. 6. The hotel is over the top grand, but not gaudy like some other Italian hotels I've stayed in. If the hotel weren't in Rome and surrounded by hundreds of incredible buildings, the hotel itself could almost be a tourist attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: NYJanet
Reviews.Content: This place was grand. I don't think I've ever used that word in a review before, but everything about this hotel is over the top. Lobby and Bar: The lobby was stunning and massive. The service was outstanding. My husband and I ordered cocktails at the bar...I'm still thinking about that Aperol Spritz...and along with our drinks came an assortment of nuts and olives. I love that. Why can't more places do that?! I was really disappointed to find out we were a half hour late to the champagne sabering, but our server actually offered to do it again for us. Even better, he let me saber the bottle with him! The staff really went out of their way to make our experience memorable. Room: Our room was like a museum; there were murals on the walls and framed artwork that looked like something from the Vatican, columns that separated the entry way from the room. The room itself was very spacious and clean, and the bed was by far the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in. The pillows...ahhh, the pillows. Divine. This hotel was a splurge, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-Stylish Grand Dame Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewLeeds
Reviews.Content: I had a four day visit to Rome in Mid-February, and had four wonderful days at this hotel. You have to appreciate (when booking) the sheer history of this building, and that every square inch of it may not be as ultra-pristine as say the George V in Paris, but, this is reflected in the fact that it's not E800/night like the Cinq!!!! When I walked into the Main Lobby with sunken marble floor, it reminded me of the Ritz in London, therefore low and behold I later learnt that it was in fact Ceszar Ritz that originally designed the commissioned build of the Hotel in the late 1800's, so this came as no great surprise. The service in the hotel is amazing, and the staff have a genuine warm sincerity which lacks in some 5*Deluxe establishments, unless you are a celeb of course!!!! The rooms were typically in-keeping with what you would expect from a Grand Dame Hotel, and all 5*Deluxe "in-room" amenities as standard. The concierge Staff bent over backwards to help with Restaurant bookings, Opera Tickets, Transport etc., and housekeeping responded like lightening to urgent Laundry and pressing requests. Our Room typically "Gold and Red Romanesque/Empire" decorated was beautiful and immaculately "shabby chic", and looked onto some neo-classical side buildings, which on a night were illuminated and added a romantic feel to the room. The bar is very attractive, and whilst the drinks/food are expensive, they are no dearer than neighboring top-flight Bars, clubs and Restaurants. My general overview is that this hotel represents excellent value, is highly respected in Rome as being one of "thee" addresses, (whilst we were in the Bar we overheard a Royal Ambassadors' Representative planning an event), and its locality to exclusive V.Veneto is very central to everything that happening. If this Hotel always bore the "Crown", its certainly not slipped yet!!! A lovely experience and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while roaming around Rome taking in the sights. The staff couldn't have been friendlier and the service exceptional. The hotel is beautiful and our room was perfectly kept. It was a pleasure waking up each morning and returning at night knowing we were headed for comfort. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We immeditaly checked out and found another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Julian L
Reviews.Content: I normally don't take the time to write reviews on Tripadvisor but I frequent the site and should have used it during this trip to Rome. Unfortunately my wife was set on staying at the St. Regis so I disregarded the low rating on Tripadvisor and booked our stay. In short, the hotel was once a grand hotel but has since seen it's prime. The rooms were large but old. The service was non-existant and everything you touch cost double of what you would pay on the street, this is what I like to call movie theater pricing. Our bad experience started when we checked in. The desk told me that it would be an additional $100 euro per night because I reserved as a single occupancy and was with my wife. I fully understand that this is a policy and the guy at the desk couldn't really do anything about it but I've travelled all over the world and have never had to pay extra for when my wife travels with me. It's not like they are providing any additional service (or any service at all). We couldn't just walk out so we went to the room and immediatly started looking for another room. Luckily for me there were rooms available at the Albergo Del Senato (the second best hotel in Rome as per Tripadvisor at the time of this review). We immediatley reserved those rooms and checked out of the St. Regis. Some other points to note: 1. the new hotel was twice as nice, better location and half the price; 2. the St. Regis charged for everything including $25 for internet service, the new hotel was free; 3. The location of the St. Regis is not so nice, you are near the train station and it feels very industrial; 4. Price: I know I said this but even with the "special" rate that the St. Regis was giving me the new hotel was less than half of the price. We paid over $500 for one night at the St. Regis (with taxes and internet charges) and only $230 per night at the Albergo del Senato with free internet and amazing service. I did recieve an email from one of the managers after my stay where he appologized and referred to their pricing policy. My response to that is that I really don't care about your policy. If you have an inferior product at an unreasonable price you will not remain in business.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a complete renovation”
Reviews.Author: kate0614
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the St. Regis, thanks to the lovely staff and decent accommodations. However, I'm sorry to say that overall, this hotel is not worthy of the St. Regis brand. They should downgrade it to a Sheraton or something until they can renovate. Now for the good and the bad... The good: the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating, as you would expect. Great bartenders who actually know how to make a good cocktail. We were welcomed warmly by the bellmen and front desk staff, who were all lovely. The concierge was very sweet and helpful and generally quite knowledgeable, although we noticed they are not a great authority on restaurants (told us a fish restaurant was for meat and pasta, not fish, and also that it was closed on Sunday, when in fact it is one of the few restaurants open on Sunday). The property is fairly grand, and you can tell it was once a very fine hotel. The not-so-good: I experienced two small glitches in the service. First, on the morning we checked in, I was told I could relax in the lobby while my room was being prepared. No problem: I went and settled down in the lobby restaurant to have some breakfast and check my email while I waited. I found I couldn't sign on to the internet because I had not yet been assigned a room number, but when I approached the hostess, she was not helpful and told me I had to speak to the front desk. This was awkward since I had just sat down to eat and had sort of settled down at my table with my things. I had to abandon my belongings at the table and go over to the front desk, where they kindly gave me a card with a code that I could use to sign on. It wasn't a big deal, but not really something that should happen at a St. Regis. The hostess should have given me a card or sent someone to get one from the front desk. They were not at all busy, so there is no reason someone could not have helped with this. The second issue was the housekeeping staff. While they did an adequate job cleaning, there was no attention to detail. They cleaned and replaced the towels and made the bed, but didn't retie the robes, organize our toiletries, or straighten up the room much -- it seemed like they kind of just blew through. They left water and fruit for us on the first day, but not after that. Very inconsistent. The bad(ish): The hotel has really seen better days. Nothing about this hotel gleams, and the furnishings in the lobby are really quite worn and faded. The paint on the walls is scuffed and chipped in places, the carpet looks old and kind of dingy, etc. The hotel is just badly in need of a complete renovation. We also found the bed to be not very comfortable. Having stayed at other St. Regis properties and been suitably impressed, I found this one to be quite a contrast. If you are expecting a typical modern luxury hotel, I recommend you adjust your expectations. This property may have met that description many years ago, but it does not today. While I truly had a wonderful trip and appreciate the kind staff at the St. Regis, I probably would not go back until they renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jungonzales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last January of 2012 and I have nothing to say but all praises. Location is just perfect and very lovely location just beside Repubblica. Hotel staffs are all very professional and friendly. They are very helpful to all my needs and inquiries. A very classy hotel and I felt privileged staying at this hotel. It's a great experience staying at this hotel. Room service is pretty quick. Service is an A+. Very peaceful surrounding area. I like their turndown service which is very common at some 5-star hotels. Lots of taxis outside the hotel waiting if you prefer using taxi rather than train or bus. And Termini, which is the main public transport station, is just two blocks away. I'll definitely stay at this hotel again when I come back to Rome again. Such a very relaxing experience staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY HOSPITABLE”
Reviews.Author: silkroad91
Reviews.Content: Service is always perfect - rooms are nice, classic style, often with little free amenities (chocolates, fruits, water) a bit "oldish" but good quality - overall value for money - I have become frequent and satisfied customer - not extremely fancy but hospitable -Christmas decorations make it a very cozy place.Restaurants are good. I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Still Grand”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: Second stay after 10 years. First time had a HUGE room, that left an extremely favorable impression. This time, had, what I believe to be the smallest room in the hotel with construction ongoing in the hotel, right next door. (To be fair, I was paying a discounted rate). Even a small room does not hide the grandeur of the hotel. Old world elegance throughout and old world service and ambience. If you stay, be sure to secure a better room, as your experience will be enhanced and you will appreciate the hotel much more. Good location for sight -seeing with the metro within walking distance, and you can even walk to the train station, if you so desire. This is a good selection for Rome, as it is befitting the style of the city, in it's old world charms. I'd go for a third go around, if in Rome again, but only with an upper end room!

Reviews.Title: “Excelled beyond all expectations”
Reviews.Author: HPopplewell
Reviews.Content: I am not one to make gushing comments, actually have never commented on any of my trips or hotel stays (and there have been many) however feel compelled to after recently staying at the St.Regis Rome. I booked to stay there to celebrate my birthday and from the moment I arrived the customer service and attention to detail was outstanding. We were shown to our room by the person who checked us in. The room was spacious and well appointed. All furnishings were in a typical Roman decor however with modern amenities. The room was clean, comfortable and the bed was one of the best I have slept in away from my own. The hotel itself is grand but personal and the location was ideal to reach all the sights and the nearby metro. Our room was off the street and we could have been in the middle of the country as there was no noise pollution. Aside from being a first class hotel the generosity of the hotel was humbling. I recieved a silver trinket for a birthday present, a delicous cake and a bottle of premium champagne. The hotel staff also assisted me with where to dine in the evening, the place they booked me into was not in any of the guide books but it was an amazing restaurant that only the locals would know with first class dining and at a very reasonable price. Overall this hotel and its staff made my trip from being a lovely one to a truely outstanding memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: nadellsell
Reviews.Content: For New Years and my birthday my husband surprised me with a trip to Rome. We stayed at the St. Regis. This grand old hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of shopping, bistros and many of the sights. Even better it is just a very short walk to the metro from which you can get everywhere. Our room was a lovely suite. The Butler service was wonderful and prompt. We had one hiccup with the service. Dissapointingly, our room was not made up when we returned from a day of sightseeing. With a call to management they promptly more than made up for it. We enjoyed complimentary champagne while we waited for the room to be made up. When we went back to the room which was now impeccably made up, they sent up a lovely gift basket and they offered a complimentary brunch as well. The next day was my birthday and they delivered a scrumptious cake and a lovely sterling silver key chain as a gift. Thank you Vincenzo Falcone Resident Manager for making our stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: wharthog521
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis Rome over new year's and had a great time. Yes, the hotel is a little off the beaten path but we didn't think it was prohibitively out of the way. Staff was very accomodating, hotel is pretty cool. Rooms on the street are a little loud but rooms are nice. Gym is pretty nice - the little old-school elevator is a nice touch. Overall I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: UncleGeno
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here on a Tauck tour this past summer. You walk into this hotel and are greeted by this beautiful lobby that you walk through into a huge ballroom/ restaurant. It is grand and the detail in the architecture and decorating is perfect. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready so we sat in this beautiful grand ballroom and tried to relax after our overnight trip from New Jersey. We requested something to drink was surprised when they brought out drinks and snacks for the group (no charge). Our room was spacious and spotless clean, the bathroom was also a nice size and spotless. (I am a fanatic about clean rooms when I travel) We ate breakfast everyday and had one dinner in the restaurant, food and service was very good. The only thing that I found annoying was paying for WiFi, I think that should be complimentary in any hotel but a minor note. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb St. Regis Rome”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis in Rome in October and it was truly a delight. They upgraded our room to a fabulous suite that was beautifully appointed. The butler service was wonderful. We had the concierge book our tours for us and they were all fabulous with the exception of one tour. We had asked for an english speaking tour guide for the Vatican and the guides english was very broken. When we informed the hotel, they gave me 1/2 of my mine back which was completely unexpected. The lobby in the hotel is gorgeous and the staff was always friendly. We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA_Bank
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and comfortable hotel. The service level for this country is above average, not perfect but good. Minor service issues were experienced but mostly on Sunday. Everything is dead on Sunday at this hotel. Room was not cleaned and most of the requests were not answered. The hotel is maintained nicely but needs some work and updating. The butler services are a hit or miss. The days when Johnny was there its perfect when not, you not going to get anything done. The showers are very small as well as the bathrooms. Room Service is fast and the quality of food is excellent! SPG Platinum was honored with an upgrade a nice amenity. Met with the Manager when wanted to change the room, which is very nice and polite but couldn’t solve the problem and never followed up as far as the liability on the next day. Considering that Rome's hotels are genially old, this is a good choice in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “below expectations:(”
Reviews.Author: bogdanovaolga
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very beautiful and luxury. I think it was very high level hotel before but now. The building and service on the same level, but the rest - all these small things that make you feel comfortable were not good, starting from slippers, towels, bathrobes and bath details to the food quality. We didnt want to go for the breakfast there for the second time, and didnt order any food or even coffee, didnt stay in the hotel too long. The staff is excellent, but the quality and level of the hotel itself is going down unfortunately. It didnt cost that money.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Holiday at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler7740
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis offered everything we had hoped, and more, for our family trip to Rome during the holiday break. We had an Imperial Room, which was more than generous enough to handle two roll aways for our twins, and gorgeous! When walking around the Spanish Steps, my son mentioned that he was glad the hotel wasn’t in that location, saying “It is too touristy here - I think our hotel gives us a better feel for being in Rome.” Yet, it is only a five minute walk from the Steps, and from the Trevi Fountain, and 10-15 minutes from just about everything else. There was a terrific kids room set up, with wii, play station, movies and snacks. Good for decompressing after a day seeing the sights. The New Year's Eve celebration was an extravaganza of food, music, glamour and fun. Terrific way to ring in 2012! Everything about the hotel makes it worthy of its 5 stars. The beauty, the staff, the breakfast buffet, the service, the location, the rooms… Would definitely return the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGoddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in Rome over Christmas and being at the St. Regis, Rome was a special part of it. We used Starwood points had connecting rooms (family of 4 with 2 teenage daughters) and while ours was a larger suite, they were both beautiful and very special. I had brought Christmas decor but it was almost superfluous as the rooms were so pretty! Rooms were also very quiet - never heard road or hallway noice. We were particularly satisfied with the concierge service - especially Pasquale who went above and beyond for us. It was my daughters birthday on the 26th and they sent a cake up. All the staff were lovely! It was also a very nice location - not on too busy of a street, but either good walking distance or short cab rides to many sites. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more as the hotel delivered less... Could have been better! Shine your own shoes!”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: As a SPG Platinum member, I stay with Starwood properties alot during the year. Let's say that my expectations were as if I were a Roman Commander coming back from a victorious battle where the streets are lined up with people and the trumpets blaring. We stayed for 5 nights using points. Check in - Went smoothly. We were given hot tea and snacks as we waited for our room. However, we were not upgraded as we normally are at our SPG stays. Room - While we weren't upgraded, the room was fabulous. Both of our mouths dropped in awe as this is one of the best rooms we stayed in. It felt luxurious because it was. Wifi wasn't a problem although we had to keep reconnecting our machines from time to time. -1 star for lack of upgrade Service - I asked for my shoes to be shined which is normal for all St Regis properties. They gave me a brush and cloth and hinted that I had to do it myself. And this is coming from a 5 star hotel? -1 star for having me shine my own shoes Concierge - was very helpful in giving us directions to where we wanted to go and confirming our reservations with us. However, do not use the hotel services to the airport. We were able to get a Mercedes through the TA forums for ALOT cheaper than their suggested rate. Gym - could have been better, but it is clean. Location - there's not much around in the area, but the subway is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We were able to do some walking to places. Money saving tip!!! - Free Water and Sports Drinks from the gym. Stock up here so that you don't have to go to the local store to buy. Overall, it's a superb hotel but the service could have been better. Why on earth would you have me shine my own shoes is beyond me? I'm not sure that I would pay the prices listed for this hotel or return for that matter. As a SPG Platinum member, I did not feel anything special as I normally would feel at other SPG hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnice106
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here while touring Rome prior to boarding the Seabourn ODYSSEY. We were originally shown to a Jr. Suite on the ground floor with a view of a noisy water pump system located just outside the window, which was unacceptable. We were then moved to a beautiful second floor full suite where we enjoyed this magnificent hotel and it's wonderful staff, including our butler, who brought our morning coffee. We had upgraded to an internet/breakfast package prior to arriving. The buffett breakfasts were terrific but charging for internet is so-o-o nickel and dime! I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and I didn't expect much as I've heard hotels in italy (or europe for that matter) are very small. We arrived at the st regis and was blown away by the christmas decor and interiors of the lobby. However, the check in desk service was not up to par. He didn't seem like he wanted to be there.. but we just looked past that. The room was very spacious and roman - no complaints. Room service was not bad - it was inconsistant at times throughout our 6 nights there. i guess i do expect alot from a luxury hotel that claims their service as a top priority. For the money paid, I probably would not go back there but was good to have experienced it this time round.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, beautiful and pricey--truly 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: JasonfromTacoma
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis was a wonderful oasis for myself, wife, 3 yo and 10 month old after a day of exploring Rome. We stayed for 10 nights. (Dec 2 to 12th). The service was impeccable and friendly. The hotel is gorgeous and quiet and the beds are heavenly. It is pricey. A 250ml bottle of diet coke was 10€! But this is truly a 5 star hotel. One minor quirk is the shower door had a one inch gap and would not close all the way and so the floor got a little wetter than normal. I reported it once by phone and once by "e-butler" with no response. Not a big deal, just odd. Overall, loved the hotel, service, food, & housekeeping. I thought it had a good location--easy walks to metro, termini and park. It is surrounded by 4 gorgeous churches and has a Bernini across the street (St. Theresa in Ecstacy). The Hard Rock Cafe was two blocks away and satisfied my craving for some American food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: Mnobles
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very nice. The hotel itself is beautiful, clean, and in a great location. The staff is very helpful. They were always willing to provide any service needed and met every request. The concierge was very helpful recommending restaurants regardless of what we were craving. Our room was beautifully decorated and average size. The bathroom was very big for European standards. Excellent water pressure. Great place. I would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - very helpful staff. Pure class.”
Reviews.Author: thewizeone
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this very impressive hotel attending a conference. It has a very memorable lobby and bar area with exquisite furniture. I eat breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurant – the food was very good, as you would expect in a hotel of this type. My room was spectacular (on the third floor) with a mural on the wall behind the bed and a couple of wonderful paintings on the walls. You really knew you were in Rome! It had a very personal and unique feel – which is rare in a large hotel. The service was very good and the staff friendly. I think what stood out the most was the wonderful smiles that greeted you whenever you approached anyone. The staff were happy and seemed glad to help. The wifi was even good - which is often a problem in older hotels. I will definitely go back with my fiancé for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the hotel before embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. Everything was perfect - staff nice and knowledgeable, location very convenient to all the sites, luxurious bed, and spotless room with large bathroom. At check-in, I mentioned that we were celebrating a big wedding anniversary, and the staff upgraded our room for free and send up a complimentary bottle of champagne. The only downside to the hotel is the price. We stayed using points, and it was 25,000 for the one night - worth it for us but may not be for others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St. Regis in Rome! Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: shooflyfarm
Reviews.Content: I had Stayed with my husband in this Regis a few years back for one day only. I kept remembering it as one of the nicest hotels I had ever stayed in. When I decided to take a spur of the moment trip to Rome last week with my 2 children (ages 11 and 12) I was quickly reminded of why I had such a nice memory, The only thing that was off was the size of the entrance. For some reason I had a grand circular drop off in my mind. In fact it was a very small, just enough space for a small car to enter and circle around. The location is very good. There are other nice hotels (Westin) that I think have a little better location because where the Regis is, it's a little tight. The small one way street makes it feel closed in. The Regis is walking distance to everything. The staff greeted us in an over the top, glad to have you type fashion. We were upgraded to an imperial room as platinum members which was large, very pretty, very elegant, large windowed space with all the amenities. The view was a courtyard view but we wanted quietness to get over our jet lag. Views might be limited there. Not sure about that. The products (Remede, my favorite) are the same as in New York and Atlanta. The showers are fantastic! The bath is small, typical of europe. The best thing about the room was the bed. MUCH better than NYC Regis. We had a little trouble with the television and within 15 min, he had it fixed. Service was the best! Nothing to complain about, and I'm picky! If I had to write anything that I didn't find outstanding, it would have to be not having a traditional restaurant to go to. The eating space was in the grand room just after the reception. It's a lobby type room with tables around and massive ceilings. Not a specific room to eat in. This hotel is wonderful but expensive. 3 hot chocolates one night before bed, 45 euro. Not complaining, we had the best darn hot chocolates that side of the pond. I recommend this hotel to all. We stayed at the Westin Excelsior also to see what it was like. It was very nice as well. Both had it's qualities. The Regis is the better hotel, the Westin had the better open location. They were only a couple of blocks apart. Go to the Regis, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SpinDoctor18
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the St. Regis Rome. Overall our stay was very good. Location was good, not great. 25 min walk to Colosseum. Metro is 2 minute walk and gets you around pretty well. Customer service at this hotel is excellent. Bell-hops are courteous and prompt to help out. Check in was easy also. Our room very large. Imperial room I think which was great because we traveled with an 11 month old and it gave her lots of room to crawl around. The decor in the room very similar to the website pics. Not modern, but Roman decor. Our room faced the main street outside and when window was close it was very quiet. The rooms seem very soundproof as we did not here anything next door or in the halls all trip. The one complaint is I think this hotel turns off the AC in the fall sometime and our room did not have it. When it got hot at all in the room we had to open the window to outside. Kind of annoying. Bathroom was spacious also. Only complaint was that the shower door did not close properly so water leaked on floor when shower was on. Its a 5 star hotel so Food and Beverage are not cheap but goes with the territory. We would return at the right price

Reviews.Title: “Five starrish, but lacked something”
Reviews.Author: kkwek01
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood Platinum member, I am comparing this with similar hotels in other cities. Overall it was a good enough experience... you walk in and there is a nice lobby, versus the myriad small tiny desks they would call 'Reception' in Rome, including many '4 star' hotels. We arrived early and they were kind enough to provide an early check in (thanks Angelo!), and while waiting in the lounge area a waiter from breakfast area came over to offer coffee and juice on the house- that I call classy. Rooms- I was given a 'junior suite' and while smallish, had all the trappings- B&O tv in room, Bose sound dock in sitting area, nicely and classically decorated- a great way to start the Rome vibe on your first day in Rome. Bathroom facilities and provisions were high quality. Gym- enough for a 'vacation workout' and free isotonics provided. Internal area- very classy and old school and I recommend you walk around, walk down the main stairway, use the old school lifts, observe the furniture and different names of rooms. Location, metro just around the corner and less than ten minutes to Termini so no complaints, with at least one decent and friendly Italian restaurant very near the hotel ('Target'). My only gripe would be having to ask twice and still nobody came to get the Bose to work on day one, and despite eventually getting it to work on day two, no one apologized for the lapse.... An example of the lack of touch general feeling I got. Another being a rather impersonal (albeit effective) concierge assistance on Rome eats. All in all, I did enjoy the stay though, just can't say it's super outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, people a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: TheLing
Reviews.Content: The building is spectacular and common areas too. It is a treat to stroll around the property , each and every corner is well designed and truly elegant. I stayed there three times and only once I had a n unsatisfactory room because of its size, not because of its decor. The restaurant and the hall is the most beautiful I recall, it is a Grand hotel in Rome, the immortal. I would recommend to the staff to be a little more warm in their behaviour, it seems that customers are transparent, sometimes it doesn't appear they see them. Obviously Rome is not Hong Kong or Bangkok where service is everything but maybe management should remind everybody to be gentle and welcoming to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel....but stop nickle and diming!!!”
Reviews.Author: UKUSTRIPS
Reviews.Content: You are a 5 star hotel. you have amazing rooms, facilities, location. So why on earth would you make people paying $500 a night go to the biz center to get a code everytime they want 24hrs of internet access? Are you insane? Charging for internet is stupid, bake that in to cost of room. Make it simple. Its about being top notch. It kind os spoils everything else you have going for you. We had an amazing stay but th einternet thing is just stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: Excellent old-school grand hotel. The interior is beautiful in every regard. Our standard room was very small. The price was too high. Value for money was not right - I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and well situated”
Reviews.Author: michellebarrett
Reviews.Content: This is a grand, historic hotel. It's in a very good location near the Termini as well as within walking distance to many of the main tourist attractions. The service was excellent. We received a room upgrade at check in and a complimentary bottle of wine sent to our room. The only downside is that the rooms facing Via Orlando suffer from some noise as it's a busy road. However, the grand scale of the hotel and lovely service make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: NRT
Reviews.Content: All things considered, I was satisfied with our stay at the St. Regis. The common areas of the hotel are amazing - absolutely beautiful. Each night of our stay we made a point of having a glass of wine in the lobby bar just to soak up the ambience. We had a basic double room, which was ok - it was luxuriously furnished, but somewhat on the small side and could probably use some updating (but was still quite nice). The service was a bit of a mixed bag - the front desk staff were pleasant and professional, while the service in the lobby bar was indifferent at best. The room service was great. They seemed happy to serve us and were very fast and efficient. The hotel is located in sort of a commercial area that is not especially charming, but not bad. At least it's relatively close to all of the major sites (we walked pretty much everywhere). The next time we go back to Rome, I think I would look for a hotel in the more historic part of town (eg, the area around the Piazza Navona), which is where we spent most of our time. Overall, I think that the St. Regis is a good choice if you want a sort of old-school luxury hotel and you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: PAG224
Reviews.Content: We loved the St. Regis in Rome. Walking into the lobby, it is immediately spectacular. We loved the fresco painted behind the bed. Our suite had a lovely sitting area. We truly felt like we were in Rome being in our hotel. Breakfast was amazing. My husband could have spent hours eating at the hotel every day. I guess that's part of traveling to Italy. Please note that this hotel is a bit far from most of the tourist destinations in Rome. We did not mind the walk, but the area does get very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “As put by another reviewer… Rome has a Ritz and it's the St Regis Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Marble_Trek
Reviews.Content: As put by another reviewer… Rome has a Ritz and it's the St Regis Grand Hotel. I have stayed a a lot of hotels in the world and this is one of the best I've stayed at so far. This is a true 5-star hotel with the level of detail to hospitality and service expected from a 5-star hotel. Check in was flawless and when I asked about breakfast and found that it was not free with our rate. I then asked if there was a discount due to my Starwood status. They explained that they would apply a 50% discount on the breakfast buffet so we would only pay 25 euro a piece which was well worth it. We were upgraded to beautiful suite overlooking the front of the hotel. Amazing amenities and furnishings. The room included a Bose SoundDock for your iPod. Another stereo for those with CDs. A well stocked mini bar. The bedroom had a Bang & Olufsen LED with a matching pedestal that rotated to face you when you turned the TV on. The bathroom had a separate shower and bathtub and my wife's favorite… a walk-in closet. All this plus there was a complimentary fruit plate and water waiting in our room. We used the stairs in the hotel because they were so beautiful and you would miss them if you took the lift. The buffet breakfast included champagne and omelets made to order along with everything else you might want. The concierge was very helpful with all our needs. Summary: - Very beautiful historic grand hotel completely renovated - Outstanding customer service that fits it's 5-star rating - Location was fine for us (we could walk to much or take the metro to more distant locations) - Oasis within Rome (we enjoyed returning to our room after a day in Rome) This will be the only hotel we will use when we stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: addendum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The St. Regis Rome for 5 nights in September. Upgraded to a beautiful suite with an amazing bathroom due to Platinum SPG. The entire staff was warm and gracious. Breakfast, while expensive, was great and gave us the energy to power through long days exploring Rome. This is a historic grand hotel, and while maybe not as gleamming as a St. Regis in the USA, it would still be my #1 choice for a return trip to Rome. My only complaint was the absence of an ironing board / iron in the rooms due to "fire hazzard" come on that is just BS!!! International travelers need to press a few things and do not want to spend 100 euros to pres a couple items - please remedy this!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: daveinchicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just concluded a 3 night stay at the St. Regis Rome. The location was excellent - near the Rome Termini (train station) and Republica (subway station). The room was magnificent and ornately decorated. Our biggest complaint had to be the noise from the Orlando street below. There was excessive noise throughout the day (primarily during the morning and evening rushes). If you're looking for a QUIET stay in Rome, this isn't the property for you. Unlike a previous reviewer, we were VERY pleased with the bellhop staff and doormen. We witnessed them opening doors for guests and hailing taxis on a rainy day. The concierge was helpful although their answers were somewhat inconsistent. The manager with whom I corresponded prior to our stay greeted us upon arrival and remembered my name throughout the stay... a nice touch. All in all, the hotel was a solid 4.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing-Very Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: tippd
Reviews.Content: Having monitored the reviews on trip advisor and appreciating the St Regis brand, we were looking forward to staying at the St Regis Rome. Unfortunately we were quite let down. The property itself is beautiful and the location excellent. We enjoyed how easy it was to walk to the termini or to the Trevi fountain or Spanish steps. Our disappointment is with the inconsistency of the service and facilities. The check in staff were fine but the concierge and porters were surly at best. They certainly don't go out of their way to assist and even getting them to crack a smile is a challenge. As for the rooms, the hotel does not provide irons or tea and coffee making facilities (claiming this to be a fire hazard). I can handle this however they still sell smoking rooms, so it's a bit of a contradiction. They provide a pressing service, however the pricing is exorbitant and inconvenient. There was no offer from any staff to provide tea or coffee in the mornings and the room service menu did not have a provision for tea or coffee without ordering a full breakfast. We did call room service for coffee and this was provided free of charge, but this was not volunteered information. Internet charges were 15 euro per device, per day and breakfast was a whopping 32euro per person for continental. The housekeeping was mediocre, where used glasses in the bathroom were never washed for our entire stay and used room service plates sat on furniture in the corridors for a couple of days. I can understand people loving this hotel because of it's grandeur and history, but it didn't hit the mark for us. My guess is that it is mis-managed and staff are not trained as well as they should be. Our impression is that management don't really care, which is evidenced by the lack of management responses on trip adivsor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: glenridge
Reviews.Content: We booked on points and were not disappointed at this top end hotel. Train station within walking distance. Most of the major sites in Rome within walking distance. Metro station very close. Shopping and dining very close. Great base to explore Roma and lovely sanctuary at the end of a long day out. Very luxurious, very clean and the most attentive staff. We loved our suite. Very quiet all day and night. Great bed and washroom. You have to pay for Internet ... that always bugs me. Stay here if you can afford it, or use your points for this place. We booked nearly a year in advance. Historic classic luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall, Poor Check-in and front desk staff...”
Reviews.Author: vg247
Reviews.Content: Stayed in junior suite..concierge, bellman, butler staff all top notch. Except, one encounter with concierge was poor as I found out he gave totally wrong advice on taxi rates,etc. Hotel is close to Republica metro. Only complaint was at checkin during mid day, there was no one at front desk for 20mins to help us and we were the only ones there..when the "unwelcoming-arrogant" agent came about to check us in, he just handed us a room key. We've stayed at many St Regis prior and they always discuss hotel services and amenities..in this stay nothing was mentioned. We happen to be familiar with the hotels and their services available to guests so didnt fuss about it, however, if someone was new to St Regis this may have been inappropriate. In addition, on another occasion we came to exchange some money mid day at the front desk and the agent was very impersonal and almost grumpy in demeanor...quite poor etiquette at such a hotel. Other than these front desk experiences- hotel is top notch on par with other hotels in this category. ..Most memorable experience- spouse loved some sweets that came in room and had finished them, maid service had a box packaged in gift wrap left for her next day..wish we knew who was responsible for such a thought to thank them personally..

Reviews.Title: “The St Regis Rome's motto of "a destination in itself" is spot on.”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioprincess
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks of consistently great hotels throughout Italy, it was wonderful to be overawed by the St Regis Rome experience. It surpassed our expectations in every way, from the check-in with Cecilia, to the delight of entering our magnificent top floor room, to the impeccable service offered by concierge Manuel. Every minute spent in the public areas was fantastic, from the breakfast buffet (unfortunately not included in the room price) to the casual all-day dining in the bar area, and the formal restaurant was also very good. Staff were all of the very highest calibre, epitomising a perfect blend of friendliness and professionalism that never strayed into being snobby. We just loved the hotel, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: A Wow! Friendly staff. Nice size room. Elegant, historic setting.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Notch Choice”
Reviews.Author: Colocav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on a business excursion/meeting. It is everything you would expect from a St. Regis property - beautiful property, rooms and excellent service. We found the location to be very good in terms of being able to walk to many sights, but we like to walk. While we walked to the Vatican on one of our jaunts, some would probably prefer a 20 - 25 Euro taxi. The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Borghese Museums are all easily walkable (make sure you get your ticket days in advance for the Borghese Gallery). For a fun, late evening, people watching experience, make the walk just past the American Embassy to the famous Harry's Bar for a cocktail (make sure you sit outside).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Stephany L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Manfredi on the first two nights of our trip. It was amazing. We booked the St-Regis on our last night thinking we would indulge in more luxury. It was awful! Such a disappointment! Our room was old and we felt we were pushed in a corner of the hotel. We called guest services a few times (additional towels and a blow dryer). It took a few times to get through by phone and it took over 30 minutes to bring what we needed. The blow dryer was pretty sad looking with hair still in it. I guess my expectation of a five star hotel is great services and a nice rooms. We also didn't like the area as much. It is further from the nice areas and very busy with traffic. I wouldn't stay there again or recommend it to anyone. At $600 per night, I was hoping for a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service; Good location”
Reviews.Author: BoltZone
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood points for 3 nights while in Rome. My wife and I found it very centrally located being one block from the Republica Metro stop and two blocks from the main train station at Termini. Even so, we walked almost everywhere, taking a cab only once our first night to the Pantheon area (we walked back). The key to this hotel was the service. We used the concierge often and they always came through, from recommendations for restaraunts, to getting our train tickets for the trip to Florence. In addition, the front desk staff was fantastic. We did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on that. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Luxurious - Roman Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, and each time this hotel ranks among my favorite anywhere. It has an old-world charm that is hard to beat, but has enough upgraded modern amenities to keep it competitive with newer properties. As you enter the hotel, the first thing you notice it the lobby - gorgeous and elegant. It is easy to imagine ladies and gentlemen at the turn of the century sipping tea, or enjoying a beverage in this breathtaking area. The old caged elevator to the rooms adds to the charm. In the evening a wonderful piano player plays at the bar. My wife requested a song which he did not know. Our waiter looked it up on his cell phone, played it for the piano player, who then played the song perfectly -- what a treat. The food in the lobby restaurant is outstanding. Our trip lasted ten days, so we ate there on two occasions. The pasta carbonara is the best I have ever eaten. The service was superb. We also went to the spa which is Asian style and provided outstanding massages for both my wife and myself. Would highly recommend this hotel. It is a convenient base to see the City from.

Reviews.Title: “The definition of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Traveler138KR
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this location having stayed at the Westin in Rome several times, we wanted to give the St Regis a try. While the location was not bad, its not as good as say the Westin. Thats about the only negative thing we can say. The room was off the charts (we were upgraded to a large suite, including two bathrooms and of course butler service!). The bed was a very comfortable king. The marble work in the bath and entry hall was stunning. The bar was also quite nice as were the staff. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bragghouse
Reviews.Content: Used points to enjoy 5 nights in Rome. The location was great for us as we were happy to utilize the bus, metro and taxis as needed. We were very appreciative of the welcoming fruit and Prosecco and the very quiet internal room on the 4th floor (per our request). A very comfortable bed. The only issue we experienced was somewhat uneven housekeeping service, but each time we called the issues were resolved quickly. My husband reported several issues with the bathroom and the response/apology from management could not have been more sincere, which was very appreciated. All staff were incredibly responsive, polite and warm. Service could not be beat! The only reason we would not stay in this hotel again would be the "little US" feel, the majority of other guests seemed to also be Americans and we prefer stays with a more local or diverse feel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: tcakaren
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a News years eve trip with a friend. its 5 star luxury and if you are looking at this hotel and can afford it or feel you need that luxury, its perfect. But I feel it sits too far away from everything. we did walked everywhere, but would take a taxi back because we ended up too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendys2316
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel. Grand entry way and lobby. We were upgraded from a regular room with a king to a suite with a king! The room was beautifully decorated and huge. Bed was comfortable, room was quiet and bathroom was nice. Staff were nice and concierge very helpful. Buffet breakfast was plentiful and delicious; even had made to order omlettes! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our 3 week Italian trip.”
Reviews.Author: sketteroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything I expected from a 5 star luxury property, but what is most important to me is the cleanliness of the room, the quality of the bed and the size and sumptuousness of the bathroom, and St. Regis Rome delivered on all counts, particularly the bathroom. Big roomy shower, lots of plush fluffy towels, robes and slippers, and great toiletries. My only complaint is that we paid for a suite with "butler service" yet the butler never showed his face until the morning of checkout. Needless to say, he was rewarded justly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBoyz
Reviews.Content: This was a greast hotel. The upgraded us to a lovely suite which was beautifully furnished (our friends loved the regular rooms, too ;-) The hotel staff were amazing - from beginning to end. They have a great restaurant and an absolutely gorgeous lobby area. Every corner of this hotel exudes old world luxury. It's in a nice, handy location, within a few minutes walk of the train station, the sight-seeing buses, and several sights to be seen. We will definitely come back during our next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swiftmi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the St Regis and loved it. We arrived early from our flight from the US at 9:00 AM. Even though check in is mid afternoon they worked hard to get us in a room by 12:30. We were even upgraded to an Imperial level room which was spacious and well decorated. They provided us with refreshments while we waited. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful. The rooms are very clean and are well equipped. The bed is comfortable. We can testify that the food is very good as we ate a lunch and also a dinner there. Overall I rate this as a top level property.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service EVER!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bogswaden
Reviews.Content: We were picked up from the airport, the cab wanted to charge us double the amount that the St. Regis website stated it would be on their website. We asked the 3 bellmen that were in the front to help us as American Tourists but all three men looked the other way and offered no assistance in helping to translate or helping us! We checked into the beautiful hotel, the woman at the front apologized for the bellman but also stated since it was an Italian Holiday the Cab drivers charge more. Room was very nice, we were sleeping when the cleaning lady came to clean our room and we asked that she come back. We called the front desk on our way out so the room would be freshened up. The room was never cleaned and we had to call the front desk three times to get clean towels. We used the gym; the staffs at the spa/gym were not friendly. The water in the cooler was warm and the air conditioning was off, the gym experience was not pleasant. Especially when its hard enough making yourself go to the gym while on vacation, once you get there it should be a pleasant experience. That evening we went to the concierge to get a recommendation for dinner. It was a woman; I do not remember her name. I can not remember the name of the restaurant she sent us to ( I wish I could remember). We got to this really cute restaurant. We asked the waiter for suggestions; he suggested only the highest priced items on the menu which was very disappointing. We told him we were not going to try his suggestions and ordered our food. A few minutes later the waiter brought out several appetizers that we did not order. We were confused and said the waiter we didn't order this, at the same time two American woman were walking out from the restaurant and told us to be careful that they had just done the same thing to them and when the bill came they were charged for a lot of things they did not order. Immediately we asked for the manager, told him to remove these items from our table and give us our bill for our drinks. We told the manager about the American tourist that they had done this to and luckily told us on their way out or this same thing would have happened to them. We got our bill and left. I'm EXTREMELY DISSAPOINTED that a STARWOOD hotel, ST. REGIS Concierge would send American Tourists to a place that pulls scams on their guests. I called the concierge immediately after we left the restaurant very upset. We checked out the next morning as we were so upset with this hotel, on our way out we asked to speak to a manager. The front desk person said that the manager was in meetings and asked what happened and if he could help. We told him all of what happened to us and our experience and still have yet to hear from any manager. We are Gold Member Startwood Preferred Guests, i'm shocked and dissapointed with our entire stay at the St. Regis! We will NEVER GO BACK THERE!!!! We used points so this stay for us was free, but had we not used points this would have been $600 a night. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT STAY HERE!!! We will only stay at W Hotels as they do it RIGHT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a workable location”
Reviews.Author: bossids
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in August 2011 at the St. Regis hotel in Rome. Overall, we had a very positive experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms were large, very quiet, and well furnished. We reserved a deluxe room, but were upgraded to an imperial room, most likely because we had three people in our room (with an extra bed). The breakfast buffet is excellent (although pricey if not included in your room rate), and the atmosphere at the hotel is very refined.
