The location is a bit far from many of the tourist attractions, but it is convenient to Metro stations, Via Veneto, and government buildings. The metro does not run near parts of central Rome (e.g., the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc.), so it’s either a cab ride or a ~15 minute walk to get to those locations, which was not a problem for us. I was also concerned about the location being close to the Termini station, but the hotel is actually several blocks from Termini and the area around the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience but not a top hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were left with a feeling that the "wow" factor was missing for the price we payed and considering it is a St Regis branded hotel. We stayed in an Imperial room (supposed to be top category) and rooms are comfortable enough, although the bathtub is tiny and the view is for a boring interior courtyard. The overall property is beautiful but there are no social spaces except the inner lobby which serves as bar, waiting room and breakfast room. There are no terraces in hotel, which in summer is a big miss in Rome and hotel location is not the best for tourism. When it comes to these categories of hotels the details and service are what make a difference between an OK stay and an excellent stay and St Regis fails here. We arrived thirsty to the room and wanted to open a bottle of water but there were no bottle opener. The bell boy kindly opened it for us with a fork and said he would ask for an opener that never arrived during the 2 days. Asked butler for some tea and hot water arrived with no tea! When she delivered the tea I was trying to connect TV and asked for help since remote was not working - her reply "I don´t manage TV - you have to call maintenance". Had an early flight and asked for breakfast to be delivered at 6h30 - it arrived at 6h50 so didn´t have it. The day before they forgot to deliver back laundry so had to call at 10pm to ask for it. I know hat these are small details but considering what you pay for, I was expecting a stellar service and didn´t see it. Therefore I consider this a 4 star hotel with 5 star prices - not a great equation. Well far behind The Hassler hotel, where we stayed last year and which compensates their smaller rooms with impeccable service and the best views in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: mchisholm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at and the service is unbeatable. We arrived by taxi in the morning. Two bellmen took out luggage from the taxi. Another asked us our name and brought us right to check in. The check in was fast, efficient and very friendly. Once checked in, another staff member showed us to the elevator then our bags were brought up. So upon just arriving, we had a personal welcome from 5 staff members and our bags were in our GORGEOUS room within 10 minutes. The room itself was spectacular. Lovely and comfortable king size bed in a room with 20 ft high celings. The room is decorated in beautiful rennaisance art and every detail has been perfectly attended to. We ordered room service in the room one night and 2 staff brought it in and it was delicious. We called for the dishes to be cleared and they were there within 2 minutes. The Bar is wonderful and my husband claims to have had the best Martini he has ever had in his life. They give you a bowl of fresh olives as well and they are fantastic. The location of the hotel is great as well. You can walk to the Spanish Steps in 10 minutes and from there the Trevi Fountain is not far as are all other attractions. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the train station and is very close to a stop for the double decker tour bus. We always take the tour bus as you can buy one ticket for 2 days with on and off privleges. This way if you are tired of walking, the bus goes wherever you need it to. Overall, our experience in Rome at the St. Regis was the best hotel experience I have had. The staff are incredible and the hotel leaves no stone unturned for the comfort of their guests. I would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Location is not the best”
Reviews.Author: Mildred R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only convenient for Roma Termini Station....otherwise, you will need public transportation. Our rooms looked into an uninspiring courtyard and check was a little stiff. If you like OTT decor then you might like the rooms....faded opulance?

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: This is one of the classic grande dame hotels, with ornate lobbies and even stairwells that have to be seen. The hallway decor was also beautiful--my husband said it made the Plaza in New York look cheap in comparison. We can't really speak to the fitness facility--we were completely wiped out from travelling-- but we can attest to the quality of the registration process, concierge desk, bell boys and room service--all exactly what we needed. Beds were incredibly comfortable--we fell asleep within seconds of laying down. As SPG members we received several nice amenities--beautiful, large fruit basket, candy, bottled water--and an incredible upgrade to a corner suite. They couldn't have been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Winetex
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay at the St. Regis in Rome exceeded our expectations in most ways. If you want a luxurious hotel stay in a great neighborhood in Rome the St. Regis is for you. It is located rather close to the Termini train station although if you have a lot of luggage it would be a strenuous walk because of the crowds. The neighborhood is quiet for Rome and seems to be a financial or business district based on the daytime crowds. Lifting some review categories from a previous reviewer (VTSM). Location: close to metro and bus stations, walking distance to major tourist spots; there are restaurants in the area but not as many as in other more tourist areas Property: good air-conditioning->very important if you go July-Aug; well-maintained with superior bedding and well-appointed luxury room; The lobby and bar areas are beautiful with great service Staff: very friendly and helpful Some tips: many US flights come in early in the morning 9 am ish. Let the hotel know that you are coming in that early so you can check in if possible. We waited about 30 minutes in the lobby while they readied our room but others waited much longer. The full breakfast was ~40 euros per person in the morning. It was pretty spectacular but based on your booking it is best to have it included in your package. The weekend we were there Lady GaGa was staying in the hotel and they were close to 100% full. The hotel staff handled the media attention with aplomb. It says a lot (positive!) about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DeanM44
Reviews.Content: Not a detail is missed, right from the fresh fruit in the room to all the staff knowing your name. Great staff, who went oput of their way to please and serve. This is the second time I have stayed here and would stay again. Yes it costs a few dollars more, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “For a Starwood Hotel St Regis Rome is disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Sa4B3n
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveler and Sarwood member I have been fortunate to stay in many Starwood hotels world wide. St Regis in Rome is below the high standard set by many other hotels of this brand. The good: The shower and bathroom were good, the view of the square and fountain was beautiful, complementary champagne was provided on arrival for our honeymoon, the television was a good size and had a fair choice of channels, the in room dining was good and the gym was good, with free water and drinks, fruit, papers, bvlgari face fresheners etc. The bad: The room was tired and needed bits and bobs to be fixed, 2 power points were falling out of the walls, the walls were scuffed, the towel racks were old and well used, window frame damaged etc, the service was below standard and they attempted to over charge us on check out for internet which was complimentary, the maids didn't replace the vanity kit and towels and for the whole stay we never once got new face towels. Overall the experience was average and I would have expected more for the price and brand.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of SPG hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VTSM
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent business traveller with over 40 stays in international branded hotels from Jan to Jul this year, I am a discerning and demanding customer. St Regis Rome is the best hotel I have ever stayed for either business or vacation. Location: close to metro and bus stations, walking distance to major tourist spots, safe (despite it is close to the seeminly danagerous train station) with many good restaurants surrounded Property: newly renovated and well maintained, luxuriously renassance interior decoration, excellent air-conditioned, equipped with an antique escalator Staff: hearty and personal services, one of the highest "staff to room" ratio, hotel manager working 7 days a week, always touring around every corners to make sure things work well Conceirge: professional and detailed, Georgia is one of the best and will give you excellent advice on dining and where/how to go House keeping: spotlessly clean and tidy Room services: prompt and efficient. The "Butler Services" offered from a certain grade of room is worth the extra room rate I need not to stay in other hotels in Rome for comparison and doubt why it is not ranked the 1st hotel in Rome. Highly recommended with no reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Butler service is heaven”
Reviews.Author: MikeandMom
Reviews.Content: We purchased the week long package through Travelocity and went for the hotel based on the good ratings and the decor we saw on their website. The hotel is one of the most beautiful places on earth, our room was too. The butler service is no secret, use it, tip your butler. You'll never want to go home. Our butler arranged tea for us, saw to the pressing of a new shirt so we'd be wrinkle free for the vatican tour. The front desk service staff is discreet and entirely appropriate. The bar was overpriced but fun for late nights, we were a party of 4 and we had the option of adjoining rooms. The hotel is right next to Santa Marie della Vittoria - relics, EVERYWHERE and Bernini's the Ecstasy of St. Teresa is there too. Go there for mass.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best managements in europe”
Reviews.Author: hadisaidi
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel several times during past three years , apart from the great location and beautiful calssical style and arhitecture and brilliant decoration , the customer relation is excellent , during all these trips I found out that the secret is the hard working and humanitarian charachtristic of Mr Vincenzo Falcone the general manager and his staff who are doing an excellent job of hospitality to satisfy their clients and solve the problems.and honestly this spirit from the management has spread throughout all the personnel and that is why I always go there and always organize the most important trips in this hotel I strongly suggest every one to try this hotel and I am sure you will agree with me.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!! Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: alyonka73
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful and quiet. Staff is most accommodating! Hotel is close to subway and buses and we walked to most major attractions anyways. Overall, definitely recommended and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cineteach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome, having spent three days at the St. Regis Hotel. We arrived by train and it was a short walk to the hotel. The St. Regis is a beautiful hotel and looks like a palace when you enter. We found the people at the front desk very professional and friendly. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting restaurants in the area. We arrived late afternoon and decided to take the hop on hop off red double decker bus to get an overall view of Rome. The ticket is good for 48 hours so we used the bus again the next day to visit several sites along the route. After riding on the bus we realized how close we were to many of the sites. (Trevi Fountain, The Spanish Steps, Piazza de Popolo, Borghese Gardens, etc.) So on our third day we spent our time walking around Rome. We also signed up for a tour of the Vatican with Presto Tours, which was the highlight of our visit to Rome. Our tour guide, Ryan, was one of the best guides we have ever had in our travels to many cities around the world. Back to the hotel...The room was a bit on the small side for a delux but very well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were very soft. In many of the hotels we stayed at on this trip, the linens were not as fine as those at the St. Regis. If traveling to Rome, I would definitely suggest staying at this hotel. It is elegant, centrally located and the staff goes out of their way to accommodate your every need.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteLuykx
Reviews.Content: We have been to the restaurant and tried the tasting menu, which was oke. The dessert was not really nice... The service was good, very friendly and helpfull. The lobby is very big which gives the feeling that you are alone in the hotel so I missed some liveliness in the lobby. The drinks in the bar are very expensive, 8 euros for a tea! The room was very nice, comfortable bed and big bathroom! Overall it was a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThePerrys_10
Reviews.Content: We truly recommend the St-Regis Grand Hotel in Rome, Italy. Located near the subway, beautiful restaurants and tourism attractions. The excellent service and the luxury of this hotel will make you return again and again. Bravo !

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to stay in this hotel (about 500 euro/night) do it.”
Reviews.Author: dnadler
Reviews.Content: It exhudes old world elegance, beds are great. It was renovated a few years ago so it's getting a bit old. Even then it's extremely comfortable, very quiet. Our room faced the busy street in front of the hotel but the windows are so sound proof that you don't even realize you are in the center of Rome. Also if you have kids they have a special kids room with a movie projector and DVD player, Sony playstation, nintendo wii, snacks and drinks and a foos ball table. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were totally impressed with the rooms and service offered by the hotel. We really want to stay here again. WOW! The only thing that is a little weak is the location, but totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel....But Where was the Butler?”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis 2 days pre-cruise. We were travelling with our 2 teenage children. I used SPG points (Many!) to accomodate us in a Jr. Suite that connected to a Deluxe Room. Here are my thoughts.... Check-in: We arrived around 7PM local time after our overseas flight. The bellman and doormen were very gracious with their welcome to some very weary travellers. The gentleman at the front desk was attentive and efficient with our registration and was able to confirm our connecting rooms. This was very much appreciated as not all properties are as receptive to accomodating families. After we were checked in, the gentleman came around and personally showed us to our suite which was on the third floor (read 2nd floor). On the way, he provided and infomative narrative of where things were located in this grand hotel. Upon reaching our rooms, he informed us that our baggage would follow us up shortly..... Rooms: We found the rooms very clean and well maintained.....which is the first critieria of any property. Then the WOW factor. The Deluxe Room was beautiful. Very ornate and spcaious. The marble bathroom was lovely and well laid out. The bed linens were sumptous. There was a nice seating area in front of the bed. We noticed that the bed in the room was made up as a king even though we had requested 2 beds. No problem. A quick call and a maid quickly appeared to rectify the situation. All in all, the deluxe room category was fantastic. Now, the Junior suite. Again, beautiful but not as well laid out. as the previous connecting room. The marble bathroom was definitely a step down from the deluxe room. It was as if they retrofiited the space and had a check list to make sure that all the parts were there.....but just did not fit! The sitting area in the suite was comfy with a small desk and an armoir with a flat screen TV. From the sitting area of the suite, one could past the french doors into the master bedroom. Again, lovely linens, wonderful mastress, but a very small room! For any interested readers out there, I guess that I am mentioning all of this, in that if it was just my husband and myself travelling I would most certainly opt for the Deluxe Room over the JR. suite.....points or cash!! And here is the clincher. We were under the impression that the Jr. Suite came with butler service. ( I should preface to say that we have stayed at properties with bulter service and the minimum service we have received is a quick courtesy call to see if we needed assistance with unpacking, clothes pressed, anything to make our stay more comfortable, etc.) We were not contacted at all except as we were leaving and a gentleman knocked and asked my husband if we enjoyed our stay......We were not sure if this was the butler or not. In the end, it really did not matter, as we did not want anything unpacked as we were moving on to the cruise in 2 days. In hindsight, we would have been a very easy client for Mr. Butler....because we really required nothing...perhaps a shoe shine....but no worries, his tip stayed securely in my husband's wallet.....So, dear readers......perhaps rethink if you want to pay for non-existent butler service because the suite itself does not merit the differnce in price from the deluxe room. Oh, and I want to mention that we were given a total non-view rooms. We had the pleasure of looking out at an aging roof.....but the flip side is that it was very quiet and lent itself to some very good sleeps. (Rome is a very noisy city....so this proved to be a good thing for a short stay!) Concierge: We found the concierge team to be very friendly, engaging and helpful. Our arrival night, we wanted to dine at a casual, easy walking distance restaurant with of course, great food! The recommendation did not disappoint. Target restaurant! For a quick, easy, delicious dinner, this establishment was a hit! The concierge was also excellant at routing out a map of some lesser known attractions ( we have been to Rome previously). As an aside, there is a church "of the bones" that is within walking distance. Our kids were fascinated with this for some reason.....check it out and you will understand. Restaurants & Bars: We did not have the pleasure of dining at any of the hotel's establishments. I should mention that if the opportunity would have presented itself, I would have most certainly enjoyed a glass of champagne in the bar listening to the excellant pianist....ahhhhhh the ambience! Check-out: We had a bellman knock at our door at the appointed time to help us with our luggage. WE proceeded on to the front desk to depart. Everything was in order and our private driver was there and we left for the port. Conclusion: Would I stay here again? The million dollar question that all hoteliers want to know of their guests......The answer is PROBABLY....IF... I used points or if I was able to have a great negotiated rate. The hotel is in an OK location. We found it easy to walk to all the big sites minus Vatican City. However, it is not surrounded by the ambience that many other hotels are enxconed within. The personel were fine but certainly not as gracious as some of the other finer luxury establishments such as the Four Seasons. Also, I was disappointed that the butler did not greet us. Perhaps there was a mix-up in our suite category. I am not sure and it really did not matter. But I think it prudent for me to mention that my husband and I had previously stayed at the St. REgis Bora Bora. Again, our suite was to include butler services. It was non-existant, as well. Perhaps the St. REgis butler service is of the adage....."wait until they call you.!" Again, I am not sure. (I should also mention that in Bora Bora, we used $$ not SPG to settle our account. So, I cannot conclude that in Rome it was a snub against our points.) Regardless, I personally feel that to give a property an excellant rating, they have to deliver what they advertise. To be a 5-star property, I think an establisment must be pro-active and not reactive in their guests needs. For me, the St. REgis Grand fell short. Having said that, it is most certainly a beautiful, clean hotel that suited our needs for our short stay. Happy and safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but amazing!”
Reviews.Author: victorianunes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means a budget hotel but for a special occasion it will have the wow factor. The hotel is just impressive from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. The rooms are stunning, we stayed in a suite which was large and grand in it's decor. The service was generally good and our trip was very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great property shame about the service.”
Reviews.Author: Ioveit
Reviews.Content: Room was great, location average service abysmal. We had housekeeping walk into our room 4 times in a two hour span with a quick knock and an immidiette entry. As soon as they realised we were in the room they left without a word only to return again half an hour later. In case you are thinking we should have put on the DND sign there was not one. Room service did not arrive for an hour and when I called to ask about it, the response was twenty more minutes. For a pasta!!!!! Breakfast was fabulous. the best in Rome. When I pointed these things out at check in I got a so sorry sir but not an inkling of concern as to why this should happen. I guess complaints must be common

Reviews.Title: “Kids friendly and in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: torontotraveller080
Reviews.Content: We visited some friends in Umbria and flew through Rome. So we decided to spend 3 days here before flying home. And we do not regret it. Location is excellent and the hotel is very nice. We got upgraded to a junior suite, which was a bit heavily decorated but very clean and spacious. Staff was very attentive of the kids, which is not always in 5* city hotels. Restaurant is also very good. Highly recommendable but three days was too short to get to know Rome. We will have to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, fantastic central location.”
Reviews.Author: sdfirefighter
Reviews.Content: Without pimping a certain brand of hotel loyalty program too much (Starwood) , Let's just say this is a great place to spend your Starwood points. Walking distance to virtually everything you'd want to see (we were traveling with our two small children 3 & 19 mos). The service is fantastic & the ambiance of the hotel is... well it's a St. Regis. The room was very nice, if a shade on the small side. A little sticker shock at the hotel breakfast (€43 for the buffet & €25 for continental breakfast!!) and having to pay for in room internet access (€15). But all in all, a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Room”
Reviews.Author: Folkgroupie
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old world room with comfortable beds. What you expect at this brand. Good service, responsive concierge. Quiet hotel, not many lingering in bar area --more a quiet discreet destination. In walking distance of some tourist sites. Plaza nearby pretty with fountain, but immediate surrounding neighborhood not much exciting for tourist. very good about trying to get you into a room quickly when arriving from international flight which was great and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: LLBSacto
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with amazing staff. This is the best hotel in Rome. Great location, excellent amenities, amazing staff that are happy to help, clean rooms, fast room service, and the best concierge on the continent. We had our 7 month old baby with us, and they were able to procure a babysitter one night and then sterilize all our baby bottles the next night. Everyone is friendly and kind. We will definitely be back. Ask for room 242.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: leinsterfan2011
Reviews.Content: We were here on a family trip, and did not research the place properly. Positive: 1) Nice lobbay 2) Clean rooms (although smoke was prevelant.) 3) Nearby a hop on/ off bus service 4) Decent in room dining Negatives 1) Location, right by the train station...nowhere near the main attractions 2) Check was okay, but not that friendly. 3) In room videos were way over priced. Overall, the hotel was a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: njgalinwt
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Rome was beautifully restored a few years back and is a great place to stay in Rome. Our roome was huge and completely updated and the bathrooms were all marble and again spacious. The concierge was extremely helpful planning tours and giving restaurant recommendations. The location is not the best, as it's sorrounded by busy streets which are difficult to cross with traffic. But I wouldn't not stay here because of that. We ate at the cafe in the lobby for lunch and breakfast and had good meals.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler025
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, old school hotel in the Piazza della Repubblica area of Rome. Impeccable service, opulent lobby and well appointed rooms. We were upgraded to a lovely court yard room with a beautiful mural and fabulous marble bath with a large tub and separate shower. The robes were actually soft and thick! Turn down twice daily with our slippers on a towel/mat next to the bed. While not area to wander late at night, even though the fountains and general area are lovely, you’re close to the train station and a bit of a walk to the more touristy sights. During the day however the area is brimming with locals and tourists alike. There’s a variety of shops within walking distance (try Via Nazionale) with nice leather hand bags, shoes, etc… at reasonable prices compared to the more “fashionable” areas of Rome. The Coliseum is about a 10 minute train ride and other areas are easily accessible by train or foot depending on where you start from We took cabs at the front end of our stay before we realized how easy it was to hop on and off the busses or trains during the day. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: italias
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights and the service was excellent. The room was gorgeous and very well maintained. It was definitely a five star room. The front desk staff, concierge, bellman were all very helpful and polite. I did not eat at any of their restaurants but did enjoy the bar and the piano music. The free snacks in the bar were definitely worth the price of a drink. My only complaint would probably be that my glass was empty for about 30 minutes and I decided to ask for my check rather than have another cocktail as planned. Beautiful place and within walking distance for many attractions. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “BEST FAMILY VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: olderdadblog
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Italy, we wanted to be in a central location so as to see everything yet be able to walk to almost everything.This was absolutely the BEST location, BEST SERVICE, and we had the most wonderful time. The concierge was amazing, he did everything. We had our room upgraded as soon as we arrived, they then saw we had our 6 year old and while we were out walking they came in and re-did the entire room so she had her own little suite. They took care of her as if she were thier own daughter even at night when we came in and the pianist would play beauty and the beast as soon as he saw here enter the lobby1 We walked to everything from the st. Regis, we were at Trevis fountain at least twice a day , Borghese park , Spanish steps... I could go on and on...but if you want the best location and the best service...stay at the st. regis Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice rooms as long as you dont go for the most basic”
Reviews.Author: EddyCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis in Rome on our honeymoon over Easter this year (arriving Good Friday and deprting Easter Monday) and enjoyed our time there. We had come from Paris and Florence where we had stayed in lovely hotels and were struck by the beauty of the hotel when we entered. Our good experience was hampered by the quality of our room though. It was quite small with very little light and the decor was old (worn carpet and a leaking shower). Upon bringing this to the attention of the staff we were however upgraded to a Deluxe room which was just lovely. This made our Easter stay extra special. The amenities are divine. The lounge and breakfast room make you want to never leave and the breakfasts are lovlely. The location is good in that it is right near a train line which is helpful, however don't be fooled into thinking this location is really close to the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps. The train line does make it quite accessible to everything though. During our stay the concierge were even able to organise us tickets to Easter Sunday mass in St Peters Square. We never could have oranised this without their assistance. Also we took the hotel car to the airport on departure for the same price as a taxi and it was much nicer. All in all it was a good experience once we were upgraded. I am not sure if I would stay here again or whether I would try and find a hotel right at the Spanish Steps. Hav ing said that, we loved out time there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location (not best, not terrible)”
Reviews.Author: JPNYC33
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is right by Termini, the train station. We read the Termini area (like Port Authority) is a bit sketchy, but like Port Authority, it depends on which side of the station you are. I figured it couldn’t be that bad since it’s the St. Regis but I was still a bit wary. All for naught as it actually turned out to be a really good location. While not super close to any of the big sites, it was close enough to several – Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain - that we could easily walk there (about a 15 min walk, and as New Yorkers, this is nothing). Also, Rome is a big city so it’s not feasible to walk everywhere. Main public transportation is the bus system, but there are so many that it can be a bit complex to navigate. Good thing is, at every stop, there is list of all the buses and the routes that they are going, so for us, all we had to see if it went to “Termini”. Less change of getting lost and multiple buses to choose from. Rome also has a metro system, but it is very limited (just two lines, one that goes NW to SE, and another that goes from N to S) and there are big chunks of the city where metro is not accessible. Being in Termini, we used the metro a couple times, which is convenient in its speed. I don't know if I would recommend someone to stay here that wasn't super rich. We used our points or we couldn't have afforded the 400 euros/night (and we stayed for 5 nights). That being said, if you have the money, St. Regis has all the amenities you can want, including a private wine cellar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - away from the busy centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Charlottes-Travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, great place to choose if in Rome, it is quite a walk from the main tourist attractions so will have to get cabs or be preapred for a lengthy walk. But the hotel itself is a beautiful hotel and our room was beautiful, clean and 5*, only thing I would say is not quite 5* is the breakfast as it is all buffet self service, i think if you are paying 5* star prices your cooked breakfast should be cooked in the kitchen individually for you not laid out sitting for hours.... We were given a beautiful room, have a look at the pictures, I have not stayed anywhere else in Rome but thought this hotel overall was a beautiful place to stay... the bathroom in room 206 is unreal with the nicest bath ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: hb200805
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the St Regis. Room was a good size. Bed was very comfortable. Shower was the best after walking around Rome. The main terminal was less than a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “We only dined in the Restaurant one evening”
Reviews.Author: Fireblader
Reviews.Content: Everything expected from a 5-Star Hotel and Restaurant. Service was excellent. Food was very good. Not excellent - but very good. Service was second to none. Expect to pay 80 Euro a head if you dine here. A great place to dine for 5-star treatment. FYI: the Montes Alpha 2006 Merlot is amazing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel -- a pleasure to come home to”
Reviews.Author: DRudd88
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of ridiculously overpriced hotels in Rome, I approached the St. Regis with caution. But my fears disappeared as I was cheerfully escorted to my (upgraded) room, and took advantage of the complimentary afternoon tea service -- which included fresh juices and a terrific cappuccino. Our courtyard-facing room was incredibly quiet, so much so we nearly overslept the private tour of the Vatican the concierges arranged for us. (They also got us into La Pergola -- arguably the best restaurant in Italy -- and recommended a nearby taverna where Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor used to hang out while shooting "Cleopatra".) The room was very spacious, with the largest shower I have ever seen. And there were constant surprises: one night it was hunks of excellent Parmesan cheese and a matching bottle of wine. The previous day an order of tomato and bread pudding came with two complimentary glasses of champagne. I've stayed at hotels for 50+ nights and not been treated so well. Highly recommended by this scarred and cynical road warrior.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect -- A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxFirstTravel
Reviews.Content: The Imperial room we were assigned was virtually flawless with just two minor complaints -- a leaky faucet and shower. The butler, concierge and housekeeping services were outstanding. The fitness center was small but adequate except when the treadmills were turned off due to noise complaints from the rooms below. Suggestion: move the fitness center to the ground floor. The only thing that was absolutely dreadful was the light fare at the Grand Bar. We ate there on our last night because it was raining outside and we needed time that night to pack. What a mistake that was. Over 65 euro for a wilted caesar salad and burnt baby chicken with potatoes. Do not eat there. Within walking distance is a small restaurant called Dagnino's near Piazza Repubblica. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. In terms of public transport -- beware of the rogue taxi driver. We were overcharged for the trip from the airport to the hotel and worse yet, the driver pretended that we didn't pay him correctly in cash. The taxi ride wound up costing us 115 euros!! Now we will only take private cars for airport transfers there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: blackjeepguy
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the St. Regis while on vacation in Rome. Beautiful hotel with outstanding service. Make sure you get a drink at the bar, the bartender and waiters are the best!. I will always stay here when i am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience the moment you walk through the door.”
Reviews.Author: jesau123
Reviews.Content: Incredible in every way. After ten days of train travel through Umbria w/backpacks, sleeping in the beds St. Regis felt like we were on a cloud. We wondered how we would be received when we walked in w/ our backpacks and tired looking travel clothes and that concern was quickly dispelled. The staff immediately welcomed us, lifting our packs off our backs and directing us to the front desk. While all staff spoke perfect English they enjoyed my husband’s desire to practice his Italian and we continuously had delightful conversations with everyone we encountered. The room was beautifully appointed with fresh orchids and luscious Remedy spa products. I fell into the marble bathtub within minutes. We had excellent meals at the Grand Bar, which we chose over the more formal restaurant specifically so because it overlooked the elegant lobby. Starwoods has restored this magnificent historical building to its original grandeur while providing the modern attention to detail that you expect at any of their newer establishments. Should I mention we fell in love with the waitstaff? They were delightful, assisting my husband in some nuances of the accent on words and suggesting a perfect light lunch before we headed out the the Borghese Galleria. The neighborhood is much more central and accessible than we expected having read some of the other reviews. One must walk when in Roma because very moment is an experience to marvel in. This was a perfect location for strolling through the Villa Borghese park and gardens, which can also lead right down (yes down) the Spanish Steps and through the other historic neighborhoods such as the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain. The staff will provide you with a map and arrange for transportation or any other needs. Light dinner again at the Grand Bar Lounge is perfect after a long day in the city and the cookies at the end of the meal are exceptional. We had room service breakfast that was spectacular, lovely table setting with massive bowls of fresh fruit and beautiful pastries, cappuccino. The St. Regis is a treat unto oneself.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5stars leaving on his reputation!”
Reviews.Author: jchen038
Reviews.Content: I was really surprise for the lake of attention in the service in the St Regis in Rome, nothing to do with the other properties of the same brand in other countries! From the check-in no smile from the staff at arrival (but a very cold welcome), no apologize because the room was not ready at 1 pm in the afternoon, very few attention to details and presentation in the housekeeping on arrival in the room, I was really disappointed! I tried also the hotel restaurant being on my own for a business trip and I found it expensive and not attractive at all, no views at the ground floor. The location is also not really fancy near the train station no shopping around no site to visit at a walking distance, the Spanish Steps are at 25 minutes away, I recommend that you take a taxi if you want to see the Vatican avoid the metro, crowded and be aware of the gipsy!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Elegance”
Reviews.Author: RAM07
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis was everything we expected: elegant, romantic, classy, and sophisticated. The decor was gorgeous. The food in Italy was not as good as expected, even at the St. Regis, but the hotel itself was remarkable. The rooms were large by European standards. The only negatives were that gym was small and located in the attic area, and there was no pool, but we were able to walk to most all of the landmarks around Rome. I would recommend The St. Regis to anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: robert4704
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. The over all attitude of the staff was not welcoming. Several small things,AC,TV, elevator did not work. The room just seemed worn. The place needs to be refurbished. Not what is expected from a 5 star hotel. Could use advice from Kempinski. Monica is the only employee who seems to know she works in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star does make a difference”
Reviews.Author: RoseD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely 5 star, service from concierge was fabulous and the cakes/biscuits provided with drinks were lovely. Down sides were no tea/coffee facilities in room and unfortunately the maid for some reason never provided us with any replacement toilet rolls so we had the one to last us. Upon calling when we did actually completely run out and resorted to tissues(!) they did swiftly bring some up but really for 5 star a call should not have to be made that is a basic thing surely when cleaning the bathroom daily. Also for 5 star and the cost (not that I wanted to use it but for those who do) you would think wi fi would be free. The main downside was check in, we ended up waiting 2 hours for our room which was a bad start to the holiday and very unfortunate. We did get given a drink and biscuits but perhaps replenishments would be in order for that length of time and no updates throughout. They were apologetic when they did finally show us our room. The room was superb. I found the air con quite noisy which did disrupt my sleep and I'm a heavy sleeper. However don't let that put you off, the hotel was splended and the dressing gowns, slippers, lovely toiletries, mats by your bed so you didn't have to walk on carpet upon getting out of bed, bowl of fruit brought to room, free bottled water in room every day, fabulous cocktails at the bar, extremely helpful concierge, doorman who spins revolving door for you, huge beds, a welcome when leaving and entering hotel were all what made it special. Regarding location, don't listen to any of the reviews which say it is not walkable to the attractions, they must be physically challenged because you are literally 5 minutes from the Barberini which really is the central hub. We walked everywhere, even to the Vatican on the otherside of the river and that only took about half an hour and everything else is much much closer than that. Like somebody else said it is better being that slightly removed from the tourism spots but being closer enough to wander to them. I wouldn't want to have stayed on the road next to the Spanish Steps or the Via Veneto where I was also thinking of staying, too busy and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days, 4 nights on a business trip. Upgraded to deluxe room. The location of the hotel is key, as you can take the Metro just about anywhere. It is just a couple of blocks accross the square. I didn't eat in the Hotel, but the service from all of the staff was excellent. Would highly recommned this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: glisella
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The room was immaculate, the staff remembered everything we told them, the concierge helped us with anything we asked. The location is great, it might not look it on a map but once there you'll see what I mean. You do not want to be by any tourist attraction such as the Vatican, Colliseum, etc., they can be either walked to in 10 minutes or a 10 minute cab (completely safe as are the trains, we took them to Naples and Florence for day trips) The room service came at the exact minute we ordered (called night prior for pot of coffee and milk delivered to room at 6:45 AM and they knocked at that exact time...beats having a separate wake up call!) I will definitely not only stay here again, but this was my first time ever staying at a St. Regis and I will seek them out in other destinations based on this trip. We traveled my wife, my 1 year old, and myself and they made all of us feel like we were the only ones staying there. From the moment we arrived and they gave us water, coffee, and snacks while our room was being prepared to catering to every need...they were there with great attitudes and smiles. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon stay!”
Reviews.Author: Simplyluvin
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis in Rome was fantastic. Great service, great rooms, beautiful lobby. Did not have breakfast until the last day, but it was delightful. The location is a little bit of a walk from the main Roman attractions, but the area is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: JayaYan
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding, easy access to subway and restaurants, beautifully decorated room, complimentary fruit and champagne upon arrival and the evening before checking out. The lobby and staircase were grand. Concierge was very helpful with directions and maps and in making restaurant reservations. The room itself was a bit small by US standards but it wasn't of a big deal. We spent quite a bit on taxis because it wasn't in the most central of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny and more.”
Reviews.Author: Visili
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for nine consecutive nights. The hotel met all our five star expectations re: elegance, ambiance, service, food quality, cleanliness and location. The staff are professional, thoughtful and extremely friendly. Our room was luxurious and exactly as advertised. We will definitly stay at the St. Regis again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jane48682
Reviews.Content: St. Regis is a beautiful hotel in the center of Rome. Its location makes it accessible to all the historical spots. The room is spacious and well kept. The staff is wonderful. No request is too small and all requests are attended to promptly. The concierge is remarkable, they even procured v.i.p. tickets for us to the Papal audience. I would absolutely stay at the St. Regis Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice for Valentine!”
Reviews.Author: emily2563
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel and regret for doing it so early! I would recommend this hotel for valentine weekend! Booked from tigerhotels.co.uk. The hotel is within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and Via Veneto. The rooms are lavishly decorated with rich damask, silks and cosy carpet, giving a royal feeling. The restaurant served signature dishes by award wining chefs! The staff was friendly and helpful. Rome is voted as most romantic city and St Regis hotel should be voted as most romatic hotel in Rome! Indeed we loved the hotel and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, convenient location to most everything”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugM
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects: -- The hotel is quite nice and very luxurious, and in a beautiful space. -- The service is top notch. -- I had several meals at the hotel, including breakfast and dinner, and the food was very tasty. -- The location of the hotel is quite convenient on top of the Repubblica subway stop and just adjacent to the train station. Some minor drawbacks about the property: -- The hotel is in an old building and it's clear the property has been around for a while. -- The room was quite stuffy (temperature-wise) and window-opening helped only slightly. -- The gym is a bit lacking in features: the men's sauna was broken (for an indefinite amount of time according to the signage and the workers) and the treadmills were not able to be used before 9am (still unclear why). -- For the price one pays for a room, it's a bit obnoxious to be charged for internet use (3 euro per hour). With room rates as high as they are, just throw the Wi-Fi in gratis.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel - Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Gourand
Reviews.Content: The hotel hosted over 70 of us for a conference and I couldn't fault a thing. The service was completely discrete and yet they thought of everything, from airing the rooms, remembering the drinks we ordered and even serving us with drinks when we were working on computers in the business centre during the down times. The food was good, although I think suffered somewhat from the mass cooking. The hors d'oeuvres in cocktail hour were stunning. I will definitely return for a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beat, so don't try”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand Hotel in Rome is definitely the best hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. From the moment we walked in the lobby, the service was amazing. Whatever part of the hotel we were in, we were greeted personally and by name. We were personally shown to our room by the front desk staff. The amazing concierge was able to book us into the Galleria Borghese with just a few hours notice. The butler staff is amazing, even by St. Regis standards. Wonderful fresh juices, espresso, tea, and fresh pastries arrived several times daily. We were sent champagne, a fruit plate, and wine courtesy of the management before we even unpacked. We were in a fantastic suite with special touches by a celebrated artist. Everything was lush and luxurious-- pillows, bedding, chairs and sofas, curtains, etc. etc. Can't get enough of the Remede products either. A must visit if you can afford it. Sandro on the management staff deserves special mention for his amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 0puns
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the St. Regis Rome at about 9 in the morning. The front desk clerk knew that we were had just come off a long flight and offered us complimentary cappuccino's in the hotel lobby restaurant while he checked on getting a room ready for us. After about 30 minutes he gave us the good news that a room was ready and that we could check-in right away. That gesture really set the tone for our stay in Rome. Doors were always opened for us and a smile/salutation always greeted us. Some mention the hotels location being a bit out of the way, but we didn't find that to be the case. We did a lot of walking and walked to the all of the attractions (except the Vatican) from the St. Regis. Granted we were bushed at the end of the day, but we got to see a lot of the city. Our deluxe room was big by European standards and the bed was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Home!”
Reviews.Author: cchriscap
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every time i go to Roma in the last 10 years! The service is the best and the location spectacular! Yes there somtimes a problem but all you have to do is pick up the phone and call the front desk or any of the staff and the problem is taken care of in minutes. I have at times traveled there with a group of people needing 5-10 rooms and other times just myself always treated like a vip!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: gerrykaka
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Europe. Rich in history and decor. Great service, great location, rooms are large a beautifully decorated. Staff was very helpful. When we arrived are rooms were not ready ( we where there better check-in time) so we went to the bar for a drink to wait, when a staff member came to the bar to give us the room key, he promoed the drinks and apoligized for making us wait. First class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome; friendly and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: dinmo
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Hotel is in a great location in Rome. It's near the Piazza della Repubblica and the Rome Central Station. It is even passed by the regular tourist buses. It is across a travel tour office that offers tours in Rome and other parts of Italy. The staff is friendly and accommodating and can help you find the best tours for you, train schedules, etc. The breakfast is also good, offering American and Continental breakfast. The room we stayed in though was a bit small. There's little space between the TV armoire and the king-size bed, considering that it is a suite. But the bathroom is nice with separate shower area and bathtub. The bed is nice to sleep in, fluffy pillows and all.

Reviews.Title: “loved the St Regis”
Reviews.Author: mohlab
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 wonderful nights in St Regis ,this was our fifth visit to Rome,we love everything in this city,but this time our stay in St Regis made us loving it more. Everything in this hotel was great,the staff ,the room ,the lobby,the location and most of all the breakfast is not to be missed(it's advisable to get your booking breakfast inclusive to avoid paying 40 euros for it). After asking the concierge advise for the best pizza in Rome he suggested BOFETTA" pizzeria,for those who love pizza i advise not to miss this place ,despite its poor appearance they serve here the best pizza i ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: vtv75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights using my SPG points. Upon arrival, I received email from the hotel personal assistance for any special request. I had mentioned that I needed to check in early in the morning and it was for our honeymoon. The hotel staff upgraded our room to a junior suite which was beautiful. On our first night, the hotel management offered a complimentary champagne bottle. The concierge desk was very helpful since it was our first time in Italy. The hotel staff was just wonderful. We are looking forward to coming back there. Thanks for recognizing our platinum status! We absolutely loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The St.Regis Grand is Our Favorite Destination in all of Italy”
Reviews.Author: MacroMicro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely love staying at the St. Regis Grand Hotel in Rome. We've stayed there a number of times and, each time, we've enjoyed ourselves immensely. We've never been disappointed. The staff is warm and friendly, the breakfasts luxurious beyond all expectations and the hotel itself an architectural wonder. It's within walking distance of the Via Venetto and yet just far enough away from all the tourists. We're not the only ones that feel that way: http://extravigator.com/discussion/312/top-hotels-in-italy/ and I'm sure we're not alone in giving The St. Regis Grand our highest rating, not only for Rome, but for all of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A truly Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles025
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel made me think of many amenities offered in newer 5 star hotels in the US, this is simply a grand dame with many luxuries worth copying. They have several great concierges and a lady called Federica in the front desk that goes out of her way to take care of things for you. Great pasta (Fetucelle made of wheat) that were truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: flyerdc
Reviews.Content: After so many fine reviews of this hotel, I was surprised to arrive here -- and find it so lacking in so many ways. First things first, the internet has been out at the hotel for two days, so businessmen and women, be warned; you can't depend on doing business on the internet in your room, wired or wifi. The rooms are pretty, but the bathrooms in many of them are very small. And Starwood Platinum guests, don't expect any real upgrade, because there won't be one unless you get an exceptionally friendly front-desk manager. The hotel was nearly empty during my stay, but I was "upgraded" only to a standard room with a view of the street. (The un-upgraded version has a view to the courtyard.) The service is indifferent and often unfriendly. My favorite moment came when I was elbowed out of an elevator by a security guard to make way for the wife of some African despot. Eye-contact seems to be a real stretch for much of the hotel staff. With so many other other choices in Rome, why stay here, especially at the king's ransom that the hotel charges?

Reviews.Title: “nice luxury, great service”
Reviews.Author: QueenB66
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is definitely a "Grande hotel".The front desk and front door staff was very friendly and upon check- in we got an upgrade. Our room war very spacious with every amenity you can think of and plenty of room for a roll-away bed, which according to our daughter was the most comfortable ever. The bathroom however could use some work, leaking faucet, etc. The concierge service was outstanding, we used them for advising us on private guided tours, and I can highly recommend that, and also we used the concierge for our dinner plans, and most restaurants they recommended were also highly recommended by Tripadvisor. We didn't try the restaurant in the hotel, as it is totally overpriced. Breakfast buffet for 42Euros per person. Instead go to one of the little coffee shops all around the hotel. The location of the hotel is not the greatest for sightseeing but we walked everywhere apart from the Vatikan. And there are always taxis right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury, well located, perfect beds”
Reviews.Author: SDN01
Reviews.Content: St. Regis didn't disappoint. Was there for 4 nights in November, perfect location 1 block from Republicca metro for easy access to Vatican, can easily walk everywhere else. Rome is best seen in foot. The hotel was stunningly beautiful, gorgeous rooms, well equipped and very nice fitness facility. I did not eat at the onsite restaurants, but heard Viviendo was splendid. Just had coffee, brioche, etc in hotel, was excellent. Staff was excellent, Monica, the lobby butler is a wonderful Ambassador for the property who will greet you on arrival and help get you settled. Only critique on service was that we found the Concierge desk could have been more helpful on some questions we had about both restaurants as well as some sights we wanted to see. I read other reviews about Hotel on a hill, hard to walk, etc, not sure I understand that - it is easily walkable, yes, some hills in Rome, although nothing like San Francisco, just minor inclines/declines. If you don't walk to walk, taxis were everywhere and the cheapest I've ever found in a major city. Travestere to St. Regis Saturday night at 10 PM was € 5-6

Reviews.Title: “great but it needs to be renovated....”
Reviews.Author: lebuchin
Reviews.Content: we had a very nice stay for 3 nights at the Saint Regis. The staff is great, excellent service. I highly recommend the breakfast which was fantastic (not always the case in Italy). My wife had a treatment at the Spa and she loved it (considering that she is quite difficult with Spa...). the location is a little bit off pitch but it is fine. The only negative point is the current conditions of the rooms... This hotel really needs to be renovated! Once it will be, we will go back there with great pleasure, before that, it is not worth the price, in my opinion. Please renovate it !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Smartgirl4sure
Reviews.Content: This will be the only place we stay in Rome...the service, the quality...the attention, we enjoyed was amazing. The rooms were large and elegant....the baths were equally as lovely. The staff from the front desk to the door were friendly and accomodating. Tony and I highly recommend this elegant establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Relaxin656
Reviews.Content: St. Regis say was great and I loved the location! I'd stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly Better than St. Regis NYC?”
Reviews.Author: Nanci_Dru
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night on our way home to the US from a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel is somewhat unassuming from the exterior but deserving of it's "grand" name as soon as you step inside. The beautiful hotel, recently redone, is full of marble floors, frescoed ceilings and lovely moldings throughout. Even the stairway and hallways are sights to see. We both agreed that this hotel is perhaps nicer than the St. Regis in NYC, which I believe is the flagship St. Regis. As soon as we walked to the front door, our luggage was taken and later brought to our room. Doormen were always there to open the door. Check-in and check-out were easy. Staff was friendly. The concierge was great and showed us that most Rome sights are within walking distance of the hotel (except the Vatican) and made a dinner reservation for us. We had limited contact with the staff but found them to be excellent. Also, maid service was good, with towels and toiletries replaced and the bed turned down while we were at dinner. There is a fairly large business center, though prices were high. I would have loved an airline check-in kiosk to print our tickets. The room was outstanding, even though we were in their most modest room since we had used Starpoints to pay. The ceilings were soooo high, and the doors had hand-stenciling. There was a chandelier above the bed and hand painted fresco above the bed. Our room had two floor-to-ceiling windows with large drapes and a window seat. I only wish I had time to curl up and read a book there. There were slippers and robes, plenty of Remede toiletries, and bottled water. We also had a large flatscreen TV with channels in multiple languages, including English, and DVD. The butler service was slightly stripped down from the butler service at other St. Regis hotels (suites have full service), but this suited us fine since I'm not used to having a butler anyway! There was a card outlining the normal services -- shoe shine, pressing, concierge, etc. The gym was small and you had to go through the spa to access it. It had brand new equipment. The hotel was quiet and the bed was divine -- finally a good night's sleep! Our experience was 5-star in every way, and I do believe that the furnishings and decor were nicer than at the St. Regis in New York. The hotel is a quick walk to the train station Termini, also. As we departed, we tried to get a cab to the airport but were told that a black car was the same price. It was 60 euros, whereas I believe a cab is only 40. The train is I believe about 11 euros each is direct ever half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: NoraNJtoLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our weekend at the St. Regis. The hotel itself is beautiful and is convenient to most attractions in Rome. We were able to walk everywhere other than the Vatican. The rooms are nicely appointed and in very good condition. The service is, with some exception, not top notch. When my husband and I arrived, our room was not yet ready. We were shown inside and offered tea and coffee while we waited (20 minutes or so) for our room. This is the way guests should be treated at hotels, though this is rarely the case. From here, the service level decreased. Upon returning from dinner, my husband called the front desk to let them know that he would like his shoes shined. He left the shoes outside the room and retrieved them in the morning. They had not been shined. The maid then neglected to give us washcloths on our second day. We called the front desk to have them brought to our room, but we instead received long towels. Upon checkout we asked to leave our bags at the hotel for a few hours. The man at the front desk merely pointed in the direction we should head in to have our bags checked rather than offering to help. When we went to the other side of the lobby, the men actually walked past us and ignored us rather than handling our bags. These are all small things, but it is the small things that really count at what is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. My greatest annoyance was with a tour we booked through the concierge- a private Vatican tour- we were quoted a price of €230 for 3 hours. What we were not told was what the price did NOT include. First, transportation- after meeting our guide, we had to hail a cab and pay an additional €10 to get to the Vatican. Second, our tickets- at the end of the tour our tour guide informed us that in addition to the €230 for the 3 hours and the €10 we spent on the cab, we had to pay €50 for the tickets she had purchased for us. In addition, the clock started running the moment we were introduced to our guide at the hotel. So approximately 25% of our 3 hour tour was taken up with travel time to the Vatican, standing in line for security and gathering our tickets for entry. I think this is VERY expensive, and I also believe that it was very underhanded to not have been told that the quoted price of €230 was only for the 'time' of the guide, nothing else. The guide was informative, but she should be. I do hope that a member of the St. Regis responds to this post. I didn't expect to be hustled at a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Could've Moved In”
Reviews.Author: MollySS
Reviews.Content: Of all of the (very nice) hotels we stayed in during our Italian honeymoon, this was our absolute favorite. Our spacious room came with complimentary prosecco, candy, double sinks, a Jacuzzi tub and shower. Granted, it was our honeymoon. I had a vanity all of my own. Our room had a beautiful chandelier and a lovely mural over our king-size bed. We honestly didn't want to leave. The service was outstanding. We ordered room service on our last morning, and while it is pricey, it was worth it. The bed was uber comfortable, the linens crisp and clean and delicious. We also loved the lobby, which is fancy in an old, grand hotel sort of way. We did a wine tasting at the wine cellar which was outstanding. The wines were terrific and the staff very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: dc10away
Reviews.Content: My 21-year old daughter and I stayed at the St. Regis Grand from October 9-12. I had stayed once before and again had a wonderful experience. I wanted a safe hotel with a great location for our trip and this property fit the bill. The St. Regis is located very close to the train station in Piazza Republica and just a couple of blocks from the metro. We loved shopping at the Japanese department store, Mitsukoshi, which is only a block away as well as walking up and down Via Nazionale. Our room rate came with a buffet breakfast which was the perfect way to start the day. The service is impeccable and the concierge staff couldn't have been kinder in recommending restaurants for us to visit. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, unless you want breakfast in bed!”
Reviews.Author: Sscottthomas
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our trip to Rome mainly because it had a decent gym and, given that Italians are not prone to exercise, that's quite hard to find. The room was comfortable, the bed and linens good and the decor pretty enough but there really wasn't room to swing a cat and the bathroom was even more constricted. We didn't mind that too much because we literally only slept and showered there. We didn't order so much as a cup of coffee at the hotel, since the feeling that one was being majorly ripped off, was unpleasantly prevalent. The breakfast cost about $80 per person and the Internet was $15 or $20 a day. Across the street we got our coffee and breakfast in the mornings and tea and cannoli in the afternoon, for a fraction of the price and in a much more authentic atmosphere. The location was excellent; we walked EVERYWHERE from there. The service at reception and the Bell Captain was also impeccable. The gym was quite nice for a hotel gym and served our purposes well. We got an excellent price on the actual room and were, overall, very happy with our choice. We would stay there again if we needed the gym but we would also like to try some other places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1215
Reviews.Content: If you don't like to explore a city on foot, then maybe the "perfect location" description doesn't apply for you. For my husband and me, and our two European friends who joined us from Germany, this location near the Piazza della Republica was absolutely perfect. Close to Ancient Rome, close to the beautiful Via Veneto, and the Borghese Gardens and a 10 -15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. The service was excellent, exactly what you expect when you stay at a St. Regis. The front desk staff bent over backwards to see to it our stay was nothing but excellent. (we had some trouble with the reservation before we arrived, no fault of the St. Regis) The breakfast was delicious, the cappuccino was the best we had. It would be hard to return to Rome and NOT stay at this hotel again. We all LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Tired lady”
Reviews.Author: Popect
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is getting on the tired side. Rooms are small and in need of some reinvestment. Lobby, and common areas as well. Not the best value for a high end hotel. Great staff and very good service can't make up for the age.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all.”
Reviews.Author: DRace
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous, old hotel with tastefully updated rooms and loads of charm. It is in a wonderful location and our room had a lovely view. The room we had offered a beautiful blend of old world charm with modern touches. The room was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous and also roomy, with every extra imaginable. The lobby and reception area were elegant and comfortable. The dining area off the lobby was also beautiful and the breakfast, which was included with our room, was fabulous. The service was excellent and everyone most helpful. Would recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Amapola24
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, could not ask for more. Very expensive. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Great Hotel, Service Not Meeting Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: crumycat
Reviews.Content: Total Nights: 3 Room Type: Imperial After wanting to stay at a St Regis hotel for sometime now, I finally got the chance to in Rome. I was very excited and had very high expectations from the jewel in the Starwood hotel chains crown (www.spg.com). We arrived at the St Regis by taxi and had to lug our bags out of the taxi ourselves until the bell desk finally realized that we were checking in and then came running to our service. Maybe they there not used to a pair of Aussies turning up in shorts and a t-shirt? We were welcomed by one of the front desk staff and were promptly checked in. Very efficient but not overly friendly as I would have expected. We were then escorted to our room by the front desk member and welcomed to the St Regis. So far so good. After arriving to our room I wanted to iron a shirt for dinner. To my surprise there was no iron and then found out they were not permitted in the rooms. Apparently this is due to a fire regulation, but I'm not sure about this as the regulation was quickly followed by details of how the hotel can iron our clothes (for a fee of course). After spending €60 on pressing I was not impressed. We called the front desk to advise them to collect the ironing. After and hour they had not appeared so we went out for dinner expecting someone to have collected them by the time we returned... 2 1/2 hours later we return to find our un ironed clothes!!! After a quick call to the front desk....all sorted. I would have expected flawless service when we were paying > €500 a night. Breakfast was fantastic. You can have the buffet with freshly cooked eggs or you can order from the menu. One of the better hotel buffets I have seen but I'm glad the cost was included in our room. The overall service at this hotel was not online with the €500+ a night we were spending and this left me feeling a little disappointed in the St Regis brand as I probably would have got better service at the Westin hotel. The room and bathroom were extremely large and there was plenty of space. There was plenty of towels and band name amenities on hand. The hotel maids also ensured we had plenty of everything and refreshed our towels and amenities during nightly turndown service. On our final nite the complimentary bottle of wine and cheese was a good gesture and one I've not seen many hotels offer. Overall I rate this hotel 7/10 (and 7/10 as compared with other Starwood hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: starg8r
Reviews.Content: When they say five star, they mean five star! What a beautiful hotel! The staff from the bell boys to the concierge to the house staff to the room service staff were top notch! Our room was unavailable when we arrived, so they offered to store our luggage while we went to sightsee. (If I could rate this service higher than five, I would.) Our room was huge with an equally large bathroom filled with amenities (shampoo, conditioner, soaps, robes, slippers, etc.) It is perfectly located within a very short walk to the train station and a short distance from the Spanish Steps in one direction and the Forum & Colisseum in the other direction. If you can afford this five star hotel, I highly recommend it. Wonderful!!! Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jojostarbux
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a landmark building conveniently located within walking distance to the rail station. Skip the continental breakfast, it is overpriced and there are many cafes in the area. The concierge was incredibly helpful and accommodating. My only complaint is that when we returned to our room late one the afternoon, the door was not pulled shut and housekeeping never finished their cleaning. The bedding was all over the place. I made a call to housekeeping and no one arrived promptly. I walked down to the concierge who accompanied me back to the room to see the appalling condition. I was most concerned about security being the door was left open and I had valuables in the room. The concierge was very accommodating and bought us drinks in the beautiful lobby bar while our room was tidied. She then sent up a nice bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us I am afraid...location is poor”
Reviews.Author: jerseybloke
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Starwood hotel that I have stayed in; Rooms are over the top, tiles chipped and in room entertainment very expensive. We had no impression of feeling like a valued guest, and we examined as to our type of booking. View from the rooms were very poor. In room dining ok, a bit sluggish. The location is not where you want to be - handy for tour bus but that's it. I will stay somewhere else next time - it is the first time that I didn't get great advice from TA:(

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, very comfortable, not great location”
Reviews.Author: scarlett81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis Grand Rome for an anniversary trip. it is an old fashioned luxury hotel. Very beautiful, charming and plush. The room had antique style furniture, artwork, etc. The room was huge, the bathroom was huge. It had lovely double windows that opened up with a little bench to watch the street below. The paint on the windows and bathroom is old and chipped but that is Italy and adds to the ambience. We had a superior king room with the extra butler service-which was awesome. The butler was so nice and helpful. Getting complimentary coffee and tea in the afternoon was the best little extra after a long morning touring Rome. We had fruit, a bottle of wine and cheese sent to our room as an extra perk also. It was so nice. The quality of the food was very good also. The downsides would be that this hotel sits on top of one of the hills of Rome and is a bit out of the way, and a bit isolated from attractions. (of course this is no fault of the hotel) The walk down the hill into Rome is lovely-5-10 mins to the Spanish Steps. But up the hill after a long day is pretty tiring. Taxi service is Rome is excellent though. We never had a problem getting one. The mattress was very uncomfortable-not the worst we've had. But from our experience in all of Italy, hard mattresses seem to be the thing. An extra pillow or two and we slept fine. The only real "complaint" I can give is that an extremely important piece of luggage for my medical equipment was "taken" from my room. I travel with a very delicate medical machine and when I fly it needs to be packed in a special case. That case was taken from our room. I can't believe someone would steal it, because I don't know how someone would even know what it is or what they'd use it for. But I have NO clue how a maid could think it was trash when it is clearly marked. I don't know which is worse! We found out it was gone when we were packing to leave. We had a train to catch in 40 mins. Management came, they were very apologetic and within 10 minutes they brought up a small bag for me to fit the machine into. I'm sure this is a freak thing. And although there is no excuse for this happening, they tried to fix it very quickly. So other than that we had a wonderful stay. I probably would stay at a hotel closer to the center of Rome next time. But all in all it is a nice accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will come back”
Reviews.Author: vuittoniti
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel earlier this year and absolutely loved it. The room is a nice size, bathroom is really clean with separate tub and shower. Very big for European standard. It's a little bit pricey but it's definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good - Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Streetfeeds
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here. First night in a very beautiful deluxe room morning we were woken up by loud metalic banging at 6 am. Turns out we were right under the gym which opens at 6 or 630. They moved us to an equally lovely room and we had a teriffic next few nights. The restaurant is great there - their breakfast buffet was wonderful and dinner was convenient and much better than expected. Now a few nit picks - the service is a bit spotty (except in restaurant which was flawless) especially the supposed butler service. Some maintenance to the common areas is in order - clangy elevator, loose interior marble step which had to be roped off, drab courtyard with desperate need of paint. Although the rooms are truly beautiful and comfortable and clean, certain minor mechanical maintenance to the rooms such as electrical and plumbing is very called for. The concierge sent us to a very average quite distant restaurant which I also heard them recommend to others. We found much better places on our own.

Reviews.Title: “This was my favorite hotel during our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: fdeva13
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Rome was my favorite stop during our honeymoon. We traveled to Venice, Rome & Paris among other cities and the St. Regis was second to none. The hotel is beautifully decorated, centrally located and the staff is very attentive without being intrusive. We booked our stay through Lorraine Travel & they informed the hotel that we were on our honeymoon. I'm sure this extra touch added to the great time we had in Rome. Upon arriving, we were kindly greeted by the staff. After being shown our suite, which was absolutely amazing, we began to unwind with the complimentary champagne, refreshments and gift bag. We were told that our suite came with a butler and he was truly wonderful to us during our stay. One of the many things he would do for us was the wake up service. Instead of waking up to an alarm or phone call, Francesco (our butler) would open up our curtains allowing the sun light to come in. He would then set up our tea/coffee/juice and leave a newspaper for us, all without being intrusive.
