When it came time to start our day & see the city with its many attractions (close to the vatican, coloseum, trevi fountain, spanish steps, etc.), Francesco would advise us to either walk, talk a cab or use the metro. Breakfast at the hotel was great. Again, not your usual toast, bagel & juice. They set up a full breakfast buffet, complete with an omelet station & mimosas. The chef & waitstaff were very friendly and endearing, so much so that they would remeber where we had visited and recommended other places to see. By the time we got back to the hotel after our excursions, Francesco would be well on his way to setting up tea time in our room. After relaxing a bit, we would head down stairs and speak with the helpful concierge who would recommed places for dinner. They made reservations for us each time & ensured a great table. Their recommendations were exquisite! After walking off dinner and desert around town, we would head back to the room to get some sleep on one of the most amazing beds ever. It was like sleeping on a cloud. All in all, we had a marvelous time in Rome made even more spectacular for having chosen to stay at the St. Regis. Lorraine Travel really outdid themselves with this recommendation, so much so that we contacted both the hotel & the agency to express our thanks.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL FACILITY WITH IMPECCABLE SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: domerx4
Reviews.Content: The expense is worth it- you feel like royalty and are treated as such.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel from a bygone era”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: Lovely, gorgeous, old world, opulent, classy, just a few words to describe this hotel. We stayed for four days and had a glorious connecting suite with a living area in between our rooms. The staff was helpful, brought us champagne, fruit, wine, cheese, candy, cookies, tea, coffee at different times all included in the room rate. The beds were fabulous, the architecture and every aspect of the rooms and bathrooms first rate and luxurious. The bed linens felt like silk and the air conditioning was wonderful after a hot day in Rome. I really can't find a fault here aside from the fact that the hotel is a bit out of the way from the really touristy areas and make for a bit more walking or a longer metro ride but totally fine since we were able to walk from Termini station to the hotel as well as walk from the hotel to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc. There is also a closer metro station a two minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful and substantial, where else in Rome does made to order omelettes for breakfast?? Really, European hotels are infamous for their cup of coffee and piece of bread and this was a full breakfast. Cappucino were delightful. If we had stayed longer we would have availed ourselves of the wake up butler service where the butler assigned to your room wakes you up with coffee or tea and opens all the curtains and makes you feel like a Lord of the Manor. You cannot go wrong staying in this jewel box of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classiest hotel in the forum area”
Reviews.Author: JohnPaolo
Reviews.Content: I would advise you to stay here at least once in your life

Reviews.Title: “Opulent Old World Charm ...Location alittle off center”
Reviews.Author: SHE81
Reviews.Content: We experienced very good service. Upon checking in we were shown to a room at the far end of the hotel that we did not like becausue it had an old looking dreary bathroom and dingy decor . They were very nice and switched our room to a lovely exquisitly decorated room with a stunning bathroom and shower to match. They have great soaps and lotions at the hotel. The location is alittle off from the center of Rome. If you dont mind walking alittle extra this shouldnt be a problem. Decor of the hotel is pluch and elegant. The hotel is very well kept. Our beds were super comfortable The concierge was helpfull and recomended a good restaurant. They also were good at explaining were we had to go. There is no free wi fi and we had to pay 8 euros. We did not eat at the hotel becasue breakfast seemed too expensive and the restaurant we didnt know too much about. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with a very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: FinickyTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed and made comfortable at this landmark hotel after an overnight flight. The front desk manager was kind enough to provide us with some cappuccino and gave us a great overview on how to walk the city and find out way back in the time before our room was ready. Very convenient location for interesting strolls...near the train station and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: trish274
Reviews.Content: Just got back after spending a week at the St. Regis. The hotel is situated in a great spot. Not far from Termini train station, subway, the via veneto, even McDonalds!! We had a great view of Piazza Republica from our window ( room 339). Service was exceptional. Monica, the hotel lobby butler was a pleasure. Beds were comfy. Room was clean, spacious. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “St Regis Roma -The Birthplace of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: I will note bore you with details on how plusher luxurious this hotel isbecauseyoucan read that description on line aswell as the hotel pictures. The property is one of the best Starwood properties worldwide and I have visited over 200 of them. This property is close to Piazza Esedra or the Repubblica metro line on Linea A (Red line one stop from Terminitowards the Vatican). It is also next door to S Maria Della Vittoria where you can go Inside and attend Mass, light a candle or just sit and gaze upon Bernini's the Ectascy of St Teresa. The hotel is very quiet. This is good since you are next to a church and on a piazza with three churches. I like hearing the bells in the morning and evening. I know about il pane di Genzano but do not know a Hermes scarf from a 3euros scarf on the street. The hotel has a personal shopper service and I think my wife will like her scarf and Bottega Veneta handbag. There are 168 rooms and each have a hand painted fresco of a famous church, fountain, or site in Rome. Everything works as if new. This hotel was one of the first Starwood properties to be renovated. The cooling or AC is great and I have kept my room like a meat locker.....this works since my wife likes to cuttlefish and play :) to keep warm. I recommend this tactic and blame it on the Italian AC system. The towels are huge and you also have linen towels and the bathrooms are all marble and complete with a magazine holder. My wife says that the magazine holder is a bidet and I have yet to figure out if you sit in it or straddle it or if you are supposed to insert the family jewels into the water. There are no instructions and glad we had a shower. I would love to know do you sit facing the water knob or away from it? Has anyone ever invented one of these so called bidets with a hand held hose to direct the water? My wife says enough on this topic. Last year, the toiletries in the hotel were exclusive scent by Laura Tonnatto and this year they are even better with toiletries by Laboratorie Remede and are so much better than il Pino di Sylvestre and has a mint or menthol scent. It is quite refreshing. The TV has many channels to choose from other than RAI Uno, Due, TRE. :). There are sky movie channels, sports, news and even Arabic channels. You can choose to watch CNN, BBC, EuroNews or Al Jazeera. All TVs are flat panel and are on swivel bases. I highly recommend that you get the butler service. The butler service is a feature of the St. Regis and there's nothing like getting a nightcap drink or wakeup call with hot pastries and cappuccino delivered by your personal butler. My butler was Gianni and he is the best one ever. I think he has established the standard and I love the long coat tails, bow tie, white gloves and silver traythateverything is delivered on. The bell desk and consierge staffs are also great. When I arrived, one of the other reception clerks recognized me and welcomed us bAck to the hotel. Monika (di Firenze) checked us in and our room was not ready and offered us a drink in the lobby (coffee or cappuccino). I ordered caffe freddo which is now ordered by the name caffe shakerato. The hotel does turndown service and refreshes towels which is a plus. Cannot recommend a better hotel and I have stayed at Hotel Flora, Hotel Excelsior and Hotel Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: Spend a short one night on the way to a Crystal Cruise. One of the best hotels in Rome and probably in Europe. Superb room with classic decor, amazing bed and fantastic bathroom. You will not want to leav that room. The breakfast is out of the ordinary, first class ingridients food fot of a Roman Emperor. The hoetl is within waking distance of many sights and have a great concierge. This will be our home next time in Rome. If you can afford it, its well worth the price, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: prg210
Reviews.Content: As soon as we stepped into this hotel, we felt we were catered to. The staff was very friendly and remembered our names, which is very important. The breakfast buffet was a little costly but worth it, as they had a great variety of great food.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel; Somewhat Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: SoCalDoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the St Regis and truly enjoyed ourselves. The staff was excellent and the room was HUGE (even by US standards). A few comments on the hotel and Rome in general: * The location is ideal. The Republica subway stop is 1/2 block away and only two stops from Spanish Steps/Villa Borghese; and 4 stops (w/transfer) to the Coliseum/Forum. * The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the Termini train station. Certainly an easy walk if you want to save a few bucks on a taxi. * The staff was unbelievable; everyone from the doorman to the cleaning staff was very professional. * I can't speak to the hotel food. It was VERY expensive and there are PLENTY of alternatives within walking distance. * The concierge expects a tip when making recommendations. I thought this was a little ridiculous. We avoided him/her. * The fitness facility is the nicest we encountered during our two weeks in Italy. * Buy a Roma Pass. I won't get into all of the benefits here, but it is worth every Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Decadence at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: RDMWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: I had two nights in Rome and I decided to splurge. The hotel, and staff did not let us down! With paying a premium at a high end place like this you would expect nothing less and they delivered. The lobby is well kept and has a nice restaurant. We experienced breakfast there and was a mix of both American and European delights. The first omelette bar I see in Europe! A working 100+ year old elevator made us walk past the newer modern one just to enjoy a bit of the old world. Concierge was able to recommend the places to eat and best time of the day to see a site. The room were large and comfortable. Sleep quality at it best, great showers, it's all in the room. My only two real issues with the hotel was having to pay for Internet at €600 per night you would at least expect free. Valet parking is €50 and with no parking around you don't have a choice. Skip the rental, since the city doesn't really have much parking anyway. Would I return, only on a romantic trip with my wife, otherwise I would find something else more central to where I needed to be. A taxi is needed for most areas to visit. The city as the hotel are magical. I am already craving a trip back!!!

Reviews.Title: “When in the Papal City, let the Saint Regis host you...”
Reviews.Author: JEANCHIOTTI
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in this wonderful hotel and loved it; the staff was genuinely friendly and professional at the same time, always attentive and quick to address all your needs. We particularly appreciated the excellent services from Massimo, Luca, Cristiano & Monica; we felt as if we were among friends whose only common wish was to see us enjoying our stay thoroughly. I loved the Perrier Jouet served at breakfast, there is nothing like a fresh French bubbly to give you the energy you need to walk busy & hot Roman sights in July. C'e vediamo St Regis! Jean Chiotti

Reviews.Title: “Effortless Elegance”
Reviews.Author: rimen
Reviews.Content: Absolute luxury. If you can afford it, I would highly recommend it. Not only were the rooms nice, but the hotel staff was extremely nice. They made dinner reservations for us and contacted our tours to make sure that everything was confirmed. Breakfast buffets were really good. While the restaurant may be a little expensive, there are several restaurants in the area to try so you can save some money by going out instead of getting meals at the restaurant. We had several tours booked w/ Carani Tours, and lucky for us, their office was right across the street. So all those early morning tours were very easy for us as we just crossed the street. The hotel was centrally located in that we could walk one direction towards the Collosseum or walk in the other direction towards Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Both were about a 10-15 minute walk. Tip for Italy: there are several outdoor water fountains all throughout the country. The water is extremely safe to drink as its completely treated. So if you buy a water bottle, you can refill it or bring one with you, you'll save a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, a perfect oasis in the middle of it all.”
Reviews.Author: Jwhite8040
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, outstanding service, terrific location. You couldn't feel more pampered if you were a king. The room was beautiful, the staff, perfectly wonderful, the extra touches elevate this place beyond your expectations. If aren't happy here, maybe you just aren't the kind of person who can be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jnjkang
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the quality of the staff. Monica Zanghirato The Lobby Butler was extremely helpful. Thank you for making our stay even more enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “The St Regis in Rome was great”
Reviews.Author: tanjakrucker
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Hotel, due to being SPG members we got a really good offer and decided to go for the St Regis. When we arrived ive got to say the hotel is stunning but the entrance area is fairly small and we didnt even recognise it when we got there. Once we where inside it was stunning, the hotel deocr is just fabolous, unfortunately the staff should be a little bit friendlier. Our trip also fell on our anniversary so we asked the concierge service to recommend us a restaurant that is not overfilled with tourist and he did a fantastic job, the concierges were always friendly and helpful, they just need to smile a little more.The location is very good, next to a metro station and everything is really in walking distance(if your good on your feet). Our rooms faced the inner courtyard which wasnt a problem, it was very quite and ever so clean, shampoo and everything else was filled up everyday and everything else was just spotless!! On our way back the hotel also offered us the hotel car transfer which is 10 euros cheaper to the airport than a usual taxi and probably safer (knowing the italian taxi drivers). All in all, the hotel was great just a shame the lobby isnt bigger and doesnt have a nice seating area, but i would def go there again, anytime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mahomedix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a tremendously convenient location and is extremely well decorated and appointed. The staff were courteous and very obliging as well. The lobby areas are stunning and one could spend hours admiring the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every sense of the word.”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonersrtw
Reviews.Content: The word "ok" is the best that can be assigned to this hotel. Check in staff was lovely however, it is a fairly dirty hotel. The couch next to the elevator is stained and it looks like it has been for awhile. The windows in the room have been repainted several times and everything just seemed a little dirty. As a Spg platinum member and one with an ambassador they didn't seem to treat me any better than a leisure traveller. Furthermore, it was my honeymoon and they didn't even bother with a basic amenity (I would have been happy with a card). The only acknowledgement came from check in when they said congratulations. This is not a 5 star. But few things are in Rome. I'm not sure I would ever return here

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment - I would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: This was the first (and last) time I had stayed at a St Regis hotel and unfortunately, I had built up so many expectations in my head before arriving at the hotel, none of which were met. I had imagined that the hotel would be in some lovely square surrounded by beautiful buildings - boy was this not the case! The front of the hotel is so unassuming, I think that we would have just walked by it. The buildings around it are not pleasant but it is quite close to the main train station, right near a tube stop, la repubblica, which is a good location for accessing the train station etc. but the area felt incredibly unsafe. There were so many beggars in the area and at night we felt like we had to take a taxi everywhere. I appreciate that this is outside the control of the hotel but I feel it is worth mentioning, especially for single ladies travelling to this area. Furthermore, the hotel is really far from the main sights. You will certainly end up either using public transport or taking a taxi. The hotel is not worth the money that I spent. Check-in was a nightmare - unlike in most hotels, where you sign a sheet of paper etc., the St Regis has chosen to go high-tech and have an electronic pad that you complete check-in on. Sadly, it just didn't seem to work and the front desk agent admitted that they were having problems with this system. Get rid of it then! Anyways, what felt like hours later, check-in was completed and we were walked to our room. The room was a complete disappointment. Scuff marks all over the walls, a tiny room and the view was of an office block - charming! The minibar had not been replenished and when we called the front desk, we were told that the issue would be remedied. This never happened throughout our stay. The laundry form had already been filled out and when we asked for a new one, this request was also ignored. On the plus side, the room was very quiet and the amenities in the bathroom were lovely and of a very high quality. In one of the common areas of the hotel, we spotted a half eaten apple left on a table. Hours later when we walked by this area again, it was still there. The concierge was friendly but totally useless. We asked where we should go for an aperitif and he and his colleague couldn't recommend anywhere! Unbelievable! Also, we asked for help with the public transport system and were told that we should just take a taxi. The lobby area of the hotel is beautiful and we did eat there and were very impressed. Overall, the hotel is not good value and if you are staying here, I would not make the mistake of having high expectations as it really will not live up to them!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: set_designer
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Rome is a wonderful affair with all the voluptuous charm of an old-world Grand hotel. We occupied Deluxe Room 222 to the inner courtyard. The room is not very big but the décor is exceptionally rich and beautiful, spotless clean and with a fantastically comfortable bed. Carved wall panels, leaf golden details, Murano chandeliers and individual (a little naïve) wall paintings with Roman monuments create a really palatial ambience. Public areas are gorgeous, opulent and extremely well maintained. Staff could not be more friendly, helpful and efficient. There are few back-drops: - The uninspiring view to the inner courtyard. The maintenance and care of the inner courtyard is just a shame and our window view was very uninspiring. Such a contrast to the rest of the hotel! - The diversity of lounges and public spaces – which are part of the ambience of traditional Grand hotels - is limited as they are closed for conference business; which gives a little strange feeling of conference hotel. - There are no a fresco spaces and the wonderful lobby is a little too dark to be inviting during the day. - The location is a little off the points of interest - an disadvantage which Grand Hotel shares with the properties in Via Veneto / Ludevico area. - Fitness room is a little dull and options are limited. Altogether St. Regis Grand Hotel Rome is a gorgeous and extremely pleasant– but also quite expensive – affair in one of the most beautiful cities of the world. Looking forward to come back!

Reviews.Title: “OMG - talk about being pampered!”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon ended with a stay at the St Regis Grand in Rome. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite, which was awesome! We even had our own Butler, on call. The room was large and comfortable, with a TV in both the parlor and bedroom. The bathroom was large. We were on a corner, so it was a bit noisy, but who could complain with the surroundings? We were close to a metro stop, which made it convenient to get to other tourist sites (but watch your pockets on the crowded metro - my husband had his picked!). The staff was awesome, and Le Grand Bar in the lobby was nice for a drink and to listen to piano music. Very soothing...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel built on ancient...”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Fareham
Reviews.Content: Beautiful classic hotel built on ancient Roman spa. Not cheap, but can get deals on rooms but food and drink vert expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: TravelforChow
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Platinum members and have been to numerous Starwood properties globally both for business and for pleasure. In trying to decide between the top properties in Rome (the St Regis, Hotel Eden and Westin), we were attracted to the St Regis's proximity to Termini since we were doing extensive sightseeing via public transportation. While our stay was overall fine enough, the St Regis was overpriced (20000 points) for what it offers, and cannot compare to comparable flagship properties such as the Grand Bretagne in Athens. We had two adjacent rooms as we were travling with extended family, with one of the two being a suite. We found the setup to be much less thoughtful than the Westin which had a huge shared living room for their suite. The St Regis suite was small, and reeked of cigarette smoke even though it was a non smoking room. The shower was a tiny triangle (half of a port-a-potty size), and they did not replaced the shampoo and conditioner for three days and eventually I had to call. The decor and facilities were ok but not impressive. In all, it is overpriced at 20000 points.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dinatalm
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel and were greeted and walked to the registration desk by an extremely friendly staff member I was thrilled with the St. Regis. Our room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the cleaning service was excellent. When we have stayed at higher-end hotels in the past I have been disappointed because some of the staff have been a bit pompous and rude, but not the St. Regis. The St. Regis staff was gracious, helpful and each person we dealt with had a wonderful personality. The hotel is located near the Termini, which was great for us because we were headed out of Rome after four days, but the location may not be appealing to others. Although the location was a good central location for walking and catching the subway and train. One tip: When you are in a cab be sure to say both the St. Regis and the Grand Hotel. The hotel was the Grand Hotel (no St. Regis) for many years so it is taking locals time to get use to the name change.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: SPGtourist
Reviews.Content: This Regis I am sad to report is not nearly up to the brand name of the hotel. Rooms are very small, bathroom is very small but well appointed. Two shoved together twins to make a king is a European thing, but is a little underwhelming in this day and age of King size mattresses. Location is good, the hotel presents well from the lobby. No coffee in the rooms, which is a Regis thing, but still annoying. Tried to ask for a iron and ironing board and was told that they don't do that---please use our laundry service, thank you very much. I was denied reservations to Vivendo after I had been prompted by the greeting email to please book. The entire evening aparently was sold out. Maybe true, but a guest you would think that they could work something out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaMarie16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel using Starwood points for one night before leaving for our cruise. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Although I used points, we were upgraded to a huge one bedroom suite with a king bed, one and a half baths, sitting room, two flat screen tvs, two closets (one walk-in in the full bath), separate shower and footed tub. The room was ridiculous! I also used points to stay at the Marriott Rome but the service and point value for this hotel is far superior. If you have both points to use, I definitely recommend the St. Regis. It is a little off the main street (the Marriott is on a famous street lined with several fancy and boutique hotels), but the St. Regis is close to the train station and all the major sites (we walked everywhere). The concierge was also helpful and recommended a fantastic local restaurant and made our reservations. Will definitely stay here again next time we're in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels503
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights on cash+points during Iceland volcano chaos; it's a relative bargain if you use points. Location is very good, with easy access via subway, train, bus, taxi and walking. Train from airport is about 14 euros + 1/2 mile walk. Cab ride from airport is about 35 euros. The hotel was gorgeous and provided an excellent experience. We were very pleased with our room and the hotel's service. We arrived 1-day late due to the volcano; the hotel refunded that night no questions asked. The hotel also allowed us to add 2-nights to the reservation on cash+points. I am SPG Gold. We checked in a couple hours early. Marcos at the front desk said they wanted to prepare a deluxe room for us, and then bought us cappuccinos. Monica, the lobby manager, then approached us and spent 20 minutes drawing walking routes for us on map she provided. The lobby isn't huge, but it's very nice. The staircases are also very classy. The rooms are each unique, with classic furniture and artwork. Our deluxe room was fantastic. It had a large room and bathroom with a great shower, tub, and heated bidet. The courtyard view was fine, albeit unimpressive. They gave us 1-4 free bottles of water per day. They gave us 2 small boxes of chocolates. Like most really fancy hotels, room service and mini-bar are very expensive. There is no free Internet in the hotel. They offer Internet for about 15 euro per day or 4 euro per hour. The hourly option is palatable, whereas the daily option is too expensive. The turn down service was nice. Things that were less than perfect: 1) No free Interent in lobby or business ctr. 2) Our keycards locked out on us twice during our stay 3) The shower leaked slightly. 4) DVD Player doesn't play Region 1 DVDs. And a Region 2 DVD we have didn't play correctly. 5) A couple other slight inconveniences. 6) No pool. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Less here than meets the eye....”
Reviews.Author: nowornever
Reviews.Content: and it is eye candy. However, underneath all the puffy cloud & angel ceilings it's an old hotel with issues. They were nice enough to upgrade our Starwood Point stay to the top floor facing the courtyard. Unmentioned was the fact that our room was directly under the fitness center so we did our treadmill and weights vicariously. The shower was plugged completely, the TV remote was missing, there was no bottle opener for the comp. water that required a bottle opener, the "gourment bar" drawer was completely empty. These things just shouldn't happen in a 5 star hotel. On the plus side, the location is fine & the breakfast buffet is quite nice. If required to pay for a hotel, there are certainly others in the same category which would provide better value, in my opinion. Proceed with caution on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional luxury”
Reviews.Author: AdaminDC
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand is a world class hotel with gorgeous rooms and extraordinary service. It is centrally located, with easy access to most tourist areas. The guest rooms are exceptionally comfortable and unusually spacious, with luxurious furnishings and large marble bathrooms. The public areas are impressive. The entire staff is professional, friendly and attentive. The restaurant is first class. In short, everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A truly grand experience”
Reviews.Author: fruitystu
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all of the top hotels in Rome we chose St. Regis and were definately not disappointed. The interior of the hotel is amazing and the bar and the staff are always available to meet your needs. With the flight disruption we had to extend our stay and the hotel were very supportive with this. The room was magnificant and the bathroom extremely spacious and the bed is the most comforatble we have ever slept in. While it is an expensive hotel (around 10 euros for a coke) we did not eat or drink there instead venturing to cheaper nearby cafe's and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjdm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriends when we traveled all over Italy a while back. When I checked in, I was upgraded to the suite (maybe because I had a status with starwood hotels?). Room was gourgeous and loved the bathroom! Amenity was all by Hermes (back then)! Good thing was that I didn't see any children running around so overall, it was quiet!! I would recommend to book the one with breakfast included. It's definately worth it! If you want to have it in the room, you can just switched over to room service instead. I was very impressed with the service and how fantastic my stay was, I emailed hotel's GM after I came back home. I got response right away! It is a bit expensive, but every penny is deginately worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie709
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we could have expected and well worth the price. My husband and I spent the first leg of our honeymoon here. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff were courteous and helpful. They even upgraded our room. The bed was SUPER comfortable - a sweet sleeper bed, no doubt. The room was very large with a separate sitting area with a walk-in closet that even had a vanity. The bathroom was much larger than what you'd find in any hotel in Europe and the decor was elegant. We felt like royalty. We accessed the internet (charge) through the television screen. Sometimes the connection was slow, so I'd recommend going down to the business center or an internet cafe. The hotel was walking distance (at most 30 min walk) to trevi fountain, pantheon, spanish steps. But you can visit these sites all at once since they're so close to each other. We also walked to the forum and Colosseum ... although the walk was further to get out there. The hotel was also walking distance to the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: minsam
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at the St. Regis and must say that it is one of the nicest hotels I ever visited. Monica, from the hotel, emailed me ahead of my visit and asked it there were any special circumstances. I explained that we would be arriving quite early but not to fuss as 10:00 am is well before normal check in. I also informed them that my wife and traveling to celebrate our anniversary. When I arrived I was escorted to the front desk by the doorman where Andrea, the reservation attendant, told me that room was ready and that since it was our anniversary they upgraded us to a junior suite. It was a fantistic room. I would say the staff visited the room four times a day taking care of things. The food was great, and the hotel is extremely close to the train station. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a first class experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Elegance”
Reviews.Author: katerachel15
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a ten day trip to Italy and it is hard to decide which of the three hotels we stayed at was the best. Each one had it's individual character and charm and all three made us feel like honored guests. The St Regis is the Grand Dame of hotels in Rome, plush, luxurious, beautifully decorated, regal yet warm and inviting at the same time. From the moment we arrived we felt like the staff cared that we were staying there. The doorman greeted us and showed us to the front desk. Check in was professional yet friendly at the same time and we were escorted up to our rooms by the front desk staff. The hotel is clean, the buffet breakfast was excellent...winning the prize for the best fruit of the three hotels.....be sure to try the poached pears! I would stay at the St Regis again in a heartbeat...in fact we plan to the next time we visit Rome. Thank you St Regis for a wonderful start to a magical trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “can't find a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clefdor
Reviews.Content: YES, it ios expensive, but what a great experince ! lovely decor, great service, excellent hot chocolate in the bar, best breakfast we ever had and very kind concierge. will never foget this place !

Reviews.Title: “very opulent and old school!!”
Reviews.Author: kpyoink
Reviews.Content: stayed here end of march for birthday visit. very old but plush hotel. the main plus regards the service. speedy check in, taken to and shown around bedroom. quick room service. free champagne, chocolates and fruit bowl on arrival. complimentary bottles of water each day. free wine and cheese delivered on one evening. room was good size with big bed and nice bathroom. no view as inward facing. wifi available but 15 euro per day, five star hotels should really be offering this for free. agree not many english tv channels but this is not an english speaking place so cant complain! couple of news channels and italian sky cinema (channel broadcasts up to date movies in english) air con in the room was rubbish which left room too hot, thank god it wasnt summer!!

Reviews.Title: “True Grandeur!”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: What a spectacular hotel. Beautiful public spaces make you truly loose all concept of time and just make you want to stay inside the hotel and forget about Rome. My room was small, but well furnished consistent with the rest of the hotel. There was however nothing really 'amazing' in the room, something you would expect at these prices. Bedding is of very high quality and I had no problem sleeping. This is not an extremely large hotel and what disappointed me was that despite there is so much staff around, I found them a little timid. They sometimes made me feel like I was not there as they went about their business. Don't get me wrong, service is friendly and professional, but a hotel like this should treat its guests like royalty. I like doors to swing open for me by doormen, and everyone greet me. Instead staff was looking away and bellman would push you to the side when coming through with baggage. We are talking details here but still: What is up with receptionists not asking how your stay was, when you check out? Are they afraid you will complain? It makes you feel like it is all about the hotel and now that you are checking out, you are no longer part of it anymore. I would say it is the other way around and I hope management will pick up on this nuance, because it is a huge missed opportunity. This hotel could be a life changing experience and it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Furnished with grandeur, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: Frank21961
Reviews.Content: We felt like we were sleepng in a museum, but it turns out it's not so much fun after all. After a day it felt cold and unwelcoming. Service at the front desk was decidedly poor. Location is not great either, there isn't much to do right outside. We finally decided to check out earlier than planned and stayed at the Westin Exelcior where we had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “This old joint could use some work...a lot of work!”
Reviews.Author: Trevorbord
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand in Rome leaves a lot to be desired in the way of a “luxury hotel”. I checked into the hotel for the beginning of my Thanksgiving vacation in 2009 for a four night stay. My room had its fair share of problems…The room door would not close without being slammed which I found to be a nuisance. The room was plush, however I found it on the smallish side. The shower door did not close completely which made for puddles in the bathroom every time we showered. My over-priced internet lost its connection a few times and I had to reboot the router through the television system. The hotel staff was helpful and the location is kind of auspicious, but two Metro Stations are in close proximity, which played a very important part in my selecting the hotel. There are several nice restaurants in the area, including Trimani Wine Bar. The Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon are within walking distance of the hotel too. In retrospect I probably should have opted for the Westin Excelsior, and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for any other reason than it’s proximity to metro stations. Luckily, I only had to lay my head at the hotel and didn’t have to rely on it for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “rome like you would travel with angels”
Reviews.Author: steve_borsworth
Reviews.Content: guys.. thats a fantastic place - I felt like in a castle and the service quality is amazing. its quite some expensive, but and aweful place to go to if you do have the chance !!! great hotel, great location and rome, I will be back with my wife...

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice for the opulent traveller”
Reviews.Author: heatheratkins
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel coming from our first accommodation, Lord Byron. They were amply staffed to handle the check-in process efficiently, so that made for a quick and pleasant first impression of The St. Regis. From the moment you step foot into this historic building, that feeling of elegance one would expect to find at a St. Regis establishment is immediately brought to attention. 18th and early 19th century Italian and French influences make for authentic, urbane surroundings, perfect for a romantic Roman getaway. We happened to be on our anniversary trip (December), so the lobby was beautifully embellished with an enormous Christmas tree and lavish decorations. Our standard room was spacious (for european standards) and pristine. Hand painted murals adorned the walls, set off by dramatic floor to ceiling draperies and period style furnishings. The bathroom was well lit, with separate bathtub and shower. High quality robes and slippers available for use. Le Grand Bar (down in the lobby) features a notably overpriced menu for the food quality and portion size you receive. We did not try the other two restaurants in the hotel. Overall worthy of a 5 star rating for a large city european hotel, the St. Regis is a nice choice for the opulent traveler. Close proximity to the Roma Termini (train station), and subway access is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: abomb526
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop in Italy for our honeymoon. from the train station, it was a quick 10 minute ride, the hotel is known to some cabbies under a different name (but now I forgot what he said), he found it after calling it in but it was no problem, I loved taking the ride. We immediately were impressed with the grandeur of the hotel & the staff. We were upgraded to a suite and greeted with a bottle of champagne, a really nice touch. Upon venturing, we were a little lost, hotel is huge and there were is much space we felt like royalty in a castle. The gym is hard to get to but most of our stay no one realy went there so we had a lot of privacy. Sometime we had to call for water but they came pretty fast. I did have one problem, on our first day, there was a bald headed young guy at the concierge desk who had an attitude and sent us the wrong way when we asked how to get to the coliseum. We actually walked around Rome for hours only to find the train station a block away and the colisuem about a 20 minute walk. When we walked by the fountain, you can see it from the hotel, yuo make a right and follow the path. We actually saw the movie premiere of "Made of Honor"...lots of stars and that was really cool. they even did a press conference in our hotel! The next time we spoke with him he had the "same chip" on shoulder and my husband wanted to talk to someone but I passed. Why let him ruin our trip so we knew not to go to him again and asked the doormen questions, they were just as informed and willing to help. Just be ready to tip. Rome is awesome, its beautiful and bustling, just as we expected. We toured on foot most days and just got lost in the atmosphere, the steps are somehitng not to miss and afterwards go window shopping, you cant miss this. We also stopped at a deli, got lunch and sat on the steps and ate. There are so many people, be prepared but it was fun. Enjoy, I would go back in a heartbeat, bring money it is not CHEAP. Next time though I think I woud try the Westin, it was a better location with a park across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kmanct
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using Starwood points in Dec-09 and found everything about the hotel luxurious, warm, friendly and ridiculously priced (of course)...especially with the bad US/Euro exchange rate. We had a beautiful room and the hotel seemed nearly empty which probably helped the service. It is in a great location with an easy 5-10 minute walk to subway, restaurants, train station and local sights. I would stay here again in a second, as long as I wasn't paying for it. If you don't buy anything inside the hotel, it works out great.

Reviews.Title: “Another Starwood winner”
Reviews.Author: sassathon
Reviews.Content: The husband and I stayed here on Starwood points+cash on our Honeymoon last May. As the reviewer below notes, it's a total steal if you can stay here on cash + points. This is a beautiful hotel from which we had absolutely no problem walking to and from all of the touristy sites in Rome. If you're lazy or unable to walk due to injury, I don't think a cab from this hotel would be too pricey. We knew the minute we walked into the lobby that we were totally out of our league. We were the only guests not in business attire but hey, it was our honeymoon so we weren't bothered. Despite the fact that we were totally underdressed and paying via cash/points, we were still treated just as well as any other guest, which is a standard for Starwood. Their service is unmatched, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Retraction!”
Reviews.Author: Throbbert
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review of this place that was critical on Aug 5, 2007. I sent my review to the General Manager of the St. Regis, who promptly replied (regrettably, this review should have been written sooner.) But the GM wrote me back and offered me a complimentary stay in the hopes that I would give them another chance. My point is not to highlight the free stay but rather to acknowledge his efforts to rectify a poor situation. He did. We received stellar service upon our return, and while I'm sure we were the couple who had "made the complaint," we were treated with kindness and fairness and enjoyed a pleasant stay over the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not the greatest location”
Reviews.Author: DebKel
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old daughter and I stayed at the St. Regis Grand from December 30 - January 4. The hotel is very lovely, the room is smaller than it looks on the internet photo's, but nice. We were deciding between the St. Regis and the Westin Excelsior, we ended up choosing the St. Regis because of its closeness to the Termini station (my daughter had to meet someone there) the station is just a couple of blocks away. We walked to the Westin Excelsior on our 4th day in Rome to see what it looked like. The area that the Westin is located in is so much better than the St. Regis location. If I would have known this before we booked I would have chosen the Westin hands down over the St. Regis. The Westin is as grand as the St. Regis, and you have a much nicer location. The street is way less busy and a lot wider and prettier. You have lots of restaurants to choose from near the Westin and none to choose from near the St. Regis. The only real restaurant close to the St. Regis is the one in the hotel and the prices are outrageous. Also just down the street from the Westin is the most beautiful park we have ever been in, there are water fountains and statues galore. The park was the best part of the Westin's location. We got great photo's from there and ate good meals in the selection of nearby restaurants. When you do go to Rome, be sure to use the Hop on Hop off buses, I believe there are 3 or 4 different companies operating them. We paid 19 euros per person for 24 hours of travel. Make sure to sit on the upper part of the bus and take the full loop of the drive from start to finish, taking photo's as you go. Then do the loop again and get off at the stops to see the sights. Using the Hop on Hop off bus was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: HeidiLHomme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old and very decedent, we loved it. The room was perfect, the service exceeded expectations from the bar to room service to the spa. The concierge helped with dinner arrangements, a car to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all... GRAND Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dufhel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis Grand Hotel in the first few days of November, our experience was incredible. From check in till check out the staff pampered us and went way out of their way to make our stay as special as the occasion called for (we were on honeymoon). We had a lovely room overlooking Piazza Esedra, true that the rooms a quite small, however the luxury in them is impressive. Lying on the bed feels like being on a cloud and when you get up in the morning you feel like you have slept for a couple of years. The bathroom is very comfortable, it has both shower and bathtub to suit everyone's likes and it has good lighting unlike other hotels I did not have to strain to put my make up on. The breakfast is a luxury, quite pricey but it keeps you going till the evening. When you're there, try the omelettes of Cristiano (the chef) they are delicious! I could go on mentioning all the members of staff I found helpful, but that would have me listing all the members of staff as they were all incredibly friendly. All in all, I think this is the best hotel in the World and a valuable gem in the Starwood collection, the management should be proud of their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: cheetah72
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the St Regis Hotel was part of a pre-cruise stay. We booked the hotel on a friends and famly rate, so overall it was a good value. Had we paid the 400 Euros that was the going rate I would have been slightly disappointed. The hotel is impressive. The bellmen helpful upon arrival, although our driver did help out with the luggage. The check- in process was efficient. The front desk was also efficient, but a little cold. We booked a standard room. The room was clean and met our needs, although it was a little small. The service at the concierge was hit or miss. They seemed annoyed at times when we called with questions, but were pleasant when calling up to the room to alert us of our tours and when our driver was there to pick us up. The lobby bar is impressive. The service in the bar was excellent. Overall, it was a good hotel that meet our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal if you have the Starwood Points”
Reviews.Author: JPBJMB
Reviews.Content: Not sure I would pay full price for this hotel given all the other options in Rome but we had the Starwood points so it made it a no brainer to stay there during our visit. It is a grand hotel and we had a nice & clean but small room. The bathroom was really small. However, since we were not planning on being holed up in our room while we were there it didn't matter. The hotel also had a decent gym and a spa (though I did not use the spa services). We were able to walk from the hotel to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and were close to the subway to get to the farther out places (Vatican etc). Lots of good restaurants nearby. We did not eat or drink at the hotel (too pricey!) and had a nice breakfast everyday at one of the coffee shops around the corner. We stayed at the Westin Excelsior towards the end of our trip and it definitely had a different feel. It had a bigger fitness area and bigger room. It loses the boutique feel of the St. Regis as it seems more geared towards large groups (there was a Mary Kay convention there when we were there as an example). Can't go wrong with the St. Regis when staying in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: FL09Miami
Reviews.Content: After many months of planning for our trip to Europe we started with The St. Regis in Rome, and it was 'EXCELLENT". From the greeting at the Front Desk to the Butler Service we had. It was everything we hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...”
Reviews.Author: vmlehrbaum
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the st regis grand from oct 26 to nov 1st..the hotel was perfect..the staff were so professional and helpfull....paolo the bartender was awesome....the front desk attended to our every need and were all so nice ..we highly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable... but no real 5 stars feeling”
Reviews.Author: jcgeire
Reviews.Content: We were given a Deluxe Room of a good size, nice bed, nice decoration but with an overall impression of fakeness though... Bathroom was excellent, with a shower and a bath, all marble and spotless. The room was on the street side and I found it noisy at night with a constant traffic. I was a bit annoyed by the Sultana raisin left on the carpet during the whole stay (3 nights)... proof that there is no daily hoover of the carpets... disappointing for a 5 stars! Staff at reception was efficient but indifferent. Staff at breakfast was very pleasant. Breakfast was very very good as a matter of fact with a large choice (and it was included in my room rate). Overall I would say that for 400 eur per night, I didn't get the 5 stars feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Most Elegant Hotel for Sophisticated Travelers”
Reviews.Author: foodiesouthflorida
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and the hotel has on both occasions exceeded our expectations. Rooms, Serivce, and Food is truly five star and worth the price compared to other options in Rome. The hotel is an elegant palace, each room is unique and tastefully decoarated with classical art. The staff is eager to go out of their way in a quite professional way. Yes you will pay a price that is well worth the quality you will receive.

Reviews.Title: “If in rome its gotta be the regis”
Reviews.Author: PrakashTilokani
Reviews.Content: Rome was the first leg of our european holiday and i wasnt very sure abt the regis but to my surprise everything was amazing i have to mention the hotel staff always plays an imp role in ur holiday exp and i would rate the regis number one outta all the 10 hotels i stayed during my trip....u gota try the hot chocolate and the tiramisu and ne thing on the menu was gr8....rooms are a bit small for the price but all good things comes in small packages....location was excellent 5 mins from the termini.....we took the hop on hop off which was again jus 2 mins walk from the hotel and indeed had a fantastic stay in rome......wud recommend it ....!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: DonnaDCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 3 nights in late Sept. '09. We walked to the hotel from the Termini train station as it's very close. We were very tired from a long difficult trip. The person who checked us in, Angelo, was not what I would call gracious. He assigned us to a room very far away and so small we had to almost turn sideways to pass between the bed and armoire I called down to ask for another room and taken to a lovely room much closer to the lobby. This room was beautiful and like the ones in the photos. The bathroom is large and modern. but we found the location less than ideal. We might stay there again with points, but not for cash.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: penleyeta
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand hotel is in a great location to tour Rome. We used our Starwood Points (20,000 per night). We had a nice room, big for european standards. The bathroom was large with a full shower, bathtub, toilet and bidet. The room was dark (black out shades) and quiet, and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Don't even think about eating in the hotel, as it's ridiculously expensive. The breakfast looked delicious, but was 41 euros. They definately get you on using any of their ammenities, for instance if you want to use an iron to press your shirt, they don't have them (claim it's a fire hazard), but they'd do it for 10 euros. Are you kidding me, thats $16 to iron a t shirt? Don't use the internet there, find an internet cafe in the area. They don't offer any coffee to guests unless you want to pay 6 euros for an expresso. Oh and don't dare eat the nuts in the mini bar, or that will cost you $11 for a 3oz jar. Would stay there again, but only if I did it with points, otherwise I'd consider it overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: STLSteward
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like staying in a palace! The rooms were beautiful and even had artwork. The bathroom was slightly small but just as amazing as the room. The St. Regis is one of my favorite hotel chains and this was by far the best I have ever stayed at. The hotel is centrally located and very close to the train station. Absolutely worth the splurge!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was spectacular we stayed in the designer suite which was finely appointed, we enjoyed the food at Vivendo.”
Reviews.Author: SytlishTraveler
Reviews.Content: The food was inspired by the Bloody Mary and the ravioli deserved a second helping. The KamiSpa i think its called, massage was relaxing. The staff were very helpful especially at the door. Stefano was the best. Plan to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Location Just a Bit Off”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been decorated in a beautiful Italian style, very comfortable and our room was a reasonable size. Concierge and checking very helpful. Although Rome is a small city it was just off the main tourist attractions and lacked the intimacy of other locations. However, it is possible to walk to all main destinations and it is next to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: hookem2009
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand is a beautiful hotel which is well located one block from Piazza de la Repubblica and a Metro station. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are large and well decorated. The staff is very friendly and very helpful with questions, and recs for activities or restaurants. The hotel is expensive, but you are getting what you paid for. We used Starwood cash and points, and enjoyed every minute of our stay at the St. Regis Grand!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect good service”
Reviews.Author: Vesa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is somewhat well located depending on what you want to see in Rome. Rooms are a bit small and not very quiet, but clean and nicely decorated. Our biggest complains are about the service. Almost every time you had to wait to get to the front desk or concierge and especially front desk was not very helpful. Upon our arrival at about 1pm we still didn't have a room available. Front desk told us that housekeeping would just need to check our room to make sure everything was ok and told us to wait in the restaurant. After waiting for more than an hour I got back to the front desk who told me that the room was still not ready and I was again told that they would come and tell us when the room was ready. Eventually the room finally was ready at about 4pm and I still had to go and ask for it myself. Overall we got the feeling this hotel is not quite up to five star standards. It's a good hotel, but overprised for a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Overly Stiff and Formal”
Reviews.Author: sinner5
Reviews.Content: This is one place I would never stay at again. I found the staff to be very uptight. Everyone has their hand out for a tip... Even the guy who came up to our room to show us how to use the remote expected a tip. The one incident which infuriated me had to do with an ironing board. My wife and I had been invited to attend a Papal Mass at the Vatican and I phoned at 7:30 a.m. to ask for an ironing board and an iron to iron my own shirt and pants. I was informed this was impossible since this was against fire regulations (which seems bizarre because other hotels in Rome were able to accomodate us). I asked them to press the pants and shirt for me and have it ready by 8:30 a.m. They charged me 56 Euros (!) for this service because I had requested it in less than an hour. I tried explaining 8:30 - 7:30 = 1 hour and should get the "reduced" rate of 28 euros... but they wouldn't budge. Personally, I think these European "Grand Hotels" are a crock...

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: theeptraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights after a 10 day cruise. Hotel was elegant and very Roman. The location was good but a little on the outskirt of all the "action". Still easy to get around though, on the underground or bus transportation. Staff were generally pleasant, realize however that Romans are not the nicest people in the world. The first room we were given was a closet. I asked if they have a bigger room (i generally do not complain and I was expecting the room to be small but this was a little too puny). One on the front desk staff, Andres, went out of his way to get us a much larger room (i really think our initial room was a standard room and the second room was the premium we were supposed to be in anyway based on the pictures on the website) while the other front office staff was less accomodating. The concierge prices were generally exorbitant, tours could be booked elsewhere signiifcantly cheaper. When you go to the Forum/Colliseum and Vatican sign up with a walking tour, which gets you out of the long lines and gives you a nice education as well. Carmela, in reservations, was wonderful in helping us set up the room for myself and 2 children (the 5 year old shared our king bed). Overall the staff was nice, since we stayed 5 days they had wine and cheese in our room on different nights.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome - THIS is where we stay!”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaWmn
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with St. Regis at the end of 2004, after spending a week & ringing in the NYE in their spectacular Ritz Ballroom. Everything was organized flawlessly and it was one of the most memorable NYE hotel-parties we've experienced to date (previously having celebrated at La Tour d'Argent, Hotel de Crillon, Eiffel Tower's Jules Verne & Bahamas' Ocean Club to name a few) but we were most impressed with the service and how staff made us feel as if we were the only, and the most important, guests of the hotel that week. On a spontaneous trip to Rome in August of 2007 we decided to spend another 3 nights at this hotel and felt like we were back at home. When deciding where to celebrate NYE 2009, fondest memories of St Regis's Ritz Ballroom came to mind and we booked another 7 nights. Nothing changed from our previous visits. Attentive service, old world atmosphere and the ever-present feeling that no one else but us matters prevailed. Our most recent stay was in August of 2009. We spent another two nights at St. Regis before heading down to Amalfi Coast. Imperial Guest room is rather spacious and has such a comfortable bed that you'll definitely have a hard time rolling out of it in the morning. Junior Suite is obviously much bigger in size and offers a separate living room & powder room. All four stays our room was facing the courtyard and it was very quiet. Breakfast is delicious and I suggest going for it every morning. If you plan on splurging on at least one restaurant while in Rome, make sure it's Le Grand's own Vivendo, which is known for its food (#1 restaurant in Rome) AND its contemporary decor, which takes you into another world as soon as you walk in from a completely different (in a good way) feel of the hotel. The location is very convenient. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to Via Veneto & Termini station, another 5 to Piazza di Spagna. We are always looking forward to returning to St. Regis, hopefully in a very near future.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel - Delivers top quality in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: BeachMax
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you expect from 5 star hotel - great service, rooms, location etc. It is expensive, however, you can prepay and save 30%+ off normal rates => got deluxe room for 230 Euro (including tax). Concierges are EXCELLENT. Many restaurant, museum, sightseeing and transportation reccomendations. Arranged + booked our train ride to naples => take the express first class for 50 Euro - beats flying or driving any day. Rooms vary in terms of size and stlye quite a bit for superior or deluxe (typical of old hotels) - checked in and didn't like the room (too small) - front desk was very helpful - showed us many rooms to choose from (avoiding June - Aug busy season probably helps). Room was realy at 10 AM check-in after international flight - awesome! Lots of outlets and telephones in the room. We were given complementary fruit (peaches, nectarines, grapes, kiwi, apples etc.) and wine and cheese platter during our stay. The room was probably 300+ sq. ft => very nicey furnished. The "King" bed is really two singles pushed together, however, you can request American style one-piece kings as well. The views aren't amazing - so I chose an interior courtyard view to avoid noise (offered exterior as well). The lobby is great - piano music every night. The drinks aren't cheap - but worth it after running around all day in 90+ degree weather with high humidity... the Spa is also quite good. Very few complaints - they could upgrade the toilet paper - a little rough for 5 star hotel - and the shower door fit was not snug - leaked water onto bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Dalsemer
Reviews.Content: St Regis Grand is a beautiful hotel in a central downtown location in Rome. We were able to check in early, about 10:30 AM, which was much appreciated after a long flight. Excellent front desk and concierge arranged for ticket reservations to desired museums. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous but as other reviewers have written, it does come off a little sterile. The room provided was supposedly an upgrade to a Deluxe, which was a nice size and all the proper amenities, including a few complimentary water bottles each day. We had drinks at the bar in the evening, and the staff was very friendly providing us with some appetizers. Some negatives were a slight odor in the hallway of the 3rd floor and our 3rd floor room was still subject to Street noise, which apparently is common in Rome. The location is near the train station and Republic Square. Not ideal for tourists, but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Treeh5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St Regis for 4 nights for the first part of our honeymoon. Found it to be a gorgeous hotel in a great location - just 5/10 minutes walk from the train station and surrounded by great restaurants/cafes. Very grand entrance and bar area. We were upgraded and had a lovely spacious junior suite. We had a problem with a leak in our bathroom ceiling and they dealt with the problem straight away. Eating or drinking in the St Regis is not cheap - 16 euros for one drink! But you expect that in a hotel like this. We didn't fancy spending 17 euros for a cereal breakfast so we went over the road to a nice wee cafe and got a croissant and expresso each for 5 euros. Very tasty. Rome is a great city to walk around and we found this to be in a good location for walking around. Be careful with the taxi drivers tho - the hotel hailed one for us as none were outside and we were charged 15 euros to go to the train station - handed it over before we thought about it stupidly! The concierge were great at recommending good places to eat (Target which is nearby was great) and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and met all of my high expectations.”
Reviews.Author: blondzai
Reviews.Content: From the lobby to the bar to guest suites everything is done grandly and I was delighted that we had chosen this hotel as it is very beautiful. It is three blocks (less than a five minute walk) to the Rome train station so it turned out to be incredibly handy for us to catch our train to Florence/Venice. (It is about a 50 Euro cab ride from the airport which will be standard fare for most of downtown Rome). Across the street, you can catch one of the double decker hop on/off tour buses that takes you to all of the major sites around Rome and is reasonably priced at 25 Euro for three days (and includes the Metro train and bus system). It is about a 5 Euro cab ride from all of the major attractions near the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain etc. The food is expensive, but we had dessert and after dinner drinks in the lounge one night and listened to their terrific pianist who entertained our five year old daughter by playing a few Disney tunes. We found the reception/concierge and bellman to be extremely polite and friendly and it was just an overall great experience. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shiloh62
Reviews.Content: Had the privilege of spending three nights at the St. Regis - Rome this month. What a hotel! The service is above reproach. The room, a deluxe, was fully appointed and decorated exquisitely - right down to the art work. The staff - what can I say about the staff? They were so helpful and everyone spoke English. The only negative - at least for us - was that there was no pool - and you need a pool if you are traveling in Rome during the summer. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive building, less impressive service”
Reviews.Author: TandSReading
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in the St Regis in July this year. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site and also due to it's location. Originally we had planned to stay in the Westin but the reviews persuaded us to try the St Regis. On arrival the hotel looked very impressive, but the reception staff were less than welcoming initially, until a different receptionist took over half way through which did improve things slightly. The room on the 4th floor was lovely and overlooked the courtyard (so was very quiet). The air conditioning worked brilliantly and kept the room nice and cool during what was a very hot week. Before heading out sightseeing we thought it woud be a good idea to get advice from the concierge on tours of the Vatican. This proved to be a waste of time as they only seemed interested in selling extortionately priced tours. Do not be fooled into paying their prices. We used one of the open top tour buses to get to the Vatican and after a couple of minutes getting our bearings found a licenced tour company, down a side street off the right hand side of the Piazza in front of St Peters, who charged us 45 Euros each for a tour lasting two and half hours led by a History of Art graduate that took in the Vatican museum, Sistine Chapel and then led us to St Peters all without any queues. On returning to the hotel we went for a drink in the bar. Sadly it has absolutely no atmosphere and was almost silent. Maybe it is the high bar prices that keep people away. It is a shame as the pianist playing there is very good. There are a couple of very good barmen there though who make great cocktails and proved vastly more helpful than the concierge when trying to make arrangements for transport to a concert on the outskirts of the city later in our stay. Again the concierge only offered a very expensive solution of the hotel car that came with a minimum 3 hour booking period and a cost approaching EUR 300.00! When asked for any other solutions he just shrugged. If you need transport in Rome and don't want to rely on the local taxis I would strongly reccomend Romecabs. Stefano who runs it is incredibly helpful as are his drivers. www.romecabs.com. They are also great for airport runs. This is the first hotel I have ever stayed, irrespective of star rating, that has refused to provide an iron and ironing board. They insist on you using their ironing service which again is ridiculously expensive (10 Euros for a tie and from memory around 20 Euros for a shirt). We opted to stay creased! We travel quite extensively and stay in either 4 or 5 star hotels and this is by the far the most dissapointed I have been left feeling by a hotel. It certainly does not live up to the standard we have come to expect from the Starwood group. We left wishing we had stayed at the Westin as originally planned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobGnewYork
Reviews.Content: Elegant, old world charm. Service and amenities were excellent. Good location. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: From start to finish...From Top to Bottom this hotel does it better than any hotel I have stayed at in Rome. While the stay will cost you a few extra Euros it is money well spent. Rooms are large and ultra plush. Bathrooms are the best in town. Service is personal and attentive. Food is simply great. Health Club very nice also. You will not go wrong with a stay at the St. Regis Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Lux”
Reviews.Author: ecadams
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about it. The restaurant could use some interior decorating help, but the food was excellent, and the waitstaff was even better. Our suite had a butler who made sure we had everything we could need or want. Great location near the train station and metro... but really everything in Rome is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement”
Reviews.Author: tomasAgustafsson
Reviews.Content: The most marvelous place I ever stayed at. The feeling of the Bottega Veneta Suite is something I did not exist - it is where I learned that feeling is what really matters to a hotel, not only more of everything. Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: Stinkaroo
Reviews.Content: An inconspicuous building that is centrally located. I stayed in one of the un-renovated rooms and it was comfortable but a bit stuffy and old-fashioned. The other couple in our group stayed in the newest, greatest bottega veneta suite, which is sumptuous and light. Another couple stayed in the most economical room, which was cramped and dark. The whole place generally needs a facelift and to wean itself off package tours from the States.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not perhaps worth the premium pricing”
Reviews.Author: pc319
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel as location for a birthday treat visit to Rome. The city itself was fantastic with plenty of stunning sights within easy reach. The hotel was pretty impressive and the rooms were very elegant but the location was just a fraction outwith the main tourist centre - 10-15 ins walk so manageable. Rooms were very ornate although the level of road noise and those of church bells (an unavoidable hazard in Rome) did cut down on the potential for a long lie. Did not really use the dining facilities as we were on a room only deal and the menu pricing was quite steep. Concierge staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a good hotel but not perhaps worth the premium pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Bailey3305
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009. Great service, service was one of the best I have experienced. Don't forget to check out the gym/spa on the top floor. The only thing that could be viewed as a negative is the room size. A little small, but plenty big enough! Have never written a review before.....I would go back there in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around”
Reviews.Author: ffxstation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with my wife and would stay here again. The common areas in the hotel are beautiful and the service was great. We had no complaints about our room. However, I can see how some of the rooms could be quite small and may not be a good value. I looked at the fire escape routes posted on our floor. They have a diagram of all the rooms to scale; some of the rooms were much smaller than ours. I would make sure you are getting one of the bigger rooms, otherwise I would recommend possibly staying somewhere else. Pros: - The location. Its convenient to the train station and the metro station and is within walking distance to most of the sites. There are several good restaurants within a short walk from the hotel - Service. The Services was great in all areas. The only compliant would be with a particular gentlemen working the check-in/cash desk who didn't seem to pleased to help you out. -Rooms. The room was large, good bed and large bathroom. -Gym. Big plus here. The gym was large and had a good spread of equipment for strength and cardio. Cons: - Internet - Small compliant here, internet is expensive. - Nightlife - There isn't much besides a few restaurants within a five minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: We are a family with several children and had a wonderful stay in 2 extremely spacious connecting rooms in this hotel. This is an expensive hotel, however, with very good deal for starwood preferred guest members. Comparing it to other upscale Rome hotels: the location is near the termini train station which is a bit less glamorous. However, an enormous advantage for us was ease of walking to and from the station and avoiding traffic in taxis or metro with suitcases. The central area of Rome is compact enough that this is really an easy walk to all the major sights. We had a Roma pass and an open tour pass so also easily supplemented walking with metro and bus depending on destination. Other things about this hotel: service is almost impeccable (most concierges were fabulous except for one who started poorly but redeemed himself), restaurant on site is excellent, room service is fabulous, the gym/spa is excellent, rooms are extremely comfortable, internet is about 4 euros per hour which is not too excessive for this caliber hotel. Neat freaks will notice some tear, some stains etc..: we were however completely enchanted by the pampering, art, comfort and grandeur of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: foiegraslover
Reviews.Content: There is no denying this is a beautiful hotel and is deserving of its 5 star staus. The rooms however are very small. I stayed in 2 rooms and in the first the room was so small the drawers couldn't open due to the bed. In the 2nd room the bedroom was a bit bigger but the bathroom was much smaller. No bidet!! I would look elsewhere the next time I stay in Rome. Also if you want to see the sites of Rome be prepared to walk and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location in Rome, but Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: walzholz
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the St.Regis Grand Hotel Rome as part of a 10 day Italy vacation. The hotel is old but in good condition. The rooms are decorated with Louis XV style furnishing and the bath rooms are all new and very nice. Service is good and we enjoyed the food and entertainment in the lobby bar. The hotel is in a very good location for seeing the sights in Rome (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc). The only bad thing I can say is the room prices during peak season can be $1,000.00 per night and parking is $75.00 per day. I used Starwood points for three free nights, but otherwise this is a very expensive hotel that is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty and dead...”
Reviews.Author: CHERIEParisFrance
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The St. Regis instead of The Hassler, where our friends were staying, because I could use my Starwoods points. The staff was formal and cold; there were many staff members everywhere, but not once were we greeted by name...in an eerily empty hotel. The contrast was considerable when we returned to The Hassler to have drinks with our friends for the second time. We were greeted warmly and told that our friends were in the bar....they remembered us from our one visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1335
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St. Regis in Rome from April 4th to April 7th 2009 and it was by far the best part of our 15 day trip to Italy. The hotel is situated in the heart of Rome close to the main train station. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the lobby is absolutely gorgeous. The rooms are large and comfortable and the hotel staff are very attentive, friendly, and helpful. Upon our arrival the hotel reception desk gave us an upgrade and treated us like royalties. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to have the best hotel at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur and Charm”
Reviews.Author: trioptikmal
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Grand is located a stone's throw away from Termini Station, so arriving here is a cinch. Once out of the dreary metro, you'll be greeted with the awe-inspiring Piazza della Repubblica, with the hotel just a few steps away. While others may find fault with the not-so-central location, it really isn't that far away from the sights, and the environment is usually more peaceful and quiet.
