The facade of the hotel looks deceiving: once you step within its doors, you'll be greeted with a grand lobby and perfectly coiffed staff. We had a deluxe room and everything was as advertised. Lofty ceiling, chandeliers, huge comfortable King bed, an excellent toilet and air conditioning. Room service was always prompt and polite, although hot water delivered tended to taste of coffee. We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed a generous percentage off, and every cent was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, Historic Building, Needs Updating (Just a Little)”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRVLR
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome and had such a great time. First off, I was in contact with the hotel via e-mail for car service, a Vatican tour, and Easter tickets for St. Peter's. The concierge was quick to respond and accomodating. Like other guests had mentioned, when we arrived our room wasn't quite ready, but they brought out cookies and coffee. They came to take us up to the room about a half hour later. The hotel entrance is small -- so initially you don't expect a "grand" hotel. Once you get in, there is marble everywhere and a gigantic chandlier. We had a room to the interior courtyard, so it was very quiet. That was a big plus in a bustling city. The concierage gave great recommendations and our private tour of the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel/St. Peter's was great. They came through with tickets to Easter. Every morning, the brunch buffet was good and the service was great. The only thing to keep in mind is this is a very old building. I think they did a major rennovation in 2000, but there is some wear and tear. I wouldn't normally even mention it (nothing big), but at this level of a hotel, you expect everything to be absolutely perfect. All in all, it was a great experience and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “No wander George Clooney and Madonna Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Chanelbaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the true epitomy of St Regis and luxury right in the heart of Rome. When we first arrived the porters were at our service immediately and escorted us to the front desk where they were very polite and professional. Being a gold SPG member I requested an upgrade to a deluxe room and they gave me an imperial room with optional butler service which was really impressive. The room was out of this world and felt like a palatial bedroom. The bedding was amazing, beautiful linens, very clean and the marble bathroom was up to my standard. Their luxury toiletries (Laura Tonato) were a real treat also. They gave us free water daily and an evening treat every night (macaroons, biscuits and local italian treats). The evening turndown service was lovely too they really freshened up the room beautifully. The breakfast wasnt that impressive, expected a better spread of food but the chef and our morning waiter were very polite and friendly. If you want to feel like a celebrity go for the Bottega Venetta Suite, I think this is where george and madonna stay! I wouldnt stay anywhere else in Rome now and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, Friendly & 5 Stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: tarak1m
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the late afternoon, our room was ready almost immediately, they upgraded our room without even having to ask. We found this hotel through AmEx travel, so we trusted that it would be top notch, and it was in every way! The room we got did only have the view of the courtyard, but when you are in Rome, you are rarely ever in the room! The room was large, nice shower and bathtub, 2 sinks, large king size bed and flat screen tv. There was a small desk and couch area as well. I did not like that the hotel charged so much for internet access, but most highend hotels always do, so not surprised. Upon our arrival I was very persistant about getting a private driver to take my husband and I to Ostia Antica, I had been trying to arrange this through a private tour service, but no one had gotten back to me with the details, so within minutes the concierge had a driver pick us up and take us there! It was not cheap, but the driver spoke very well english, so I was impressed! The concierge was always willing to help with dinner reservations,etc. anything we needed, we even requested a specific type of converter for our personal use (bc our's was stolen from our luggage from Madrid to Milan) they brought it within minutes, and didn't charge us for it either! very nice... The rooms were very clean, always turndown at night, which I like and the mini bar was always restocked. They also provided 2 complimentary waters per day in the room, which was nice too! We ate in the Late Night Bar area twice, once for lunch and dinner, the food was good, especially nice to be able to get a sandwich & fries, which you can't find in the city, although I did think 8 euros for an iced tea was ridiculous and I mean for every glass...pricey, but I always expect that from St Regis, come on.. Overall, a great experience, friendly service and a perfect location!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A bit stuffy... not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: agsinspace
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here last October for 4 nights. We found the hotel to indeed be "grand" as in the title, certainly the lobby and outward facade were impressive, but overall, found it quite stuffy and rooms small for the price. We were paying nearly full rack rates at the time... $550/night (CAD) and there was nothing about the hotel worth that price tag. Staff were not unfriendly, but not out of their way to be friendly either; restaurant was nice but nothing to rave about (the real great restaurants were in the true Italian districts); concierge gave typical tourist advice and it wasn't until night 2 or 3 that he finally got it right about us looking for a trendy but truly Italian experience and then we were directed to fabulous chic... but it took a while. The rooms were nice, again, but small... as to be expected, and even though we were paying nearly full pop for the room, we just got a courtyard view. There was nothing really wrong with the St. Regis Grand, but there was nothing spectacular either. We have stayed at many 5 *s across the world, and this one did not to anything to really differentiate itself from its competitors. (BTW, we arrived early and were directed to the restaurant for breakfast as our room wasn't ready. We were charged 56Euro for two cappuccinos and a pastry basket... )

Reviews.Title: “In my mind, hotel was not airconditioned.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexasMom
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome. My husband, son and I stayed at the St. Regis. The room was lovely and large - opening on an interior courtyard. However - looks were certainly deceiving as it proved to be quite uncomfortable - hot and stuffy. There was no air conditioning and no fan - so no air circulated through the room. When we inquired why this was the case, we were told that the hotel is only air conditioned in the summer. The hotel advertises that it is air conditioned but apparently it is only air conditioned part of the time - false advertising as far as I am concerned. For 400 euros a night - one should be able to sleep comfortably!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Good but not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: tommytourz
Reviews.Content: The two rooms we had were elegantly appointed and the bathrooms were large and well lit. While the furniture was a little worn the carpeting had recently been replaced. One of the two rooms we rented had a musty smell that the staff tried to remove with deodorizers but it just masked the odors for a short while until the odor returned. Restaurant had a nice buffet but it was pricey. Location was within easy walking distance of the train station, a little longer stroll can get you to the Borghese, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon. There are some nice restaurants very close to the hotel. For inexpensive, good, simple food (breakfast, lunch, coffee) the locals go to check out Bar Tavola Calda on via Torino just around the corner from the hotel. ttz

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld006
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! A lot of A-lister running through the place too. We went all the way around the world to see the same people we see in CA. Great food, great drinks. The only questionable thing was the service. I thought they were good overall but I would say they could have been a little freindlier considering the amount of coin you're dropping in the place. We checked in really late so they stuck in a tiny closet of a room that was nice but a little cramped for my style. A chart on the door will tell you if you are in one of the smallest. On a positive note, a quick buzz to the manager the next AM got us into a much larger room and the rest of the stay was great. Overall...a great place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Wayne_Chester
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night and it was our first visit to this hotel. We were excited to see how we would like it. The service was absolutely excellent. From the moment we arrived at the front door, through check-in and to our room, everyone was prompt, pleasant and courteous. Our room was large, well appointed with beautiful period furniture and it faced a court yard. The bathroom was very spacious with a separate tub and shower. The room was very quiet with no noises from other rooms or the hall. We spent the day walking around the neighbourhood. At the end of the evening we had drinks and snacks in Le Grand Hall and again, the service was excellent. Overall, a beautiful hotel, but, expensive. You pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the St. Regis Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoaoZ
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room at the St. Regis and absolutely loved the whole experience! Room was spacious, wonderfully decorated & super clean. Bed, pillows & mattress were outstanding. Bathroom had bath & seperate shower, all the amenties & wonderful italian toiletries. The overall service was second to none! Congratulations to all the staff for doing everything possible to satisfy all our wishes. The doormen, concierge, front desk, bar men, cleaning staff, gym staff...could not be more professional & nicer. Always had a smile & always efficient. Going back to the bar - what a team & what magnificent cocktails!!! The location is a 5 minute casual walk to the Via Veneto and 10/12 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The St. Regis Rome will forever be my Number 1 choice in Rome! Small things i would like improved: Extension of the breakfast hours to 11am or at least 10:30 instead of 10am More english channels on TV & more sports english channels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: theone_one
Reviews.Content: well this is my final destnation in italy for my honeymoon trip i like this hotel from the 1st look they were so nice they made for me an upgrade becuase i'm a hooneymooner the things i didnt like about the hotel that they got only 2 elvators and one of them was out of order and the another one was a old manual elvator so if any one didnt close the door it wont move lucky for me that my room was in the 2nd floor so i could used the steps for going to my room the another thing which i didnt like is the breack fast time is only upto 10 !! it's so hard for any one espically if you got a lady with u :P the 3rd thing which i couldnt bealive it that the hotel main resturent closed at sunday !!! we can order to the room but not eating in the resturent !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service and accessibility to metro”
Reviews.Author: bklyn2beantown
Reviews.Content: Details: Booked a 3 night stay (Wed-Fri) in a Superior room on Expedia, which was offering a very good discount; also found and used a $50 online coupon code. Flight was to arrive in Rome at 8AM and requested an early check-in. Called Starwood customer service day before departure to confirm booking. Review: My wife and I were greeted by the Head Bellman at the door, who took our luggage and directed us to the front desk. We were very warmly received and were told that we could check-in early and that we were being upgraded to a Deluxe room. We were then led to the beautiful hotel lobby for welcome drinks and a tray of small bites. Shortly, we were escorted up to our room, which was very spacious and well appointed, and looked very similar to the pictures on the hotel website. Our bags were brought up soon after. The bed was quite comfortable, and had a marble shelf behind it--a nice place to keep a glass of water (2 free bottles at turndown), cell phone/alarm clock, etc. The bathroom was very large, with separate shower and tub, as well as a large sink with lots of counter space. The only "negatives" about the room were the high price of internet (4E for 1 hour and up, but symptomatic of larger hotels everywhere since it is an easy way to make money), and the toiletries that we did not love. Otherwise, the room was great. The service at the hotel was also very high quality. Everyone smiled and said hello. The concierge was quite helpful in making dinner reservations and in giving us great directions. The doormen always helped to get the giant revolving door moving when we were entering or leaving the hotel, and had umbrellas ready if it was raining (they let us keep one at checkout). Part of the reason for booking was the location close to the metro in Piazza della Repubblica and to the Termini station (we took a train to Florence from Rome). To be fair, the hotel is not centralized, and despite the presence of a metro you will do alot of walking in Rome, so keep that in mind if you are considering the St Regis. Two final notes about the location -- first, there are a few cafes near the hotel for you to grab a morning espresso and a pastry (don't spend you money on hotel breakfast, nor the stomach space on breakfast foods); second, immediately after settling in you should walk around the corner to the tourism office and purchase a 20E Roma Pass (which provides you with 3 days of unlimited metro rides, free entrance to 2 museums (Vatican not included so buy online before you go), 50% off entrance to additional museums, and most importantly, the ability to blow past every line at every sight (again except the Vatican))

Reviews.Title: “Not the standard of st. Regis i know and love”
Reviews.Author: HelenSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pleasant enough, although super expensive -- 42 euros for a continental breakfast -- we had an OK time, but the room was not the quality we expect from a St. Regis hotel. We stayed on points from Starwood, thank goodness, I would have been very disappointed had I paid $600+. We took the advise of a tripadvisor reviewer and tipped the front desk on arrival -- this did not get us upgraded and we felt we waisted the money. For free it was reasonable, but I would not pay the normal rate for this hotel - luxury it is not!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: BentleyDriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand as part of a Tauck tour. The tour took us to some of the most beautiful hotels in Italy, but this hotel stood out as the most magnificent place we have ever stayed at. It's simply beautiful. The old world craftsmanship is evident throughout, and the service is there to match. In hate to think what it cost per night, fortunately that was covered by the Tauck people! We felt that we were royalty. The room was beautiful with an elegant renaissance mural over the bed. Beautiful furnishings. A huge king sized bed that was one of the most comfortable I've ever had. In all it was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Of all the 5 Star Hotels In Italy We Stayed, St.Regis Truly Lived Up To It”
Reviews.Author: PMNEF
Reviews.Content: Everything at the hotel from the second you step in the lobby til you get to the room is a great, lavishing experience. The decoration throughout the hotel is wonderful. The location of the hotel is good. We did a lot of waking in Rome. I would definetely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Royal suite supreme!”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: Again, extended family of 8, booked Royal Suite, interconnecting deluxe room and 2 additional deluxe rooms. The Royal Suite is royal in proportions: 2 wonderful lounges, an enormous dining room (seats maybe 20?), wonderful bedroom and bathroom. Decor was totally over the top as I suppose it is in most suites of this importance. Service was great, breakfasts in Italy are not incredible but at this hotel they were good, room service was perfect. The concierge also arranged courtesy pick ups & drop offs from the airport - a nice touch and something you'd expect when booking such large suites but not often offered by other hotels. The only down side on this hotel is its location. Although its not far from the centre I do believe one is better served staying at Hotel de Russie or even the sister hotel, Westin Rome which is on a great shopping street full of cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11594
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand in November 2007, over Thanksgiving. We were warmly welcomed, despite having arrived very late (approx. 11 p.m.) due to striking air traffic controllers at Paris's Orly airport. We were due to arrive early a.m., and ended up having to get a last minute Air France flight out of Charles De Gaulle. The staff at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful in getting us settled and getting our room service order right away. Our room overlooked the Piazza and was nicely appointed, although very small. The hotel staff was very helpful in getting us chauferred car service which we needed to attend Thanksgiving dinner at a seminary just outside the city. Overall, it was a great experience. Negatives? Very expensive breakfast and location. This hotel is not super close to many of the places we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but breakfast ridiculously expensive”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaijules
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was impeccable. Excellent service with the grandeur and opulence one would expect from a St. Regis hotel. We were however, quite shocked with the price of their breakfast buffet. It was about 40 Euros for a simple buffet and we decided that it was not worth the price. Instead, we went across the street and found a lovely local coffee shop where we had excellent coffee and brioche. My surprise was after the trip though when I found out that I did not get any Starwood points for our 3 night stay. We spent nearly $2000 but only got points from the F&B bills. Other than these two points, the hotel itself was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff at St. Regis Rome”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son at the St Regis Rome for two nights, the 3rd - 5th October this year. This is not the best hotel I have stayed at, but very nice with excellent staff. And this means all staff from housekeeping to the Vivendo restaurant. I found it difficult to decide on the hotel, all 5*s in Rome have their pros and cons. Some don't even seem to have twin beds at all! St Regis is an old Grand hotel and we knew what we were going to get. At home I´m an Alvar Aalto kind of woman, but I also like the grand hotels, which make a nice change and that's what holidays are all about. The hall with the many chandeliers is really something to see. The room was beautiful in the same style, good beds. Our room was facing an inner courtyard, so it was very quiet and we slept well. Also, no noise was heard from the corridor. The check-in and check-out were quite efficient. We were upgraded to a deluxe room, which was very nice. The room was normal size (to a 5*) and the marble bathroom was quite big with a bath tub and a separate shower stall. Bathroom amenities were not quite to my best liking, I think Bulgari would be more suitable for this hotel. But this is nothing important. The bathrobes, towels and sheets were of an excellent quality. My only real complaint about the hotel is the glass partition of the shower stall. No matter how tight you tried to close it, there was water on the floor after a shower. We had several meals at the hotel, all were good (or even better) and the service always excellent. The Vivendo, where we had prebooked a table, was a really nice experience. Both restaurants have options for vegetarians, which I appreciate a lot. The Bar, which is also a less formal restaurant, served excellent pasta, sandwiches etc. Breakfast was 32,-, which is a reasonable price. The breakfast is normal, nothing spectacular. We had also booked a Mercedes with a driver to take us to the airport. He was at the hotel early and everything went smoothly. I recommend this service as it was not a nice experience to take the train into the city. All in all, I'm happy to recommend the St Regis. Last, a word of caution. Not at all about the hotel, but about the Roman taxis. Most of the drivers are nice and honest, but unfortunately not all. If they ask you if they can leave you not at the hotels' entrance, but somewhere near because of "the traffic," just say no. Also, always carry small notes and coins so that you have the exact money, then tip separately.

Reviews.Title: “one of THE hotels in Rome -- a landmark”
Reviews.Author: BostonBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Rome can be a New York - like experience (a virtual assault on your senses at times). You need a getaway / escape and the St. Regis is the perfect choice. The hotel is a landmark, and absolutely beautiful inside. The location is also PERFECT for seeing all of the sites (basically central in Rome). Having been to Rome previously, and researched hotels extensively, it's difficult to find a good hotel (for any kind of reasonable price). Therefore, it's truly worthwhile to spend the extra money at a hotel you know will offer a certain level of accomodation and service (i.e. St Regis). The service was professional, and responsive. The onsite restaurant was superb. The decor in the lobby and "grand bar" are worth the admittedly overpriced drinks. overall -- VERY pleased with the experience

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burydrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Italy to celebrate my 40th birthday (in mid August, 2008). As part of this 10 day celebration, we stayed in Rome, Florence, Milan, and Turin. Our first and last nights were in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal during the first few nights and then at the St. Regis Grand the last night. During the entire 10 day trip we only stayed in 5 star hotels so to end the trip on a high note, we booked the St. Regis Grand hotel (Room 235). Our stay in the St. Regis was nice, but I think that we preferred the Hotel Splendide Royal. The St. Regis was very close to the train station (a 15 minute walk) so it was convenient when arriving and departing by train (Roma Termini). Checking in was pleasant & convenient. We arrived in late afternoon (around 5:30) and still received a nice room. The room was surprisingly spacious, very clean, and had an elegant feel. The bathroom was huge with dual sink basins but unlike the room it didn't have the elegant feel. The room was quiet and the bed was comfortable so we were able to sleep very well (the hotel itself was very calm and quiet). Our room rate did not include breakfast and we had to leave the hotel relatively early (6:45 AM) so we didn't get a chance to sample the food. The staff seemed friendly and attentive. We would recommend the hotel, but you can find the same class of hotel (say the Hotel Splendide Royal) for a more reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Grand??”
Reviews.Author: ryu0803
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Rome. We had no idea which hotel to choose as there is no Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental which is usually our hotel choice when we travel. We decided to book our stay with the St. Regis Grand Hotel because we were attracted by the beautiful photos they put in their website. The place looks like a palace in those photos! We were really disappointed when we found out the actual condition of the place. This hotel was opened originally in 1894. It was closed for a major rennovation when it became a member of the St. Regis Group and it was reopened in December 1999. Eight years later, this place looks a little run-down to us. They need to repaint some walls in the public areas as the colour is already fading. We also noticed burnt light bulbs in more than one chandelier at the lobby. The most unacceptable of all, there was cobweb at one corner of the high ceiling. We did not see flower arrangement which we consider a must for a luxurious hotel. The place just gave us an impression that they are low on maintenance budget. Althought we were not happy with the hardware, we were more than satisfied with the software. Every staff we met was very nice and helpful. Smiles were on their faces all the time. We booked the Imperial Guest Room and we were upgraded to the Junior Suite. Our room was ready when we arrived at 7:30am but we were still invited to their buffet breakfast. A large plate of fruits was sent to our room from the GM and there was also a gift basket filled with Hermes toiletries. Overall experience with this hotel was not bad because of the high level of service. However, we will go for another hotel when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “very good traditional hotel - average location”
Reviews.Author: smudgecirencester
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a deluxe room on the hotel's 20% discount offer. Fully refurbished hotel decor in the traditional style. Very good quality, comfortable room, reasonable size, excellent bathroom, excellent housekeeping. And I asked for a quiet location and actually got one, so top marks for that. Problems? The foyer is grand to the point of cavernous - a bit overwhelming, so guests tend to huddle in the corners ; the hotel food isn't great in the evenings, though my husband said the breakfast was good . The bigger issue is the location, which while central certainly isn't the prettiest, being close to the bus and railway stations and all that entails. Still, some guests wll find that very useful - but if you're there for the sights, it's a longish walk or taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: krtravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a beautiful, upscale hotel and, with that, the staff was polite but stiff, as were the travelers. We stayed at the hotel with 'free points' and for the money we would have been charged we would never have stayed in it otherwise. The room was relatively small, probably average for Rome, but would have cost about $1100 usd per night. The bathroom was very nice. Nice hotel, but stuffy and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: CM002
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very impressed by the level of service and the friendliness of the staff - there was none of the attitude one can encounter in Italy. Check-in was extremely courteous and helpful. I had booked a standard room and forgot to specify twin beds, but the staff member immediately offered to switch us to a twin-bedded room and give us an upgrade to deluxe. As the room was not ready yet, we were treated to a complimentary drink whilst we waited (only 20 minutes or so). The public areas are very grand and impressive and beautifully kept. The room was also nice and spacious, for my taste perhaps a bit over the top with the murals. Again very friendly staff at the breakfast buffet, whom I observed dealing with rather difficult guests gracefully and patiently. As we are not big breakfast eaters, we were not billed the full rate on a couple of occasions, which is a nice gesture. The location of the hotel is a mixed blessing. It is not in a lively or elegant area of town, but then it is still pretty central and convenient for the main railway station, numerous buses and the metro. In my opinion one area of improvement for the St Regis would be the fitness facilities. They seem to have been installed under the attic as an afterthought. There were two small rooms with only a few machines, and a small dark sauna in the men's changing room. Overall though the positives very much prevail and I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridatravelpro
Reviews.Content: Unlike our experience in Venice..This hotel is truly a gem. Upscale in every way. The staff is both knowlegible and helpful. We had a beautiful room over looking the fountain. The hotel is elegant yet reserved. The entire staff mae us feel welcomed and gla we were there. The live piano player in the grand lobby was a wondwrful way to end a day of sight seeing with a drink before retiring. I found the business center to be well equiped and very easy to use. This is truly a place to stay and experience. We hired a private limo to show us the city at night ( great experience) and he said that the St. Regis was one of the two best in Rome. I must agree and would surly stay here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 12345stars
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and it is near shopping and turist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic100
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights at this Grand hotel and we absolutely loved it. When we first arrived, they upgraded us to a deluxe room, gave us complimentary breakfast and snacks at their bar and had the room ready for us in a jiffy (we came in at 10am). Location - its not smack in the middle of the tourist attractions but all major destinations (Spanish steps, Pantheon, Colosseum) are about a 20 minute walk or about 6 Euros by taxi. So quite convenient and it feels good to get away from the tourist throngs at the end of the day. Dont trust the distance estimates on the hotel website especially if you have a kid on a stroller. Rome was not built in a day but in the days of yore and it shows. The kid rattled and we hrrumphed and took taxis. There is a taxi stand right outside so it was easy. And its very very safe. Room - Even though we prefer minimalist balinese decor and not the opulent 19th century European style, the room was quite nicely done up. The 34 inch flat panel TV compensated. And they had a DVD player - useful for the kid. But the icing on the cake was an amazing bathroom - trust me in Europe, bathrooms are an afterthought. It had a separate walk-in shower so no half shower doors separaing the bathtub and and bathroom from imminent flooding. Food - did not eat at their restaurant; Their bar is great to sit but the food is average. Service was excellent. Breakfast and room service is expensive but there are multiple cafes just outside and you can say cappuccino to go without attracting puzzlement as in Paris. Finding fresh milk for the kid was hard - room service charges 7 euros which was way too steep. The first day when we asked for milk they sent it up for free; the rest of the days we got charged. So we trudged to the nearest supermarket which is about 5 blocks away. They should have a "infants drink milk free" program and parents would arrive in droves. Concierge and service - Mario and Omar were amazing; they have great maps, they made reservations for all the places so we managed to skip queues, and gave us excellent restaurant recommendations. However, the restaurants we went to were sometimes stuffy and not kid-friendly. (Aside: We did find perhaps the most kid friendly restaurant in all of Rome - called Life on Via della Vite near Spanish steps. The servers were the most kind and pleasant that we have encountered in all of Italy - they entertained our kid while we had a great dinner.) The hotel arranged a pricey private tour of the Vatican (at 230 Euros) but it was worth every cent. Our guide Fabio Luciani was very good (www.arslongatour.com) - pleasant, knowledgeable and well versed in European history. We cannot recommend him more strongly. Finally, service standards at the hotel was amazing - only the Aman resorts and some select 4 seasons are comparable. Overall, the best European hotel we have experienced - unfair of course, to compare it to Asian hospitality and service but they can give it a run for our money.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I didn't realize that this is the old Grand Hotel of Rome. The Grand Hotel was a stuffy, unfriendly, tired hotel. The St. Regis was incredibly friendly, elegant, fun and worth the money. As we entered the hotel we were taken good care of. Check in was short and friendly. As we were taken to our room, our butler arrived and he explained all the details of the room, the fact that we could have free coffee brought to the room at any time, etc. Every day a bottle of wine, cookies, and pastries were brought to the room free of charge. Our bedrooms were enormous with ornate and high ceilings, beautiful rich carpet, lovely art on the walls and large, well appointed bathrooms. The public areas of the hotel are the grandest that we have seen in any hotel. Breakfast was included and it had everything including a cook to prepare any kind of omelette, eggs, pancakes, etc. My wife told me that the gym was nice but nothing extraordinary. The concierge staff were uniformly excellent and friendly. Our favorite trattoria was Costanza underneath Pompey's villa. We loved our stay at the St. Regis and wouldn't think of going any place else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: sorrento2008
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel in the world! Expensive but worth every penny. Customer service was meticulous and our room was gorgeous. We will definately be staying here again! I could not more highly recommend the St. Regis Grand Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: CarlaWashingtonState
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the St. Regis in the afternoon and were greeted warmly and with great care. We then started our stay there in the deluxe room for 9 days. Overall the experience was very good. The help did seem a bit Stoic at times which I can understand and it wasn't always consistent. At times we arrived back from being out and were greeted warmly, other times no one was there. Also we ran into problems with the front desk deducting money for a charity whicih we had not authorized (only $1 but we like to be asked anyway) and with co-ordinating services for us. They also failed to mail out our postcards on time (they were received by everyone almost 3 weeks after we gave them to the front desk) and messed up one of our day trips. We did notice that the service did seem to deterioate over time due to what we thought might be that we were in a lesser room. But when the hotel upgraded us to the top floor villa suite overlooking the city on our last night there coming back from Naples, most complaints were forgotten. I had one problem with the hotel after we got back to the States when they wanted to charge me 90 Euros (about $170.00) to ship a pair of expensive shoes I had left in the room back to me. Naturally I balked at the fee and after some emails back and forth they relented and ended up shipping tthe shoes for free. I had to resort to threatening to dispute the hotel bill if they didn't lower the shipping fee. Mind you I would have paid something to have them shipped but 90 Euros was ridiculous especially since we had just stayed there for 10 days total. Any other 5 star hotel would have handled this with more tact and consideration. Do yourself a favor and don't leave anything behind. there. The food at the hotel was very good although very expensive. We hardly ate in the hotel because of the outrageous prices they charged for everything including snacks and water. We ended up going out for most of our meals and extras and to be honest it did somewhat diminish our experience there. We only did the breakfast twice.. I expect to pay more at a 5 star hotel but certainly not the prices we saw. Really outrageous. That aside, the hotel is very beautiful and elegant and everything you would expect a hotel of this caliber to depict. It has recetnly undergone a huge restoraton and they did a great job. The toiletries were nice, the bed very comfortable and it was quiet but I have to give it 4 stars because all of all of the above. Will I ever stay at the St. Regis again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jjp10
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the St Regis. The room was quite well appointed and up to date. The public spaces are impressive and the location is quite good for touring. My wife thought the bed was very comfortable and she travels a lot. We had a corner room on the front side and it was a bit noisy at night as the windows are older and don't block the traffic noise, which continues all night. A different room had less windows and was more quiet. Both were upgraded rooms. The staff was excellent. Our bags got lost by BA in our transfer at heathrow and took 4 days to get to us. The concierge was extremely helpful about calling several times a day to push BA to find and deliver the bags. The reception staff were very accomodating to extend our stay even though they were technically "full" and they gave us a good rate on the extension given our situation. We often stay at Four Seasons and this was almost as good, for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but could and should do better”
Reviews.Author: gordongecko
Reviews.Content: The good things are that the St Regis is in a good location, central and convenient for sight seeing (although beware the area near the central train terminal at night, a 5min walk away). The staff were efficient although I wouldnt call them friendly. Furthermore I was a bit annoyed as I got charged an extra 25% per night because we were 2 people (my reservation was for 1). I didn't make a fuss over it but I cant understand how having a 2nd person in the room made any difference, apart from giving them a chance to make more money. We didn't have any breakfast or eat in the hotel. The room was reasonably spacious and comfortable, although the decoration was bordering on the kitch. My main complaint would be the bathroom, as someone else has mentioned in their review the toilet often ran and this was noisy. Additionally the bathroom stank (faint sewer smell). The smell must have been coming from the pipes or the ventilation I am not sure but we were there for 4 nights and it smelled all the time. We had to keep the bathroom door closed at all times otherwise it would also stink out the room. Not what you would expect from a 5* hotel which was not cheap by any means. If I was in Rome again I would try a different hotel to this

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a "grand hotel" and we found it an outstanding place to stay in Rome. Our room looked over the inner courtyard so it was very quiet. The room size was quite large for Europe and the bed was extremely comfortable. The fitness room and broadband internet are both very good. The staff was also very helpful. We had dinner at Vivendo in the hotel, and the food was outstanding and the wine list perhaps the best I have encountered in Italy. The restaurant staff is outstanding and the sommelier was very interesting and helpful. The hotel is about a 5 minute jog (or 10 minute walk) from the Villa Borghese which is among the most beuatiful places to jog in the world in the early morning. Our experience compared well with the grand hotels of Paris, which is high praise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Angela
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent. Nice staff, perfect concierge service and delightfull breakfast every morning. Feel like coming home after a day of adventure. We had the imperial room which is worth the money compared to a standard room. We had a butler that treated us with little snacks every day. One of the best in the world!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithme123
Reviews.Content: I'm a pretty fussy traveller, and this hotel was everything I expected it to be. Impeccable service, beautiful room and an amazing atmosphere. After a gruelling schedule it was a delight to come "home" to the St Regis Grand and be spoilt and relax. Hotel restaurant and bar both represented exceptional value - nothing was too much trouble and our every wish was catered to graciously. I can't recommend this hotel enough, it's just divine!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YukonRoadKing
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through AMEX Fine Hotels & Resorts Program, and for the price of a standard room (not cheap) we were upgraded to a palatial room with beautiful art and amenities. The included breakfast was excellent, and the main "lobby" surroundings are remarkable. Check out the photos on the hotel's web site. There is an excellent bar for drinks at the end of the day. The front desk and concierge were as good or better than I've seen in any European city: friendly, helpful, courteous. The concierge and I discussed the dinner reservations I had made from home weeks earlier, and made some appropriate changes to better suit what we were looking for. The location is not really within walking distance of much, but there's always a cab outside the door, and they are not badly priced in Rome (try London!). There were lots of dignitaries present (no idea of what country) and although we are nobody, we were treated as if we were members of royalty. Hard to imagine a better big city hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, but a little cold”
Reviews.Author: Bondosan006
Reviews.Content: Redeemed 2 rooms for 3 nights each here as part of a family summer holiday in 2007. The hotel upgraded my room. Both were worthy of a grand hotel - beautifully decorated, classically Italian etc. I was actually concerned that my kids would not break something in their room! One disadvantage - apparently there are no twin beds in any rooms, only king sized. Pros - wonderful and spacious rooms (remember it's Rome), good ventilation, comfortable beds, reasonably quiet even though the road below isn't, prompt check-in and room service, superb breakfast cooking (didn't have lunch or dinner in, but would probably have been great too). Cons - location (not really close to main tourist attractions), service is efficient but cold (compared with the Sofitel Roma). The location is not really a problem as there is a subway station close by, and taxis are plentiful - you can get pretty much everywhere for less than 10 Euros. And you can always walk as the best way to see Rome is by foot (we did all 3). As for the service, the concierge gave us the impression that we were a cut below their normal guest standard - perhaps we were too casually dressed (T-shirt, shorts, day packs as it was hot). We certainly saw a lot of elegantly presented people coming and going. Breakfast is expensive at ~40 Euros a head which is unsurprising for a hotel of this type, but you can always pop across the road to a little shopping arcade where there is a ubiquitous Italian cafe that serves decent coffee and breakfast pastries/rolls for a more down-to-earth price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but lacks something”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a honeymoon break to Rome. The Hotel is a really beautiful 5 star hotel. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the room (imperial suite) we stayed in was like something straight out of a palace. The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is that it just seemed to lack atmosphere. Granted it was quiet when we stayed there, but we felt like we were the only people staying in the hotel. It is expensive to stay there but you do get alot of luxuries for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Ermak
Reviews.Content: Overall impression - it is a very pleasant hotel. Hotel - The hotel was recently renovated to show its original decor. We particulary liked the area where the breakfast is served and the ball room. Note the ceilings in both rooms, stairs in the lobby and old elevator (hidden in the back of the hotel). Room - We stayed in Deluxe room which was spacious, but cozy with a very nice marble bathroom. The room was clean. Service -The bar and restaurant downstairs were excellent, roomservice was nothing more than one would expect in a hotel of such class, the consierge service was impeccable and helped us quickly and efficiently with all our requests. We liked the breakfast. Perhaps, the only thing that I did not like is that the service lacked some personal touch, but at the end of the day it is a big hotel (not a family run boutique) which is a part of international chain and I guess there is no room for that there. Location - not too close to Termini to get all the problems (noise, crowds) that usually associated with train stations, but still a walking distance and if you arrive with a train and the luggage is not a problem then you could probably get to the hotel by foot in 10 min. Metro station is 1 min. walk from the hotel, the fact which we liked a lot. And if you prefer walking you could get to Via Veneto in 10 min, to Spanish Steps in 20 min, and to Palazzo Venezia in 30 min. And if you are tired - take a taxi!!! They are good and cheap - 5-6 Euro to the hotel from almost anywhere in the central Rome. Finally, the hotel is in a perfect location - it is surrounder by Rome - one of the best places on Earth)))

Reviews.Title: “Class and Elegance!!”
Reviews.Author: davidsinger
Reviews.Content: The St, Regis Rome represents true class and elegance. It realy was amazing, the decor is beautiful and the service is second to none. The only complaint a tourist might have would be location as it's located near the Piazza de Republica and a good 20 min walk from attractions like the coloseum and the forum. All in all it's a true 5 statr hotel, and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: January2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in St. Regis recently. One of the most expensive hotels in Rome. It does not worth the money. We stayed in a deluxe double room. Not different than a standard room in another five star hotel in Italy. Their restaurant and bar were under construction. Our room was also looking at a construction site. But the biggest problem was the concierge, they were way too rude. We feel like fighting with them for an answer to an easy question. For a rate that high you can easily find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice for Christmas in Rome - Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: EPJD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 4 nights, over Christmas, and had a perfect stay. We are a family of 6 (youngest is 15); it was our first time in Rome. The hotel was beautiful and very well-kept. Upon our arrival at 9 AM, both of our rooms were already available and we were upgraded from 1 deluxe/1 imperial to 2 imperial rooms at no extra charge. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and shutters kept out most of the street noise. The rooms were a classic style but the conveniences, like the TV/DVD/CD player, were modern. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, as were the cots. There was plenty of space for the king bed, cot, couch and the other tables and furniture that were in the room and that made it quite comfortable. What made our stay so wonderful was the service: prompt, friendly and knowledgeable without fail each time. The restaurant recommendations, room service, butler service-- all stellar. We even requested a DVD in English that was brought to us almost immediately and at no charge. The extra touches, like Christmas gifts left at turn-down service, made our stay very special. Though the location wasn't as ideal as other hotels we considered, we found it quick and easy (and fun) to walk many of the tourist spots (Spanish Steps, the Forum, the Pantheon and Trevi Foundation). We even walked to back the hotel from the Vatican after Midnight Mass at 2am! Booking through the Starwood 800 number was very easy, though the booking was in dollars and we were hurt by the exchange rate upon check-out (total was in euros). We had a few miscellaneous charges on our bill that weren't on our confirmation that, when addressed, were removed. The breakfast buffet was ample and delicious, and service was excellent. We only dined once at the hotel for lunch. It took a very long time for our food to arrive; the meals were average in quality and very overpriced. Recommended to anyone who can afford it! The excellent service is worth the less-central location.

Reviews.Title: “Le Grand St. Regis!”
Reviews.Author: suze_shoes
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Grand Hotel, also known as "Le Grand Hotel" is one of the oldest, most luxurious hotels in Rome. As we arrived mid morning, there was a short wait for our suite, yet we passed the time in the invitingly warm, yet formal lobby that also serves as a breakfast area and bar on the level that several steps above. Enjoying a pot of coffee and a basket of breads (11 Euros each), we bypassed the buffet breakfast (48 Euros). Note that although they tend to steer you toward the buffet, there is a lovely a la carte menu available also. Our room/suite was ready in no time and we were treated to one of the many themed rooms with a sitting area and beautifully appointed marble bathroom complete with walk-in shower, separate bathtub, heated towel bar and bidet amenities. Our two closets handled the week's worth of clothes and shoes easily. The fitness center isn't huge but complete with treadmills, an elliptical, bicycles and free weights. complimentary water and fruit was a nice touch. The art and the history of this hotel are a study in themselves. The service is impeccable, the rooms spacious and comfortable--we highly recommend the most outstanding hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular- Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: vacationvacation
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Italy. While in Rome, I stayed at the St. Regis Grand. I was so happy with the hotel that I decided to share a review-which I have never done before. The hotel rooms are beautiful and luxurious. I saw a total of three different rooms in the time I was in Rome, and all were visually stunning. Where do they get that white down comforter ??? It is the biggest, thickest down conforter I have ever seen. The pillows are down as well. All white. It is heavenly. Beds and rooms are made up twice a day. Complimentary chocolates and waters every day. Bathroom has separate stall shower and tub. The hotel has the highest level of non-snobby service of any five star hotel I have stayed at. These employees are genuinely interested in their guests having a good experience, both at the hotel and in Rome. They are efficient and good natured. One small point, I was surprised to find that there was no high speed wireless internet available in the rooms. There is only a high speed cable which can be connected to a computer in your room for a daily charge. This was the case all throughout the hotels I stayed at in Italy, but nevertheless, a little disappointing. Overall though, an excellent experience. I envy anyone who is just about to go...

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: stompin_pt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last three nights of our honeymoon in France and Italy. We stayed using cash 'n points ($150 + 8,000 starwood points a night, vs. 20,000 points or 500 euros) and were upgraded to a huge & amazing junior suite. No view (first floor facing inner courtyard) but a very elegant room with fantastic bathroom -- bigger than our whole room in Venice -- very comfortable bed (though amazingly, still two twins put together), two flat screen tvs and lots of elegant touches. Concierge also gave a great recommendation for a nearby dinner spot. He was less helpful when we sought out a group tour; they had recommendations for private tours but were pricier than we wanted. They've really thought of everything at this hotel: umbrellas when it's raining, friendly and professional but not imposing staff, amazing decor. My wife absolutely loved it and the room was so amazing that we didn't care that it rained nearly the entire time we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “loved The St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: yoey1
Reviews.Content: A Fairy Tale Start to A Wonderful Vacation. We arrived at !0:30am on Oct.12 for 4 nites before our cruise.I had e-mailed about an early arrival and they would have our room ready shorthy. We sat in the lounge for 10 minutes and then were shown to our room which had been upgraded (We booked an award.cash & point stay through Starwood) Our room was GRAND. Large king bed, beautiful bath.double sinks ,jacuzzi tub, sep. shower, all marble. The staff were all very professional and extremely helpful. They confirmed our tours (arranged before we left New York).They made dinner reservations for us at nearby restaurants that they recommended..which were really terrific. We ate at the hotel one night..expensive but what an experience..they food was magnificent and the service 10 star. The location of this hotel was another big plus.we walked to so many attactions..the Spanish Steps etc. This hotel is Among The Finest and I Would Highly Recommend it to anyone wishing to have THE BEST

Reviews.Title: “Amazing guestrooms”
Reviews.Author: baburshah
Reviews.Content: The guestroom was extremely luxurious and the room-service excellent. The service, however, is pretty bad and absolutely not up to what you would expect from such an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start the honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: flyer07
Reviews.Content: After traveling all night from San Francisco, we arrived, luggage in tow at 9am for a 3pm check-in and were told..."that we'd been upgraded to a junior suite, that our room was being cleaned and that we were welcome to enjoy a drink in the bar area on the house with their apologies that our room wasn't ready *six hours early*." Now this is the kind of white-glove service I could learn to like! And this was only a taste of the exemplary service my wife and I experience at the St. Regis, Rome. A convenient location just a short walk from the Rome subway system and all the tourist hot-spots is one high point. But the wonderfully comfortable bed and the huge accomodations (including double vanities, stand-up shower, soaking tub, and two TVs and two DVD players make strong arguments for why leaving the room is hardly necessary. When we did leave we enjoyed the (included) breakfast buffet--with wonderfully attentive service from every staff person and good food in a great location to boot. Daily treats from our personal butler were a nice addition and service calls were met with exceptionally prompt and especially attentive service. The concierge was helpful before and during our stay arranging hard to get reservations and train tickets in advance and graciously helping with new dinner ideas when our self-made plans fell through. One word of warning: staying at a high-end hotel apparently guarantees that the cost of the place they'll recommend for dinner, for tours, etc. will also be on the high end. Be prepared to be specific if you are not interested in paying top dollar for every meal. Gym facilitiies are limited, but you don't come here for the gym. Outside of that, we had no complaints and no quibbles. The St. Regis Rome was a fantastic way to start our honeymoon and (for the money) makes for a worthwhile and special experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: skyplane
Reviews.Content: We rented a villa in Umbria for a week, and before returning home spent 3 nights at the St. Regis in Rome. Our stay was exceptional in every way. I travel relatively frequently for business, and can honestly say that I have never stayed in a more luxurious hotel. The St. Regis is sumptuously decorated, but compared to US hotels of this caliber the rooms are on the small size and thus there are no rooms with 2 queen beds. Accordingly, we had to book 2 rooms for our family of 4 (thus making an already expensive hotel 2x the price). Given the ages of our children, it was important to me that the rooms be connected -- when Starwood central reservations said they could not guarantee the rooms would be adjoining, I contacted the hotel directly who arranged for adjoining rooms. Service was above and beyond. We arrived by rental car on Saturday afternoon. I had been told by the rental car company that their offices closed at noon on Saturday and we would not be able to return the car until Sunday morning. So when we arrived at the hotel, I fully expected to pay for overnight parking and then dealing with the rental return the next day. Instead, when I pulled up to the front door, the bellman noticed that we had a rental car, and told us that he thought he would be able to arrange with the rental car company to come pick up the car from the hotel that afternoon, thereby saving us the overnight parking fees that the hassle of the return. 30 minutes later we received a call in our room informing us that Hertz was there to get our car. My only complaint is that the cost of breakfast was ridiculously high. While I expect the hotel to charge a premium for eating in the hotel, their buffet at EUR 47 per person was about 10x what we spent on breakfast out of the house.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, the hotel, only like the location”
Reviews.Author: Valerie C
Reviews.Content: We had a funny experience. Although I had lived in Italy for 4 years in the 80s, in Milan, I had only been to Rome once. I speak fluent Italian, so when we got off the train in the center of Rome, I asked the taxi driver to take us to the St. Regis. He pointed and said in Italian, "Why do you need me to take you there? It's only 2 blocks away?" (from the train station). So off my husband, me, and 2 high school boys walk towards where he pointed. We've gone a LONG 4 blocks from the train station, carrying our luggage, no one has EVER heard of the St. Regis that i ask, and we finally hail another taxi to take us in a big circle. Turns out no one knows the place as the St. Regis yet (they put that in very small letters); only still as the Grand. Remember that! Anyway, it was a wonderful hotel, probably not quite worth the price, to be honest, but the breakfast was fabulous. I had tried to decide between the Westin Excelsior and this hotel; walking down the via Veneto several times, I wish I'd done the Westin. It's in a much better location. Although, I must admit, being so close to the subway/train station did have its advantages. The rooms are small but elegant; I 'd have love to have seen the Westin's. Rome is a fabulous city--I was there 25 years ago and nothing compares to its history. Use the subway as much as you can--it's really safe and clean. I didn't like one restaurant we ate at near this hotel, to be honest. We had much better luck in the center of the city, near the Piazza Navona. And if you want to buy art work, absolutely do it there too! We got 4 incredible pieces of original artwork at about 1/4 the price of home. The concierge is very helpful at the hotel, he helped us get a fabulous private tour of the Vatican to skip the 4 hr. line. I did love this hotel, but I would also check out the Westin first. You will LOVE Rome, I promise!

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis Upscale and Exclusive”
Reviews.Author: wawood
Reviews.Content: After spending the first two days of our 2 week anniversary trip at the Sofitel Roma, the St. Regis closed out the trip in fine style. Comparatively, the St. Regis, was larger, grander and more elegant than the Sofitel and also was in a better location due to the Repubblica Metro station being roughly a 1 minute walk and the Termini Station being a 5 minute walk. Being farther on the East side of Rome's Centro Storico, most of your touring will likely require a Metro ride, but at only 1 euro each way, it's a safe, quick and easy way to get around to the Vatican, Forum, and Spanish Steps. Getting to the Piazza Navona, Campo Fiori and Trastevere will require relatively long walks unless you take a cab or a bus. Cab rides in Rome are relatively inexpensive during the day, but the rates double at night. When we arrived to check in at a little before 10am on a Saturday morning, our room was almost ready, so they provided us with a complimentary bottle of water and some snacks while we waited; clearly excellent service. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and was top notch. I highly recommend the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: waileagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis and truely loved it. The staff pays extreme attention to detail (even above most 5 star standards). Our room was a double deluxe that looked over the Piazza Republica. Gorgous frescos on the ceiling and walls, beautiful furnishings, and spacious bathroom. We arrived well before check in time, but they offered us a complimentary drink in the lobby while they hurried to ready our room. The breakfast buffet in the morning was absolutely delicious. Even though it is a distance to major Rome attractions, it is really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: atlfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for the St. Regis in Rome. The hotel is opulent and the staff very good. However, it is not the best location or the best room for such a high price. Our room was tiny, even by Rome standards. The bathroom was nice but not huge. I would probably not stay here again unless it was free! Overrated, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: rhodeweary
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 10am after an overnight flight from the states. Arranged transportation via the hotel concierge in advance, which turned out to be semi-economical and very, very convenient. Rooms weren't ready (didn't expect them to be), but the front desk attendant walked us to the bar, saw to it that we were served coffee, and then came back every 20-30 minutes for the next hour to make sure we were comfortable. Around 11:30, we were led to our room which was as shown on the website, elegant. The whole place is of another era, one of formal elegance. The bed was extremely comfortable, and with the heavy curtains drawn, the room was quiet and dark, which made it easy to take a nap and get adjusted to European time. Room service was outrageously expensive, but not unexpected given the caliber of the hotel. Service throughout was attentive, if a bit overly formal. The common areas of the hotel are beautifully restored, and immaculate. It's not an economical choice, but a fine one nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St Regis Rome”
Reviews.Author: LABill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I , along with my in laws, stayed 4 nights at the St Regis in June of 2007. In all respects, this is a great property and hotel, other than a less than ideal location for proximity to shopping ( which I was happy about). The hotel staff are top notch, and the service is superb. The rooms are nice ( especially for Europe) and the beds are great--nice and soft, again a treasure in Europe. The breakfast is fantastic and the servers are out of this world. We had a server make us a belini without our asking to prove he makes the best one in Italy, better than Harry's Bar in Venice , which it was !! You will not go wrong with the St Regis

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fritzee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at this hotel after a week long cruise, and found it to be spectacular. Although it is not in the heart of the action, it is close enough to walk along the Via Veneto and to the Bourghese Gardens. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a junior suite...not sure if it was based on our being Starwood members, but we didn't have to ask for it! When we arrived in our room, it was stupendous. A long hallway led to our living room and adjoining bedroom, whose bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. The bathroom was long and spacious. We even had a butler who offered to unpack our suitcase for us. There were daily little things that occurred, free water bottles, turndown service, free cookbook. They even took one of our wine bottles that was left on the table and put it on ice for us to drink when we returned from our day of sightseeing. On our last evening, we had a wonderful meal at their restaurant Vivendo. Although somewhat pricey, it had all the elements that make it a special meal: great food, beautiful surroundings and excellent service. Our waiter/sommelier/host handled all of our questions, and we had a nice discussion regarding his recent visit to our hometown San Francisco. Other than the doormen not being around as often to flag a taxi or open the door, our experience at this hotel was excellent. I highly recommend it if you want to enjoy yourself in luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, not too sure if it was worth it....”
Reviews.Author: JMBZ
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in March with my wife to get a wekend away from the kids (1st time in 10 years) so i decided to splash out for this stay. We always stay in 5 star hotels , but at 650 eur a night this was pushing the limits of my 'you get what you pay for' philosophy. Staff amazingly helpfull, we even had our own butler, and we were upgraded into a huge room. But when we checked out i have to admit i left the place unsure as to wheter i would return given the amount of cash id spent againt how much better this hotel is to other 5 star properties i have stayed at that cost maybe 250 eur a night less. Granted this is a city so i expected to pay more for that, but im still not sure if id pay this kind of money again when as with all city breaks we spent very little time in the room .

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DewieWright
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just got back from Rome & I have to say this hotel was amazing! Perfectly located, great service, beautiful rooms - and comfortable too. The staff made you feel extremely welcome & were very helpful with questions / recommendations. We will always stay at the St Regis when we got back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: captainstuubs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis Rome over Christmas (and attended the New Year's Eve party at the hotel). The hotel is spectacular, very old world with some modern paintings. The service is exceptional--the hotel arranged a tour of Sistine Chapel with a tour guide who got us in about 10 min before the crowds arrived. Not cheap but well worth the price. The hotel is actually one of the better bargains for what you get: a grand setting within easy walking distance of everything you would want to see. The hermes bath products were a very nice touch and were replinished regularly. The bathroom was probably the best hotel bathrooms that I can recall---roomy, but not absurdly so: two sinks and a separate tub and shower and a separate toilet room. So often, older grand hotels have small, small bathrooms which always disappoints my wife. Not the case with the St Regis. The hotel was renovated sometime in 2000 (I think) and they clearly spent time on updating the size of the bathrooms. We stayed in a deluxe king room and it was well suited for two people. A roll-away bed would be possible but would make the room snug. I would definately have breakfast included in the room rate--if purchased separately it would have been quite expensive. It is served in the lobby (a grand setting for breakfast) and is almost enough to carry you through to dinner. My parents returned to the hotel this past Christmas and had a similarly great experience. In short a grand hotel that, altough expensive, is well worth the money. Also, the New Years party at the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ITALY-NOT-GOT-A-CLUE
Reviews.Content: Well I have never posted a review before but had such a great 5 day break at the St Regis Grand it had to be done. I stayed there 25th to 29th May for my wifes birthday(it was a surpirse trip) I was very impressed with the Hotel. The room was a double deluxe not a massive room but it had a small sitting area, huge bed with fresco's on the walls and high cellings. The marble barthroom was lovely with it's huge shower separate bath and marble sinks. We normally like to stay in modern contemporay rooms but I decided that on this occasion that we would stay in a classical Rome style room and this did not dissappoint. The staff could not do enough for you and found them very pleasant and help full. Breakfast - Very enjoyable with a varied continental style available although I did see an American guy compliain about the lack of cheeses. My only negaitive( or warning) is the restaurant in the evening is very expensive, we ate there possibly first night for a light meal, my wife had a toasted sandwich with cheese, mushroom and ham with fries on the side, I had a chicken salad( four small pieces of chicken) two classes of coke the bill was 75 euro. There are plenty of good restaurants in Rome and much better value than the hotel. The location is ideal spot just minutes from the repubblica metro line, Just be brave and go for it when crossing the road outside. The trip was fantastic and would will finish by recommend an amazing restaurant perfect for that special occasion Les Etolies is the place, overlooking St Peters Basillica (ask for a window table) the food was amazing and compared to the Hotel much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot describe the greatness of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pineappleeurope
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 6 days/5 nigths at the St. Regis and I have to say that no words can describe the outstanding service at this hotel - or should I say home, because that is how it feelt. What makes this hotel is the staff - courtious, helpful, kind, educated and friendly. The staff at St. Regis obviously love to work there and are not in hospitality because they have to be. We were travelling as a family with two small children and we were welcomed in Italy from the moment we arrived at the airport. At the hotel we were upgraded to a junior suite and immidiately when we arrived in our room the butler came to unpack our luggage and offer us coffee. The butler services was outstanding and personal. Always smiling. My husband turned 40 during our stay and on the day we recieved wine and the butlers came with cake and sang for him,-) Can you imagine the joy our girls felt;-) The concierge - Mr Mario - was of great help booking restaurants for us and recommending sites etc. We had dinnner one evening at Mirabelle at the Splendid Royal hotel - the view from this Michelin star restaurant is just breathtaking. While dining on the roof terresse you may enjoy a sun set behind the St. Peters church and all of Rome is at your feet. What more can you ask for? For an informal familiy dinner I would recommend Giglio restaurant in via Torino - super service and very family friendly - like the rest of Rome actually! Also, do go the the zoo - a great childrens zoo in the heart of Rome and the Vila Borgese park. You can rent bikes here and have great fun. Don't let any one tell you that Rome is not for small kids - it is great and when we came home today all our 3 year old could say was 'I want to go back to the hotel'! The suite was fine - I have stayed at better equiped hotels I must admit but I will always return to St. Regis - my new second home in Rome. We had room 103 and the view was not that good. Also we did lack room for all our clothes - but had we asked I am sure they would have come up with a solution for us;-) Security is superior - the police was there all the time due to VIPs in residence. Note the bullet proof glass doors on some of the suite doors......... The location is very good - not too close to all the touristy sites - thank god. The Westin is on the 'street of 5 star hotels' but is is very flash and 'new rich' I think. St. Regis is low key subtle luxury for the people in the know!

Reviews.Title: “okay stay”
Reviews.Author: travelmaddy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice off course, so it should for the price. Staff is a bit arrogant, but you get that quite often in 5* hotels. Food is very expensive and not all that... The location is good, close to the train and bus station and all the sites. (Rome is a beautiful city, great food and not expensive if you go where the italians go.) The rooms are comfortable, huge bed, marble bathrooms etc. But no kettle, there never are in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary! La Dolce Vita!”
Reviews.Author: herculepoirot
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored. Sumptuous decor. Charming, romantic and representative of what a great European hotel should be. Avoid eating there, however, as the cuisine -- across the board -- is below moderate. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “a unique experience”
Reviews.Author: tpats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis Grand for a weekend in April 2007. This is a really luxurious hotel, built in 1894 by Cesar Ritz and renovated in 1999, but still keeping this aura of that old era. Every room is different to others, having a painting of a landmark of Rome and named after it. The room is furnished with classical pieces, of late 19th/early 20th century style. However, beds are extraordinarily comfortable and every need you may have is lavishly catered for - expensive toiletry items from Hermes, large 32 inch 16:9 LCD TV, DVD player, high speed internet connection etc. etc.. The lobby is impressive, same are the banquet and meeting rooms, reminding of a rennaissance palace. Rooms are expensive - but they are worth it. You may meet celebrities: during our stay Robert De Niro was allegedly staying in the Royal Suite. The property is located next to Piazza de la Repubblica (metro station), 10 minutes walking distance to Via Veneto and 15 minutes to the Spanish steps. Definetely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: desirepath
Reviews.Content: A fantastic stay. My wife an I spent 3 days with our 3 children in 2 adjoining rooms. Fantastic beds,beautiful rooms, charming and helpful staff. Breakfast wasn't great, but still the best we saw in 14 days in Italy (they don't really 'do' breakfast). Not the best location for sightseeing - but superbly located for the train station (less than a 5 min walk). The best place we were in on this trip, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before flying home”
Reviews.Author: djembe123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a 2-week "tour" of Italy. We had to spend the night in Rome before our flight the next day and this was such a good choice. After 2 weeks of B&Bs we very much appreciated the extremely comfortable bed, round-the-clock service and large room (we were upgraded). It is expensive, yes, but it was worth it for one night to relax before our flight...I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but way too old-world”
Reviews.Author: DowntownNYCers
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a little farther away from everything, but Rome is relatively small anyway so it didn't really bother me. Wherever you stay in Rome, be sure to cross the river and check out what's on the other side of it, especially Trastevere. In general, the neighborhoods on the other side of the river felt much less touristy and, as a result, more relaxed and, well, special. The staff was wonderful. We had a couple of minor issues with the air conditioning, but otherwise we were very happy with everything. The concierge arranged all our travel to the Amalfi Coast from Rome, including purchasing our train tickets for us and contacting our hotel on the Amalfi Coast so they would send a driver to pick us up at the train station. That was very helpful. The lounge and restaurant are beautiful and you feel like royalty sitting in either. The only snooty people at the hotel were some of the guests. I found the staff overwhelmingly friendly and helpful. And yes, if you get in a taxi and tell the driver to take you to the St. Regis, he will have no idea what you're talking about. So just say you're going to "le Grand Hotel." My only two complaints are minor. First, the room decor was insanely over-the-top, and not in a good way. I almost felt overstimulated by the excessive decorations and embellishments everywhere. Just about every single thing in the room was multi-colored with gold accents and tassels. The wallpaper was textured and multi-colored. To top it all off, there was a giant, slightly bizarre painting on the wall opposite our bed that was incredibly distracting and just downright weird. It was a painting of two naked men and a basset hound. It was painted in a pseudo-Renaissance way, but just seemed like bizarre motel art. The hotel's undergone a $60-70 million renovation, but, honestly, it seemed like every cent of that money went to the ground floor (restaurant, lobby, etc.) and the bathrooms -- which were gorgeous and stocked to the gills with Hermes products. (Weird that it wasn't Acqua di Parma or something, but Hermes isn't bad.) The rooms themselves seem slightly old - or maybe just really old-fashioned. I know that's some people's cup of tea, but if it's not yours, you should consider staying somewhere else. That said, our room -- which was a double -- was HUGE. It was all one room, but there was a sitting area, a separate desk station, a giant bed, a little vanity, a large armoire for the TV, and a giant closet. And with all that the room still felt spacious. Also, I would skip the food in the hotel restaurant -- it's very good, but incredibly expensive, and I found I could get equally delicious food elsewhere for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Old school Italian decor”
Reviews.Author: NicholeBa
Reviews.Content: St. Regis hotel is also known as Le Grand Hotel which is helpful if you're in a cab. Location is good. It's next to the Piazza de Republica and within walking distance of the bus terminal. The hotel lobby was amazing with a huge chandelier and elegant sofas and chairs with little tables to meet and talk. The bar was off to the side of lobby which was very nicely decorated. They also give you a series of little treats to eat while you have a drink or two--which is somewhat appreciated considering a glass of wine is about $15. The door guy opens up your door with the whole tuxedo and top hat on. They give you Hermes bath products in your room and replenish almost daily. If you have long hair like me, you should opt to bring your own shampoo and conditioner because it doesn't lather--maybe they have hard water?? There's a fresh fruit platter in the room, which I recommend you try the orange (blood orange). Different from home, very sweet and good. Beds: The bed which are called Heavenly beds are just that, heavenly. Crisp white linens and fluffy pillows with down comforters--I loved sleeping in that bed. We were on the 4th floor which was hot all the time, so we slept with the windows open and it was fine. I actually felt like I was sleeping in a dining room.
