It was strange to sleep under a chandelier with a painted fresco with track lighting behind you on the wall, but was very elegant and nice. There's also a hair dryer in the room in the desk drawer. (took me awhile to find) and if you bring your curling iron, just call guest servies and they'll bring you a plug adapter. Tips: *Don't buy a bus ticket. None of the locals do. Get on at the back door and off where you want, no one notices or says anything. *McDonald's is terrible. Very salty and overpriced, go to a Gastronomia and get a sandwich instead. *Try the ice cream. *The cabs will scam you. Make sure you know where you are going in Italian or have someone write it down for you. Watch the guy so that he does not press any addtional charges on the cab meter and it would be beneficial for you to get in a cab where the meter is located on the top by the rear view mirror instead of within hands reach. From the hotel no cab should cost more than $8, unless you are traveling out of the city's limits. *Check open hours of Sistine Chapel, Vatican, and St. Peter's Bascilica. Sometimes they're closed and sometimes they're only open till noon. *Wear comfortable shoes. Lots of walking and most streets are cobblestone and uneven. *Campo de Fiori is only nightlife section we found. Good for a couple drinks and chatting--75 percent tourists though.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights in glorious rome”
Reviews.Author: kandylandmo
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed for 6 nights at the st regis grand over the holidays this past december. we had two connecting rooms and were very happy with the accomodations. the hotel is gorgeous....very classic, elegant and sumptuous. the breakfast in the morning was just wonderful and the service was impeccable. everyone from the waitstaff to the concierges and the bellman were just terrific....polite and very friendly. as rome is relatively small, the hotel's location didn't seem off the beaten path and it was easy to wander over to the major sites. since we had youngish children with us, we did not do any fine dining, but most italian resataurants, bistros and cafes are welcoming and very good. highly recommend getting a guide for the vatican, well worth the price. rome is just fabulous, we came, we saw and we were blown away!!!

Reviews.Title: “An very beautiful grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: motutoopua
Reviews.Content: We booked the St. Regis Grand Rome through American Express Platinum Card and enjoyed our stay in Rome at this magnificent property. Through the Platinum Card, we were upgraded from a deluxe room to an Imperial room, which was spacious and beautifully appointed. The room was very comfortable and we thought it could possibly be the best that Rome has to offer in terms of accommodations. Overall a very beautiful hotel and certainly one of the city’s most elegant. There were some trivial downsides when taking into consideration the EUR 750 per night room rate. Worth mentioning were the quality of the bedding, i.e. the pillow covers, the bed linens, etc. They were hard and not the most comfortable for a good night's sleep. Furthermore, the bathroom, while lovely, was only moderately sized and not comparable to, say, The Ritz London, which feature very spacious and luxurious bathrooms. Worth keeping in mind but obviously not something to fret over as it nevertheless is a fine hotel indeed. We received excellent service throughout our stay. However, this was overshadowed by the Check-in and Check-out staff, both of whom seemed totally indifferent and just fell short of being rude. One is likely to have higher expectations when staying in a hotel of this category. Despite some minor negative points, we would still rate the St. Regis as a very lovely place to stay in Rome and would recommend to anyone wising to enjoy plush accommodations while not being on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “one word ..fab”
Reviews.Author: lexyrome
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this fantastic hotel in November with my boyfriend. Had a lovely dinner in the restaurant. The lobby is amazing and I recommend going for a nice cool beer after walking around Rome you will get lovely choice of nuts and chips to go with your beer. The room was amazing and had the best pillows I have ever slept on! the only thing that got us was the cost..it was €8 for a small bottle of coke from the minibar! So I wouldn’t recommend if you are on a budget. But overall a really good hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: travelpage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights on the weekend of December 2nd. You would have to look long and hard to find a more classically beautiful hotel. As Strarwood members we received a free upgrade (to a junior suite). The room was very nice, and much larger that expected. The bathroom was quite large as well. The suites are individually decorated with the name of the room corresponding with the wall painting over the bed. Not much of a view out the window, but come on...it's Rome. For a great view go for a walk! The hotel is a short 1-2 block walk from two Metro stations, and about a 10-15 minute walk from the Termini train station (we walked easily from the train station with our rolling luggage). Heads up...the weekend we were there was a train/bus strike. At random times they would just stop running and walk off. If you ask me a good dose of Ronald Reagan style of firing every one of the employees is long past being called for. For Dan Brown fans, one of the churches featured in his "Angels & Demons" book is across the street. If you can pay the rate ($400 plus) it is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: kconsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 4 nights in November. It is an extremely elegant and beautiful hotel. The lobby and restaurant are very grand and the room was probably one of the most elegant and large I have ever stayed in. We stayed in a Imperial suite I loved the chocolate and fruit welcoming us and the Hermes bath items were fun too. My mom stayed in a Junior suite and she got Acqua di Parma bath goodies(it's the little things!). The location was ok- I have two small children and we had to cab it and walk very far to see the sites and there weren't tons of restaurants. Overall a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “For the price it is awful”
Reviews.Author: Blikker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent six nights at St. Regis in Rome. The Tom and Kat wedding guest had just left and the hotel seemed dead. First we were given a junior suite with two tiny rooms that was so overdecorated that there was no place to put down a book and you would be afraid of knocking down something while getting dressed. The tiny windows faced a small dark gray courtyard where the sun would never shine. We asked for another room and got one of their Empiral rooms. Cheaper, but a nice big room with a good view over the square and far fewer golden nicknacks. Then as my husband was off for a meeting, I ordered a roomservice Napolitano pizza. Threequarters of an hour later, the waiter came saying here is your Margarita pizza. I said no I ordered the Napolitano with the anchovis. The fellow said, oh excuse me, your Naolitano pizza and took of the cover to a completely plain tomato and a bit of cheese pizza and said: The anchovis are in there. That it was a lie was plain, but after he left I took a bite and called room service and asked for the Napolitano. Fifteen minutes later the waiter brought a bowl of anchovis right out of the can! I expressed my surprise that for 18 euros it was not possible to get a baked Naolitano pizza in Rome. The waiter finally laughed and said that the cook was crazy and from Napoli. Another half hour, and I had the pizza I ordered with anchovis, oregano and a one inch burn all the way around. The pizza incident describes our experience. The bathroom had a terrible smell from the zink that did not get unclogged while we were there. The room was still not made up when we returned after six hours of sightseeing. The heavy front door to the hotel was usually not manned during the day. The porters were chatting inside. Had my husband not scheduled several meetings at this hotel we would have left after the pizza. At 538 euro a night and 8 euro per bottle of water this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevMarc
Reviews.Content: This is a truly deluxe hotel, although we were a little disappointed that our room only had one sink. However, the lobby is fabulous, and the location can't be beat. It's walking distance to scores of restaurants, churches, etc., about a mile from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, and it's truly deluxe (Russell Crowe and Nicole Kidman were both there at different times during our stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay at St. Regis - Rome”
Reviews.Author: misticane
Reviews.Content: We relied on Tripadvisor when we were making our plans for our Honeymoon, so now that we are back we want to report on our stay at the St. Regis. We had a horrible time getting to the St. Regis from Sorrento, Italy where we had spent a few days. Alitalia Airlines bumped us from our flight, made us sit around the airport for 5 hours, then when we finally got to Rome we found that they had lost our luggage. With a shrug we were sent on our way into Rome... Getting to the St. Regis was a relief after our horrible Alitalia experience. It's very ornate and old fashioned elegance. The front desk was very helpful and called the airline daily looking for our luggage. It was never found... The room had a welcome bottle of champagne and a treat. They left treats for us every night - a bottle of wine, brownies. It was different every night. The bathroom was very large and lovely. The bartenders at the bar were great and brought practically a meal of snacks everytime we sat down for a drink. It's very expensive but the bartenders were great. The staff are very helpful and rooms are very nice. We used their business center daily at a charge of 4 eu an hour. The concierge made dinner reservations for us and recommendations for sight seeing. Overall it's an upscale hotel. It's expensive. I think if I went to Rome again I'd have no qualms staying here, but I prefer a little bit more of a modern/hip/younger scene when I travel and the St. Regis is very old school - but in a very nice way.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous and did I mention gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Ahwatukee
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. I base this on proximity to transportation and sites, lobby area, check in clerk, concierge helpfulness, room cleanliness/size and bed comfort. The hotel was close enough to the bus or subway line, but we took a taxi from the Rome train station for 10 euros. You get white glove service from the moment you arrive. The hotel clerk shows you to your room and explains the basics to you so that you can get comfortably settled into your room. We are Starwood members, but not that frequent so I was surprised when we were upgraded to a gorgeous room. Maybe, this is standard for a deluxe room, but we had a sitting area with 2 chairs table and couch, a desk/tv area and then a large bed area that had a feather bed top (but still 2 twins pushed together). The bathroom was a very long, large bathroom with a great soaking tub, vanity area and double sinks area separately. The shower could have fit 20 people inside. But the most impressive part were the Hermes toiletries. My husband loved them so much we purchased more in London. There was turn down service and they also put some lovely music on the nice stereo system in the room so you could relax after a long day. The internet was extra at 15 euros/night, but everywhere in Europe is extra it seems. We ordered room service after a really long day on the train and it was very expensive, but expected for room service at a hotel of this caliber. We paid 60 euros for 2 diet cokes, a club sandwich and a ham and cheese sandwich. The diet cokes were 8 euros alone. The portions were large though and we could have easily shared 1 club sandwich. The other must mention is the complimentary candies they restock daily in the room. The are called Perugina gelees candies and once you try them you will be hooked. Make sure you buy some when you are in Rome as I found out when back in the U.S. that they cannot be purchased over the internet. It's worth the trip back to Rome just for those candies.

Reviews.Title: “A grand experience”
Reviews.Author: pursuit
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 6 nite stay at the St Regis. ROOM: -stayed in one of the Imperial rooms on the 3rd floor overlooking the Piazza d. Repubblica. the room was huge. service impeccable. the bed is incredibly comfortable. very quiet. could not hear any noise from the hall or from either side of us or above us (i believe the 4th floor is the highest). apparently the hotel was fully booked while we were there so the rooms were occupied. I do agree that it is hard to tell where the 40million dollar renovation was done. my guess would be the all marble bathrooms, which were great. spotless. the hermes products are a little overpoweringly scented in my opinion but if you like that, it's great. there was a tub and marble standup shower--terrific water pressure. HOTEL SERVICE: -did not dine at the hotel; ordered room service once for a VERY early bkft--arrived right on time at 6am as requested. and it was delicious. -the average age of the guests is probably above 40s. we are in our 30s and were definitely among the younger guests. did not see any young children so it was quiet. the main area off the lobby is beautiful; can enjoy the piano music at tea time or while sipping an aperitif. very elegant. -Mario Santulli, head concierge, was great. I am a compulsive planner. emailed him an entire list of reservations for restaurants and events that needed to be done for our trip and he took care of all the details flawlessly. LOCATION -it is within 15 minute walking distance to the colosseum area, 20 minutes to the Piazza Navona. Definitely worth taking the time the first one or two trips out, but to save time (and our energy...it's hot in September--sunny mid 80s) we took cabs everywhere (we're from new york city--we're used to it, as we are used to the traffic noises that may bother you if you are from a quiet area--there are sirens, traffic sounds; for us, it was just like home and slept right through it all). -yes, it is very expensive. but if you can splurge a little, it's worth it. -we had NO regrets about our choice

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Italian Welcome”
Reviews.Author: aztroon
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to Italy by staying our first three nights in Rome at the St. Regis Grand Hotel Rome. The hotel is very nice, and the staff does a nice job as well. We arrived around 9pm as our flight was late. Our room was very nice and large, especially for Europe and had a view of the interior courtyard of the Hotel. We had requested a rollaway bed through the web site, however at check-in there was some confusion and they told us it would be an additional 99 euros. Of course we had to have it since our son was traveling with us. We ran into problems with the shower, as it would not drain, and the glass door to the shower would not close. We reported it to Engineering but they only fixed the drain, not the door. So we were dissapointed, especially with this being the St. Regis, the best hotel in Rome. The hotel itself underwent a $40 million renovation about 10 years ago, and is starting to show its age again. The location is nice, but a little out of the way (the Westin Excelsior and Hotel Eden are closer the sites and restaurant row on Via Veneto). The Concierge was very nice, and did an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception at St. Regis Grand (Rome)”
Reviews.Author: funkedupcat
Reviews.Content: Deciding upon the right venue for our wedding reception was obviously a very important decision...we really wanted to get it right. We nearly booked the highly recommended Hassler hotel (top of the Spanish steps), but they had maintenance works going on...so we had to look elsewhere. I'm so glad we did look elsewhere...the Hassler was lovely (they did my hair on the wedding day)...but I doubt they could have competed with the St. Regis Grand. They went out of their way to make sure that the day went very smoothly and we were absolutely overjoyed by the staff, the venue, the food (the food was amazing) and the room. We only stayed one night (we couldn't afford to stay longer!)...we I wished we could have stayed for a few more nights...because it was simply lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time in Rome and St Regis”
Reviews.Author: newspike
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at St Regis in mid May. Everyone will have different opinions on their stay - our visit was great. I read every review on Travelocity before we booked the St Regis and it did not disappoint. Some things to note: It is pricey - something you cannot get around. I loved the bed. I have a hard time sleeping virtually anywhere, including my own home. The bed was so comfortable I was able to sleep like a rock. Our room was on the 4th floor, overlooking the Piazza Republica. Maybe because we were higher up we did not hear the traffic that others state was loud. When we closed the window - silence. The bathroom was clean and large enough for me. European hotels can have tiny bathrooms. This one is fine. Based on comments on this site we never ate in the hotel. Everyone says it is too expensive so we did not even try it. We did drink at the bar late at night - they even stayed open to serve us when we arrived after closing time. We are in our mid 30's and walked to nearly every site - the exclusion being Vatican city. We took the Metro for 1e. We found he best food at Monte Caruso (within walking distance). It was always filled with locals. No tourists. Every dish was unique and home made. The hotel hallways were quite large - not a factor in staying there I suppose. The concierge hooked us up with a travel agency across the st. for a day trip out of town. Reasonably priced but just an OK guide. The metro is convienent. At no time, including at 2am, did we feel unsafe walking anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but don't compare it to Paris' 5 stars...”
Reviews.Author: mynameisjonc
Reviews.Content: After doing some extensive research on my vacation to Rome, I finally decided to go to the St. Regis Grand. I got a pretty good rate at 320 Euros (corporate rate), expecting it to be star quality when I arrive. Truth is, I was not, really. Okay, there should be guest reporting some fine services and awesome rooms. (there were good rooms and not so good rooms mind you). I stayed at what I thoguht was not such a good room. okay, I'm going into some detail here...first off: the lights were too white and bright -- for the halls and the rooms. I heard there was some renovation, but, I'm sure for the normal rate, they could afford to install flat screens in the rooms (and maybe even the bathrooms). It may not help by a mile, but it sure does impress; and satisfy. Next off, the carpet. Old-ish, weak design, dusty. The room I stayed in (202), was not such a good room, but I'm sure there are quite a few like mine. (I simply cannot wonder how they make the rooms looks so good and nice...hmm...). Anyways, I'm sure there are bettter rooms, but some detail must not be overlooked at hand. The bathrooms, on the other hand, were good. period. Good bath products (interesting orange scent) and a pretty deep soaking tub (if not long enough), and beautiful large gold framed mirors adjourn the walls. One complaint though, when showering, the water turns cold then hot or vice versa, even if you fix it at a specific temp.; this happens quite a lot. Service at the St. Regis was not too bad, for Italy (dont compare it with top hotels in Paris though). They seem helpful at times, and the restaurants they recommend us to were not entirely the best (some good ones albeit), and I did rely on the Michelin guide for the best in Rome. However, unless you're not a gastronomic gourmet, those recommendations are not that bad; sometimes pretty good. Because of the taxi strike in Rome, I had to walk to the restaurants nearby. It happend 2 days after my trip, and luckily i tasted some of Rome's supposed best before then. The nearby recommendations were not bad though. If there is a taxi strike for some reason, you should avoid limousine service (very pricey) unless you can afford it; but still, I found it to be slightly over the reasonable limit. The location of the St. Regis is okay; its a long walk to the Spanish Steps and the tourist places, as well as major shops (about 20-30 mins walk to the Steps); the concierge kept assuring me it was only a 10 min walk, -.- . However, on the bright side, there is metro and bus station very nearby, and the train takes 2 stops to the Steps. (beware of pickpockets) Woud I recommend this hotel? Yes and No: Yes if: you're rich. more than willing to pay. can spend. did not really need to save up for this. - you're staying at a very good room. To be safe, the best suites with the best view - you don't expect top class perfection for service - you got a really good rate for a room (maybe corporate rates dont reserve the best sometimes) No if: you agree with my fickle criticisms mentioned earlier - you saved up to pay for the normal rate (even the corporate rates pretty expensive; not even worth what i paied for) - you're pretty stingy with hotels and you want the best for money - you stayed at other better hotels (except St Regis is the only one) - you think the 5 star hotels in Rome are on par with hte 5 star hotels in Paris (incl. what you paid for)

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: lupo1NewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks in Italy and ended in Cap Ferrat. The Grand Hotel was impeccable. We are accustomed to staying at Four Seasons level hotels and this hotel was impressive. The imperial romms are very large large and have Murano Glass chandeliers. Every detail was addressed. The staff attended to every detail perfectly. Their head concierge is probably one of the finest in the industry. The lobby lounge is as elegant as the Loius xv restaruant in Monte Carlo. We are very selective in our hotel choices and this one fulfilled just what we were looking for. The best dining choice for view and food in the city was Mirabelle. The view was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Grand but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the St. Regis in June 2006 and overall it was a very pleasant experience. The rooms were beautiful and quiet, although small, the bathrooms were first class (including size, furnishings and ameneties), the beds were very comfortable,and the gym was very good (it even had free bottled water, a fruit basket and towels). The lobby and the public rooms on the first floor are spectacular. The location is OK, but not great - it's about 2 long blocks from the train station and a good 15-25 minute walk from shopping and sight-seeing (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain). The people on the front desk were fluent in English and generally helpful. On the negative side: The concierge sent us to a restaurant that was way too expensive for the quality (i.e., tourist trap). The air-conditioning in our first room was inadequate and we had to change rooms (which they did without quibbling). I would not call the St. Regis Rome one of the world's great hotels, but it is a most enjoyable place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughts on St Regis”
Reviews.Author: WaldronofLondon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights at the St Regis this past May. On the plus side: * bedroom was lavishly decorated and furnished * the room had excellent internet connection (E15 per day) * the bed was superb * the linen was superb * the shower was superb (as were the bath products, all Hermes) * hotel bar and public areas are stunning (a vast fortune must have been spent recently on renovating this grand old dame of a hotel) * hotel barstaff delightful; cocktails reasonably priced * concierge and other staff were all helpful, friendly, and courteous On the negative side: * breakfast was not particularly imaginative * the location is not ideal for vacationers, as it is a fair walk to the usual spots (Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Via Veneto etc); we visited the Russie which has a fabulous location * there is no outside public space, so on a sunny day you are stuck inside (again, the Russie by comparison has an attractive garden - but it is much more expensive) Recommendations: * if possible, get a bedroom facing inwards; the road noise at the front of hotel is quite considerable * consider using taxis; by London standards they are remarkably cheap, and because the hotel is a bit out of the way for tourist activities, they save a lot of shoe leather * consider booking art/cultural tours with [------] - expensive but wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pvaz2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day visit to Italy with my wife, staying in Rome at St. Regis. Here is the real scoop (this is not a review shill placed by the hotel). This hotel is old, but very nice by European standards. Rooms are nicely decorated, but SMALL by American standards-I still am trying to figure out how they look so large in the pictures, because we could NOT get the camera angle from any location to make them look that large. They are NOT the Westin Heavenly Beds, but they are not uncomfortable either, just not the same as those great Westin beds you get in the USA. Bathrooms are also small, but nice and very functional (opt for the separate shower in your room if you can, they are great). Location is quite good, right near Via Veneto and all the shops, and a nice walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain (15-20 minutes). The hotel provided us with a fantastic guide who spoke pretty good english, to tour the Vatican, St. Peters Basilica, but the concierge is going to recommend the most expensive guides (everybody has to get paid!), so if you can get a recommendation from a friend, you may want to save some money that way. Their guides are $80 Euro per hour and you definitely do not want to do a walking tour, so they can arrange a Mercedes w/driver for another$40 Euro/hour In either event, get a guide that can get you into the Vatican and the Collusium without waiting in lines or you will regret it. Food at the hotel is way, way too expensive-YOu can eat great meals at Piazza Novona for 1/2 to 1/3rd the cost, and it is more fun. The dining room is spectacular however, just not that great and too expensive. The concierege was helpful, but didn't rush to help, we had to kind of push ourselves to get his attention, and then he attended to us nicely. Overall would stay again at this place but might try the Westin Excelsior just up the street next time just because it has a little bit better location and is in a little less busy area

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: NTTW1
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 4 night stay at the St. Regis in early May. Our junior suite was absolutely gorgeous...beautifully appointed and the bathroom was a dream. The butler service with our coffee delivered each morning with a wake-up call was something we could get used to! It was so nice to return to such luxury after a long day of sightseeing. Our one mistake was thinking it was walking distance from the termini...bad idea! Next time we'll take a cab. Our thanks to this forum for guiding us to this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - over priced”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcFly
Reviews.Content: St Regis is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location - just 5 mins walk from the train station and 2 metro stations. Decor is great, but be warned extras are very expensive (although in keeping with other 5* hotels). 8E for HALF a tube of Pringles from the mini bar, or 16E for a rum and Coke from the bar is just a rip-off. And they don't loan irons (it's illegal in Italy), so expect to have to pay 13E for every shirt you need ironed....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lawyermike
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this beautiful, classic hotel. We had a beautiful room with a spectacular view that was around Euro500 per night including room service breakfast. We were treated very well by the staff. At the time we arrived, our room was not quite ready. We were treated to coffee in the hotel's lobby bar for a short wait. The concierge arranged a private guide for a tour of the Vatican museum, which was a highlight of our trip. We used the same guide to see a number of other attractions. The hotel is centrally located and is very close to the train station. We would stay in this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: jta1012959
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel, but a little disappointing for such a revered hotel name. The lobbly and restaurant are beautiful. The staff was professional and courteous, but did not compare favorably with the staff in Florence at the Montebello Splendid Hotel we stayed at later. The bed was firm, the room a bit smallish, but with a refined decor. We were also dismayed at the smell that came from the bathroom--- we never figured out what was wrong. I recommend this hotel, but found the Forty Seven (which we stayed at on our return to Rome 5 days later) to be even better for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: texex91
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Plat one at least thinks they might be treated with a little respect--not here! At $500/night i was hoping for a good room and great service. Not so here. Was checked in by Angelo who could care less about the client. Got an upgrade to a room with no view and small--great job Angelo. Called manager to inquire and they did not care. Stay at top class hotels around the world and do not mind paying and all I ask in return is a hotel with great cust service. Not to be had here. Very stuffy and cold--no charm or personality at all. Stayed 3 nights and would never do it again. Decor is beatiful, but don't expect much in the way of service or concierge. Poor resturant recommendations--just send guest to tourist trap places--how boring. Did find great place close to hotel called Target--great food and service. Hope to find better place next time in Rome...what a complete disappointed the St. Regis was.

Reviews.Title: “in love with st regis...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with my mother and sister to Rome for spring break this year (6 days). None of us knew the language, and it was our first time in Italy--it was no problem because St. Regis made everything so easy. When we first entered, we were greeted so well. They upgraded us to a suite, and were escorted personally by the front desk to our room. The front desk knew very, very good english, which was a definite plus for us, since we didn't know much about the city at all. The room was big and beautiful. It had a seperate dressing room, and the bathroom was lovely (especially the Hermes amenities). The service was amazing, and the food was great (even though it was way too pricey--i payed 10 euro for a diet coke one night). My sister got the flu during the trip, and they went out and got us medicine for her, and would ask her everytime she left the hotel how she was feeling. We also left our phone chargers back home, and they promptly got one for us. Also, the day we were leaving, it was my sister's birthday, and for breakfast they baked her a cake, and sang her happy birthday. They were so warm, and hospitable, they really made us part of the family. They went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. When we had tours, they would arrange for the busses to pick us up at the hotel, and check the times, and make sure everything was in place. And if you're into exercising during vacation, they had an amazing gym with personal trainer at hand. The complimentary breakfast was fabulous. We loved the Omlette Chef, he was a great guy, and not to mention, extremely talented. They gave good recommendations too, and my mother would just stop to chat with the front desk before we left each day, because the staff was so friendly. Long review, i know, but there is so much more. I absolutely loved Rome and St. Regis. I hope to go back someday, hopefully stay there again, even though it is quite expensive. It was such a wonderful experience, I would recommend it, even if for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: We've had three wonderful stays at the St. Regis Rome and can not say enough about how wonderful this property is. The rooms and suites are lovely with quality furnishings, great beds and quality linens. Be certain to reserve a room on their butler floor. The butlers are incredible and really take care of all special needs. During our most recent stays we requested that the butler have a tailor come to our room for some alterations, repair a Gucci leather bag and locate an inexpensive international calling card. All tasks were done immediately and with genuine enthusiasm. The staff at the St. Regis are flawless. The service is delivered professionally and with a warm attitude. There is no haughtiness in this hotel although it is extremely elegant and formal in feeling. The service delivery is of an extremely high level - more like you would find in Asia instead of Italy. The concierge staff know the city exceptionally well and handle dining and tour requests with immediate efficiency. They are adept at selecting choices that fit your budget and personality. The suites at the St. Regis come in two forms - Junior Suites and Ambassador Suites. As a Starwood Preferred Guest platinum they will upgrade to these suites if you book a high enough category room and request an upgrade at the time of booking. If the suites are available upon check-in, they will upgrade. They are very beautiful decorated in "old world" Empire or Renaissance style blend. The only complaint is that the television channel selection is poor and the furniture, although beautiful, is not very comfortable. The buffest breakfast served in the lobby is delicious and bountiful. The lobby is the most beautiful of any hotel in room. It's an incredible way to start the day. This hotel is by far and away the best hotel in Rome if you can afford it. Value for money is excellent when taking into consideration the luxuriousness and quality of service offered.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that get's it right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my partner at midday to Rome. The hotel is very close to the train station although the walk is interesting! across a bus terminal, across roads and car parks! have a coffee before you leave the train as Italian drivers are truly mad!The train Leonardo express is so easy from the airport- clean and quiet,takes only 20 mins. Hotel is amazing,staff very well presented, concierge extremley helpful. Good advice for eating out. Room fantastic - we had a basic double but probably made the holiday. Decor is beautiful - painted murial above bed and luxurious finishings and furniture. Hermes toiletries and chocolates! Hotel walking distance to everything. Taxi rank outside. Bottom line - Expensive, brilliant service but overpriced if you order in. The decor is classic and now a few years old but still impressive. Certainly a wow! Wouldn't go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: Merlion1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome, spending 8 days at the St. Regis Grand where we celebrated our 10th year wedding anniversary. I'll break up my review into 4 parts: 1. Room Quality 2. Location 3. Service 4. Context - what our hotels do we judge our experience against I. ROOM QUALITY We stayed in a deluxe room on the 3rd floor (unfortunately not facing the Piazza). The room, by our experience in European hotels was large with a good, firm king size bed as well as a good size sitting area with a couch, coffee table, and a large writing desk. Bed linens were very nice (according to my wife). Decor was a bit ostentatious for our taste, but seemed to fit the period and style of the hotel. Lighting was a bit dim in the room, but wasn't a big deal. We received fresh fruit each day as well as Italian chocolates. The bathroom was large, again in the context of our European experiences. The shower was a bit small, but the bathtub was a good size. Water pressure was good, but during a long shower the water temp would begin to alternate between hot and cold rather than a steady flow of warm. Again, in the context of our European hotel experiences, not a big deal. II. LOCATION The hotel is close to the main train station. Having read some concern about safety, etc. in the area, from our perspective, we did not feel unsafe at all at any time of the day around the hotel. On our first day, we explored the area around the hotel, including the area around the train station and, while crowded, didn't seem to be any different than other major metropolitan areas. Taxis were plentiful and had no problem understanding our poor attempts at Italian when we wanted to go back to the hotel (many know it as the Grand Hotel rather than the St. Regis or St. Regis Grand). Distance to major attractions (within Rome and ex-The Vatican) were 10-15 minutes of leisurely walking. III. SERVICE This is where I feel (in contrast to the reviews I read which led me to book the hotel) a bit let down. The service started off mixed with the attempt to get a hotel car to pick us up from the airport. It was easier to call the St. Regis reservation line in the US (which I did) than to book the car directly with the hotel concierge (First they insisted I had to fax them a request before they could act on it. Then they said they would settle for an email as they needed written confirmation of the request). When we arrived, there was no doorman to help us or the driver with the luggage until the luggage was out of the car (despite our 6-7 am arrival time and no visible guests out front or in the lobby). Similarly, each morning we left the hotel, on occassions we needed a cab (e.g. to the Vatican), the doorman neither acknowledged us, nor offered to help us get a cab, nor offered to ensure that the cab driver understood where we wanted to go (which on occassion was a problem). This changed a bit when we finally got to the check-in desk where Helena checked us in and cheerfully and generously offered us the room early (we arrived at 7 am on a Sunday). In addition, she pointed out some places that we might want to go on a Sunday morning to people watch, have a coffee and have a good view of the city (which we did and thoroughly enjoyed). Each morning she was on duty and when we needed assistance from the front desk, she would greet me by name and appeared enthusiastic to help. Unfortunately, the service seemed to stop there. My dealings with the concierge were broadly disappointing. From my initial attempts to book a car pickup from the airport to my departure where the concierge called me, hurrying me up to come down to check out (at 10 am!), interactions lacked any sense of interest in my needs as a guest. (Admittedly, the manager tried to explain that the call was really just to check up on me rather than to hurry me up, but both the tone and the language certainly didn't contain any indications of concern and rather seemed to encourage me to make my way downstairs.) Most disappointing was a request which I called into the concierge for "something special" upon arrival as this was both our first trip to Rome and our 10th wedding anniversary which I reminded them again in my email requesting the car pick-up. To my disappointment, there was nothing special (unless a bowl of fruit each day is considered special) when we arrived and nothing special during the trip. Perhaps, it was presumptuous of me to have asked for it. However, it would have been nice to be told that it wasn't something they do so that I could arrange something myself. IV. CONTEXT Our judgements about rooms and service in particular were judged against our experiences of the same at our favorite hotels (below). We've also tried to take into account that rooms and room sizes/styles differ from country-to-country and region-to-region. ASIA Four Seasons Hotel (Singapore) Four Seasons Hotel (Tokyo-Marunouchi) Mandarin Oriental (Hong Kong) Park Hyatt (Sydney) US St. Regis Hotel (New York) Four Seasons Hotel (San Francisco) UK/EUROPE Dukes Hotel (London) Four Seasons Hotel (Paris - Georges V) OVERALL I will forever remember our stays at the St. Regis Hotel in New York, not because the rooms are the best (they're not), nor because of its great location (which it has). Rather, I'll remember our stays there (and at all of our favorites) because each time, the staff seems to go out of their way when they don't need to to make us feel like we're the only guests in the hotel. Unfortunately, I expected this from the St. Regis Grand in Rome. Instead, I received a good room and a decent location with little of the warmth and thoughtfulness that characterizes our favorite hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally High Standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although it is now some time since we stayed at the Grand, reading some of the reviews posted here brought back very good memories. So, to add my weight to those who have posted before, this really is a noteworthy hotel. From the moment we arrived (three hours before official check-in) to the moment we departed, the hotel just kept on impressing. That's not to say that everything was instantly and always perfect - but it is the mark of a truly professional operation when the inevitable hitches that affect us all are dealt with with such style and efficiency. It's probably pointless talking about upgraded rooms and special gifts because I am a Platinum SPG Member. You might not be a cardholder or the hotel might be very full when you visit and an upgrade isn't available. What you need to know is that the location is good, the standard of the public areas is exceptional, the staff are gracious but discreet, the decor in the guest rooms is opulent, the beds are extremely comfortable, the toiletries are top-notch and the hotel's restaurant (rated #1 in Rome by Zagat) is worthy of global recognition. All in all, the hotel really is a perfect example of what a good, traditional-style city hotel should be. The fact that so many are so poor elevates this one from good to great however! Finally, if you don't otherwise get the chance, do ask one of the staff to let you have a look at the 'Salone Ritz' - the hotel's main function room. I can't think of many other hotels I would recommend you inspecting the function rooms at - but this one really is beautiful. I do hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did - and look forward to returning as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: “expected better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had prebooked and prepaod our reservation throuh st regis usa when we arrived 12/26 they had no rexervation for us if i could not provide a copy of the onfirmation i dont thimk we would of had a room. the room was small even though we had booked a king and paid for it. upon chekout they required us to pay again because they still could not find record of our reservation. we have stayed in many five star hotels this was not one of them

Reviews.Title: “Glorious”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: This is a real pearl. First and foremost, the service is impeccable. Our suite was hugely tasteful – incredibly comfortable and beautifully furnished (an upgrade as a Starwood platinum guest making this perhaps the best bargain ever at EUR 290 per night). The hotel restaurant is superb – it’s Zagat’s number one rated restaurant in Rome, and we could see why. Very much at the upper end of five star luxury as city hotels go. Absolutely excellent, and recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: pcerinocanova
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a non-smoking room through SPG. When we got there they gave us a smelly room, so I had to go back and ask for another room. The second one was incredibly small, so I had to complain again. Well, they eventually hosted us in the Designer Suite... What can I say? It was absolutely fabulous and, luckily, a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Grand”
Reviews.Author: Philleas_Fogg_uette
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay in St Regis Grand in early January was a wonderful experience. 1. Upon early arrival at around 11.00am we received a complementary upgrade to an Imperial Room. We were led to our room immediately, and happily discovered that it was very large, superbly furnished and with a very beautiful view of Piazza de la Republica and a grand all-marble bathroom. Considering we had booked a Superior room for only 350 Euro per night including breakfast, we thought what we got was well worth the money. 2. The hotel is very well located, 1 minute walk to the metro stop and about 10-15 minutes walk to Trevi-Spanish steps. 3. The hotel is also very well staffed, with friendly and professional personnel. I never managed to count the doormen or the waiters in the breakfast area. Housekeeping also does a very good job, and our room and all public areas were super clean. 4. Breakfast is very good, with a good selection of fresh and very good quality hot and cold goodies. It is served in the bar, an area which stands on a higher level of the grand lobby. 5. The hotel's restaurant 'Vivendo' was very good (Try the Lobster!). We also got a great restaurant recommendation from the hotel's concierge: the Al Moro, near the Trevi fountain. Great REAL Italian food! 6. We are a couple in our early thirties, and it was nice to find that the hotel, despite its very classical setting, had many guests of our age group. We felt very comfortable. 7. Piazza de la Republica is busy with traffic all the time, but the rooms are double glazed and with heavy curtains, so we had no noise problems. 8. The area around the hotel is safe. In fact all Rome feels very safe, apart perhaps from the area immediately next to the Termini Station late at night, which still is not all that bad. Overall, the St Regis Grand is a top-of the-top hotel, and we would gladly recommend it to even the most demanding traveller. Two final notes. First, Rome is a woderful place and upon leaving we were really hoping we would be able to return there on day soon. Second, for our transport from and to the airport we were very happy to have booked with Stefano Constantini (Romecabs), who is very punctual, talkative and pleasant. He gave us a mini-tour of Rome on the way to our hotel and was also very up-beat on the way back despite it being early morning on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Read my Review”
Reviews.Author: travelnovember
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently were lucky enough to have stayed at the St. Regis Grand in Rome in Nov. of 2005. The staff was incredible. The room was breathtaking. We were on the 4ht level lookin over the interior garden and the stars. The bath was top of the line, a trademark for westin as we found out in Florence. When we flew in from Lauderdale, we were beat, and we ordered room sevice... I eat out alot and that was one of the best Filet Mignons I have ever eaten. She loved the Sea Bass as well.It was definatly a great start to our vacation. If you rent a car I suggest Maggiore its an Italian Company very easy to deal with and close to the hotel. You dont need a car in Rome. We rented one to go up the coast then into Tuscanny. The autostrade was fun in my Alfa Romeo 147 about $400.00 for four days cant beat it and they have a drop off at the airport. Dont miss Sienna, it was our favorite place, spend two or three days, THe Piazza Reviso hotel was great there. San Germinianni was nice too. I ASKED HER TO MARRY ME IN FLORENCE AND SHE SAID YES !!! Some great restaurants Maggore in Sienna, Le Logga on the Plaza de Michangelo - thats were I proposed over looking Florence, great place awesome food..

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Base Camp: the St. Regis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our Honeymoon in Rome with an 8-night stay at the St. Regis Hotel. After many visits to Tripadvisor and reviews of other hotels, we chose the St. Regis because of its beauty, service and location. We're a thirty-something couple and wanted our trip to the Eternal City to be just right. First, the St. Regis is truly a 5-star hotel. The service is unparalled. Even though we arrived early, the front desk immediately accommodated us by serving us espressos and cookies in their grand and opulent lounge while we waited for our room. Best we ever tasted. After about an hour later, the front desk manager escorted us to our room. Even by American standards, this room was huge! We had a king size bed the biggest we've ever seen (and I'm 6'4), dual sinks in the bathroom and separate bathtub and shower. The mattress is extremely comfortable - Be careful, you might find yourself sleeping more than you wish. The Hermes bathroom products are nice. And the turn down service is wonderful touch (classical music is played from the TV and slippers are placed beside). A quick comment: Make sure to always keep your "do not disturb" sign on the door. It's not really a sign, but a button by the door handle. Early on, we were intruded upon when staff buzzed and quickly entered to either clean the room or check the mini-bar. A bit annoying when taking a nap... Problem was solved with the "do not disturb" sign. Second, the St. Regis likes to spoil its guests. The front desk sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne with chocolate dipped strawberries our first night; in fact, through out our week, we received complimentary fruit bowls, desserts, and other goodies. The concierge is the best. We used them to book tickets for a day trip to Florence, museum passes to the Villa Borghese and reservations at local restaurants. No charge! In fact, we never felt pressed to tip, however, we did show our gratitude with a few Euros here and there. It rained there too, so they had plenty of umbrellas for us to use (a little thing, but very important for a hotel of this quality). The breakfast buffet is awesome - fresh fruit, juice, and lots and lots of espresso. Don't forget to hit the omelet bar. Delicious. Breakfast was included in our rate. We also had Christmas dinner at their restaurant, the Vivendo. Absolutely delicious. Expensive, yes, but about the same price you would pay for a night out on the town in Los Angeles or New York. Make sure to ask for Luca. He is the manager and was always ready and willing to start your meal with a complimentary glass of champagne. We ate there twice. And finally, the hotel can't be better situated. We were less than 100 yards from Piazza Repubblica Metro. Very convenient. Across the street was the Museo Nazionale Romano. Two churches were also located about 50 yards from the front entrance of the Hotel worth a visit. The St. Regis is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon -our favorite neighborhoods. We also walked from the Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Via Veneto and the Vatican to the hotel. Again, all very convenient and very safe. Now a word about Rome... For those going to Rome the first time, you'll find it's a very small city and extremely compact. Expect to walk. It's truly the best way to enjoy this beautiful city, and can also help the digestion after a heavy meal. Be prepared, they like their food and you'll like their food (they serve huge portions). We NEVER had a bad meal. Too many restaurants to recommend. By the way, Rome is a very safe city. Some of the reviews posted here suggested that the St. Regis is in un-safe neighborhood. Couldn't be any further from the truth - we never felt threatened or afraid. Just use some common sense and you'll be all right. Bottom line: the St. Regis was the perfect base camp for us to launch our visit to Rome. The city is both an indoor and outdoor museum. Indeed, the St. Regis was our living museum as we toured and enjoyed this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “The Lap of Luxary”
Reviews.Author: amp94596
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several days over Christmas at the St. Regis Grand. From the moment we entered the front door until we left we were given the "grand" treatment. This is really a luxury hotel in every sense of the word. Having stayed at another hotel in Rome a week earlier, I can say for certain that staying at the St. Regis really showed us a different side of Rome which was especially nice for Christmas. The plush photos on their website are accurate, what you see you will actually get. A rare thing these days in internet booking. A few suggestions though. The front, street side rooms are very noisy all night long due to traffic. Avoid them or bring ear plugs. Also, their main dinning room which is supposed to be the number one Zaggat rated place to eat in Rome was good but not great. If you really want a special, pampered experience, stay at the St. Regis Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evsie
Reviews.Content: Lives up to its 5 * rating. Location is very good with easy walking distance to the city. Taxi’s are easy to get at the hotel front and 5 euro will take you anywhere around the city centre. Reception and concierge are very helpful and provide detailed city maps free. Rooms are spacious with fittings to match the luxury hotel. Bathroom is marble with a walk in shower, separate bath. Bathroom slippers provided. Air conditioning is efficient especially after walking the hot streets of Rome. Shopping area nearby and also good restaurants and snack places/bars. Fine dinning room. Also dine on the raised area by the hotel bar for lighter lunches with all day club sandwiches ect. Good quality fitness room on the 4th floor. Hotel worth the money for a luxury trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis for a week. We had a great time. The Hotel is beautiful, our room was great and the staff were pleasant and helpful. We walked everywhere (granted we are frequent walkers). I would definitely stay there again. The only "nit" I have revolves around breakfast. We made a novice mistake and assumed that breakfast was included (or that it would be obvious that it wasn't). Lo and behold, not only was it not included, but the buffet was expensive. Ordering individual items a la carte would have been far cheaper. As I said, a rookie mistake on our part.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: emilyrushing
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome and decided to stay at the St. Regis after reading all of the excellent reviews. Needless to say, we were not disappointed! The hotel is immaculate, the service superb, and the rooms opulent. This was the best hotel shower I have ever used, without question. Unfortunately we only had one night in Rome to enjoy the room, but it was a great night! I highly recommend eating at Vivendo located in the hotel lobby. The food was fantastic and the service superb. We asked them to pick our wines based upon our four courses and they could not have picked better matches! One of the best meals I have ever had. I will absolutely stay here next time I'm in Rome and plan to stay longer than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: ScottieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for two nights last week. It was absolute heaven. The service was fantastic. Everyone was very polite and very helpful. They all spoke very good English. We asked for restaurant recommendations and they jumped to not only make the recommendations but make reservations for us. We asked about a tour guide for the Vatican Museum and they jumped to take care of that for us. The room was gorgeous and the huge marble bathroom luxurious. We had a very nice view of a church across the street and heard no street noise. As far as location is concerned - we thought it was fantastic. Easy walk to several sites; quick 5 euro taxi ride to the Colesium and the Forum. Love the Hermes bath products - actually went to the Hermes store in Rome to purchase their cologne and lotion. Wonderful hotel - absolutely recommend. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The St. Regis IS grand”
Reviews.Author: sobriquet47
Reviews.Content: This is a virtually flawless show and well worth the money. Location looks to be in a transitional area but proved to be no problem and very convenient to two Metro stops. Service was impeccable except for one incident where a bellman was called but never appeared to get our luggage when we were checking out. A couple of surprises: bed linens were much below the quality that a hotel of this caliber would suggest as were the bathroom paper products. However, with one's own personal butler, turn down service that included a linen cloth on the floor for morning feet and complimentary cozy slippers, copious fresh fruit daily and fresh baked dolci at night (and much, much more), the St. Regis ranked in my top ten of best hotels ever. You get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bunny88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis in late August for two days. We wanted to see Rome before heading out on a 12 day cruise. The hotel met all of our expectations, luxurious, super service and good food. Concerning the service, I never would have expected this. Before leaving for an afternon of sight seeing, I mentioned to housekeeping that I thought the bed was a liitle hard. You can imagine how surprised I was when we returned to find that the mattress had been replaced with one that was just right. My wife and I were pleased with everything, the hotel staff was very pleasant and accomoodating. This is truly a 5 star hotel. This is also a superior location, easy walking distance to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. Another pleasant experience that happened was the doorman for the St. Regis introduced us to a car service that took us on a fabulous tour of Rome. We saw all the sites with our driver, Bob Agoslinelli. Bob speaks good english and knows the town. We went to many places that we would have never seen or know about Bob is a native of Rome and has a car service that is affiliated with the St. Regis. Bob also took us to the cruise terminal. Next time I'm in Rome I will definitely stay at the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay When In Rome”
Reviews.Author: cs35
Reviews.Content: I chose the St. Regis because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and wasn't disappointed. I stayed at the St. Regis in March. Everyone was very helpful and friendly even though I don't speak Italian. I had a standard room with two twin size beds. It was very clean and functional. Loved the bathroom. All marble. The hotel was extremely quiet. I felt like I had the hotel to myself most of the time. The housekeeping staff never woke me up. The restaurant was really enjoyable. The waiter very friendly and helpful. The desserts were beautiful and delicious. Definitely a hotel to stay at. I don't think anyone would be disappointed. The only negative was the location. It's a little far from the sites but most can be reached by bus (the Termini is only 10 minutes away by foot) or cab. There are a lot of great churches literally all around the St. Regis. Also lots of cafes. Check out the movie Three Coins in a Fountain, Plaza Republica is featured.

Reviews.Title: “Great palace at the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Oli-on-trip
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location only e few steps to next subway und about 10m to walk to the spanish steeps. Attentive und friendly personal. The rooms are very nice und realy silent. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, superb, superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Exceptionally helful staff. Room was excellent, facilities were wonderful, food was delicious. Definately one of the best hotels in Italy. Highly recommend and although expensive, you can see where the money goes.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service,Beautiful hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rwdtgb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, we just returned from a 3 night stay June 19-21.We booked on spg and and reserved an imperial room on the buttler floor. We arrived early at about 9:30am and our room was not ready so the gentlemen who was checking us in walked us over to the restaurant and had us enjoy the breakfast buffet on the house. We finished breakfast and the room wasn't ready so we stopped by the conceirge to make lunch reservations (a fantastic restaurant was recommended) as well as see if they could get a new recharger for my Italian cell phone.We headed out for sightseeing and lunch and upon our return a room was ready and there waiting for me was my recharger (no charge).We had a problem with our ac and after a few repairmen it was decided it couldn't be fixed anytime soon, so the buttler came in and packed us up and we were moved to great corner suite on the 3rd floor(overlooking Piazza Republica). We were not charge our first nights stay and they also brought us a bottle of wine as well as a cheese plate for the inconvenience.The service throughout the hotel was stellar and we will return on our next visit to Rome. The location was great you can walk to most sights about 15 to 20 minutes (it was in the 90's while we were there). We took cabs most places and the cost was 5 euros to most places, the Vatican was 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AJH
Reviews.Content: If you like old world class and charm then this is the hotel for you. It was the first hotel in Rome to have electricty so it dates from the late 1800s. From the time we arrived to the moment we left we had stellar service. Our room was not ready upon arrival (and I didn't expect it to be as it was 11 a.m.) but they kindly served us complimentary beverages in the waiting area and informed us 45 mins later it was ready. I was shocked at their attention to concern for travelers after a long, overnight journey! We celebrated our 15th anniversary at this hotel and a bottle of nice bubbly was in our room upon coming home the 1st night along with fresh fruit. This room has everything you'd need and turndown service is excellent and truly a 5 star. The breakfast buffet in the a.m. has every want, need and desire for anyone! I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and they knew it was a special occassion via my booking form but I doubt that they'd treat anyone less differently if they weren't one. I got the impression here that EVERY guest mattered. What shocked me after having stayed in a number of large cities around the world is to how quiet this hotel was. We heard no noises, talking, etc except for a few birds outside our window that faced a courtyard. Truly a relaxing retreat after a long and busy day. The restaurant has a talented chef and is well worth visiting along with a knowledgeable wine steward. You won't be disappointed with your stay here and truly will be transported back in time without loosing the modern comforts of the future. It is just close enough to the major sights but enough removed to feel some breathing room. We'll be back here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, I got married in this hotel and I could not say enough about the service and food it was 5 star plus. We had our wedding reception and they even made our cake free of charge...it was certainly a wedding to remember. They take all the hassle out of a wedding !

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DallasKathy
Reviews.Content: It is perfect..the staff professional.room beautiful........be sure and have room service for breakfast.lovely. No negatives. We are SPG also and perhaps this had some affect on the room we were given. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Genius-loci
Reviews.Content: I never stayed in a better hotel!!! I stayed ther for 2 nights last weekend, and I will remember this holiday forever! The service is excellent, we booked a junior suite, but we had a suite...enormous!!! The breakfast is a lunch at all, the restaurant is gorgeous, night service absolutely fantastic. In 5 minutes walking we arrived in via Veneto, Fontana di Trevi and Spanish steps are svery close..... If anybody looks for the best in Rome, St. Regis is the good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel; Better Location Would Have Made it Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 6 nights (4/22-4/28/05) at the St. Regis. Very hospitable staff, courteous and accommodating. All the staff that we were in contact with spoke fluent English. Delivered clementines to our room upon check-in. Also delivered Easter bread courtesy of the hotel on Easter. Room had sitting area with loveseat, desk, armoire with tv and minibar. Large bathroom especially for European hotels. Comfortable bedroom with second tv (great bonus since I was with my 16-year old daughter and did not wish to watch MTV whenever we were in the room). Wonderful blackout curtains for mornings when you need to sleep in. Hotel missed opportunity to remind guests with a card in the room or message on telephone of the time change in Italy which took place on March 27 (Easter). Our breakfast arrived an hour earlier than we thought we had requested it that day. If breakfast is not included in your stay, it can become pricey eating at the hotel each morning, and there is not much else in the area. Only complaint is the location. While it is near the Metro and Termini station (avoid area at night), I would have preferred being closer to either the Piazza Navona or the Spanish Steps. After walking all day while sightseeing, a short stroll would have been preferable to jumping in a cab or walking a good distance. Being a Starwood member, I think the Westin Excelsior is in a better location on the Via Veneto and is also across from Hard Rock if you are staying with a young person.

Reviews.Title: “The St Regis Grand - Grand Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: flants
Reviews.Content: The service was fabulous, the staff was extremely friendly, and our room was incredible!! After I checked in, I was walked to my room by a member of the front desk who asked me all the while if there was anything else we needed. The concierge was extremely helpful and gave great advice on restaurants. To be honest, I expected less, considering I walked in there looking like a bum off the street (when I travel, I travel comfortably!). We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but all other aspects of our stay were absolutely incredible. We are in the process of planning our return trip...

HotelInfo.Name: The St. Regis Rome
HotelInfo.Address: 3, Via Vittorio Emanuele Orlando, 00185 Rome, Italy
